loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.en:
Bahtiyor is a kind man, married, and the father of three children. He has a secondary education, and he has been involved in agriculture since 2004. He currently owns some sheep and some cows. Little by little over the years, he has developed the business. At first it was so difficult for him to feed cattle and to manage the business. His wife and children help him with managing the business. 

He has turned to IMON INTERNATIONAL and requested a loan of 8,000 somoni. He will use his loan to purchase four sheep for fattening and selling. 

He plans to reinvest the earnings from his loan into further increasing his livestock headcount.

loans.use: To buy four sheep for fattening and sale

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vinos y licores, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de vinos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar vinos. 


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues with her business selling wines and liquor.  She wants to get ahead through this business, and dreams of expanding the wine sales business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase wine.  She is happy to be receiving the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wine.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Hải -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền has a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell. Hiền is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 02 Thôn hải -Quảng Nham Solidarity Group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is lack of capital. With her business profits, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn Bắc- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Tân is 27 years old and she is married with two children. Tân is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Thôn Bắc- Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Tân has a stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. Tân has been involved in this business for more than ten years. This is Tân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Tân faces in her business are lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nhóm 01-Trần Phú-Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dậu operates a food stall selling vegetables. Dậu has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more processed vegetable to resell. 

Dậu is 56 years old, and she is married with 4 children. 

Dậu is the group leader of the Nhóm Nhóm 01-Trần Phú-Phú Sơn3  solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Dậu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dậu has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Dậu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her loan she will purchase more processed vegetables to resell. 

With her business profit, Dậu hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more processed vegetable to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn 4 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nhủ works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale.

Nhủ is 56 years old and she is single with two children. Nhủ is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn 4 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of three members. Nhủ lives with no dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Nhủ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhủ has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhủ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhủ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa, 27, operates a fishing business to earn an income. She catches fish and sells these to the people of her community. She has been engaged in this business for three years. In addition, she operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like sugar, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, and seasonings. Melissa lives with her family in Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband have one child, aged two years. Melissa  is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000. She will use the loan to buy an engine for a motorboat, a propeller, outrigger, and assorted groceries for the store. These materials will help Melissa to increase her fish catch and to fill her store with various stock, to attract more customers. Melissa hopes that someday, both of her businesses will expand, for the welfare of her growing child.

loans.use: to buy an engine for a motorboat, a propeller, outrigger, and assorted groceries for the store.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 8 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Luận works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Luận is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children. Luận is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 thôn 8 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. Her children came to adulthood ( over 18 years old) and they have jobs, so Luận supports no dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Luận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Luận has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Luận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Luận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Luận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en: Teofista, 63 years old, applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase housing materials for a house renovation so that they have a comfortable house to live in. She hopes to achieve this with Paglaum’s help. She is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday on her chosen business.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for a house renovation so that they have a comfortable house to live in

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bed room for his house.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, 52 years old, is married and a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold in the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years. 

Brenda wants to become more productive, so she decided to enter the business herself by purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. 

In October 2012, Brenda and her husband decided to join Paglaum MPC to avail loan to buy fishing nets. In addition to the financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed the additional benefits such as insurance and savings. 

Now she applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale to generate more income. She wishes that with Paglaum’s help, and the patience and diligence of her husband, she will be a successful vendor and someday will own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is a 21 year-old single farmer who cultivates potatoes and beans. It is clear that Elvin works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system he will improve his living conditions.

Elvin is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit him to have a better lighting, charge his cell phone, and save in traditional energy expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a home solar system

loans.name: Mujeres Franciscanas Group

texts.en:
The six women of this group live in the town of San Francisco in the Suchitepéquez region of Guatemala and have named their group after their town of which they are very proud. San Francisco is a picturesque old town where the people follow the old customs. The economy of the region is based mostly on the cultivation of coffee and bananas.

The members of this group have businesses such as catalog sales of cosmetics and lotions and shop selling items such as daily necessities, house-made sausage and  clothing. These are hard working, dedicated women eager to learn how to improve their businesses through the business training that Namaste will provide. They will receive classes in financial literacy and each will have a personal business advisor who will help her write a business plan and offer advice on how to grow her business to meet her goals.

One of the women in this group is Doña Aurora (first from left) who is 59, married and the mother of three grown children. She is a seamstress who makes high quality garments. Her husband is a retired teacher and she is the main support of her family. She makes wedding, fifteenth birthday and baptism dresses. Her work is of excellent quality and she is well know in her area and sells dresses through the country and even some internationally. She currently works out of her home and she hopes that with this opportunity she will be able to significantly grow her business. She will invest her loan money in more fabric and other items she needs to make more dresses. Her current monthly net profit is 6970 Guatemalan Quetzales. Her goal for this nine-month cycle is to increase her profit by 17%.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other items to make more dresses

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.en:
Last December, 11 women from the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Abril,” meaning “April,” received a loan from Friendship Bridge funded by Kiva investors. These much-needed loans were invested in micro-businesses, including the retail sales of beauty items, cleaning supplies, clothing and tortillas. One of the clients, Ingrid, had a convenience store. The 11 ladies are pleased to report that they have finished paying back their loan on time and in the full amount and are ready to take out another one. They are wonderful examples of women who through hard work and dedication, have raised their standard of living and face a brighter future.

Previously, Ingrid, 40-year-old was featured, who is divorced and the mother of five children. Ingrid needed a loan to purchase maize in quantity for her “tortilleria,” or tortilla shop, that she started just when she received her loan. Today, this hard-working woman is happy to report that the loan has been a huge help to her because she has increased her business, generated more income and improved life for herself and her family.

For this new loan cycle, Esly, 33-years-old and has two children is member of the group. Esly sells various different edible items including cereals, soups and sausages, as well as snacks called “refacciones” and beauty products. She needs financial capital to purchase inventory for her businesses to take advantage of the holidays and special events including Day of the Dead, graduations and the end of the year. 

Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus.” Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares pertinent information on topics that affects the women’s daily lives. Through role playing, games and drawings, the ladies learn about how to manage their small loans with information about budgeting, accounting, customer service, marketing and pricing. They learn to care for themselves and their families more effectively with seminars on nutrition, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. Finally, the members of the Trust Bank learn to have self-esteem and that they have a voice, even though they might not know how to read and write.

All of the women in the Trust Bank “Abril” send special greetings to Kiva investors throughout the world. They want to express their appreciation for the loans. They look forward to a brighter future as empowered women eliminating poverty!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her different business, including edible products and beauty products.

loans.name: Moiolam

texts.ru: Моиоламу 51 год. Она живет в городе Душанбе, вместе с дочерьми. Одна дочка работает в ресторане официанткой, другая дочка портниха. Миолам начинающая предпринимательница. Она приобрела точку продажи на рынке и хочет осуществить продажу. Миолам будет продавать овощи и сухофрукты. Она уже купила овощи, но не хватило денег на приобретения сухофруктов, таких как изюм, курага орехи и т.д. Миолам только начинает деятельность и хочет, чтоб ее бизнес процветал, с такими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите Миоламу в ее начинаниях. Она купить сухофрукты и заполнит свою прилавку.
texts.en: Moiolam is 51 years old. She lives in the city of Dushanbe with her two daughters. One of her daughters works in a restaurant as a waitress, the other is a seamstress.  Moiolam is a novice entrepreneur.  She has acquired a retail outlet at the market and wants to start selling merchandise.  She will be selling vegetables and dried fruits.  She has already bought some vegetables, but she doesn't have enough money to buy dried fruits such as raisins, dried apricots, nuts, etc.  She is just starting her new business and she is looking forward to seeing it prosper.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  Please support Moiolam in her endeavors. Your support will help her to buy dried fruits and stock her retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy dried apricots, nuts and raisins, so that she can start selling dried fruits.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 25-year-old single man who opened a lathe workshop four years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family, which consists of four members.

Today, Hasan is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand his business through buying necessary lathe tools. This will facilitate his work and allow him to provide better service for his customers. 

Hasan hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary lathe tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, who is married, is known in their neighbourhood area for being a hardworking mother. Milagros is receiving a monthly pension for her retirement. 

Milagros became a member of PMPC and is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably in a decent house for which she has applied a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. 

Milagros hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful that all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for a decent and comfortable living space for the family

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business with her husband Radden for more than 12 years now. They also earn an additional income through fishing.

Angie is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, chains and others.

In the future, Angie hopes to make her business a success

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, chains and others.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 24 years old and single. Due to a lack of job opportunities, she engages in cooking hamburgers within the town proper. She aims to continue and improve this business to earn a higher income and support her parents in sustaining their necessities. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI, amounting to PHP 7,000 to buy more burgers, bread, sauces, hot dogs, cheese, soft drinks and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell. She is hoping that she will further improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more burgers, bread, sauces, hot dogs, cheese, soft drinks and other ingredients needed.

loans.name: Lucy Marilene

texts.es:
Lucy Marilene tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Lucy Marilene se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de una cantidad mayor de aniamales, asi como variedad de estos; dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar su inventario de animales. Lucy Marilene tiene gran influencia en el negocio y piensa mejorar productividad y diversidad de animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucy Marilene tiene is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She and her family live in a rural zone in the Oyotún District, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Basically her entire community works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.

Lucy Marilene makes her living raising and trading animals and she has more than five years of experience in the business. Her business is located in the back of her home.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more animals and a greater variety of animals. This investment will help Lucy Marilene to increase inventory of animals. Lucy Marilene has a lot of influence in the business and she plans to improve productivity and diversity of animals to be able to attend to the diverse wants and needs of her customers in the region. This will permit her to improve her income and increase her earnings in the short run and improve her family's quality of life in the long run.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of animals

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is a young farmer and mother of three children (her eldest son is 17-years old). Arevik and her family live in Aragats village. After she got married, Arevik started a farming business. In the greenhouse near their home, Arevik and her husband cultivate cucumbers, cabbage and some greens. The gathered harvest they sell in local markets and gather income for their family's living.
 
To be ready for the winter season, Arevik needs to make some improvement in her greenhouse. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse, and fertilizer (10 packages). The whole family will be very grateful to Kiva lenders if they support this family's small farm. 

As this is Arevik's first loan it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse and 10 packages of fertilizer

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa lives in Ozamiz City. She is a widow and supports her only daughter by vending snacks near schools. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and recently, took another loan which she used to buy flour, sugar, milk, etc for snack vending business. 

She wants her daughter to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, etc for snack vending business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 26, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicanor, a city coordinator. They both work to support their daily needs and to save for their planned parenthood.

Liza has a backyard piggery and has raised hogs for two years already. Investing in a piggery is a good and profitable business, as female pigs conceive twice in a year and can produce as many as 12 piglets each time. They can be sold either to cook "lechon" (roasted pig) or to the town market for meat. She also sells jewelry pieces on the side. She earns a minimum of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

To help her grow her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan, which she will use to buy more feeds and clean grain for her pigs, and some jewelry items as well. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Liza hopes for her piggery and jewelry businesses to grow and aims to have her own stall. She prays to have a baby soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for clean grain, feeds for her hog and some jewelry pieces to sell.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru: Зеби жительница сельской местности. Зеби замужем и имеет троих детей. Все дети у Зеби  самостоятельные и каждый живет отдельно. Сама зеби с малых лет занимается земледелием и очень любит свою деятельность. Так как Зеби родилась и выросла в селе она не имеет высшего образование, устроиться на достойную работу не имея образования очень сложно.  Как говорит сама Зеби ей достаточно того, что она имеет возделывая землю и получая урожай. На данный момент у Зеби возникли финансовые трудности и она решила обратится в «Арванд» за финансовой помощью. Так как сейчас цена на урожай резко упала, она не может продать свой урожай и закупить посевы для будущего урожая. Зеби решила взять кредит и купить посевы. Зеби рада, что существуют такие организации, которые помогают жителям сельских местностей в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Zebi lives in the countryside.  She is married and the mother of three children who are all independent and have left home already.  Zebi has been working in agriculture since she was very young and she loves this activity.  Since she was born and raised in a village, she doesn't have a higher education and getting a decent job without an education is very difficult.  But as she says, she is content with working the land and getting a harvest.  At the moment though, she is having some financial difficulties, which is the reason why she has decided to turn to MDO Arvand, LLC for financial support.  Crop prices are very low right now, so Zebi cannot count on her earnings from her harvest to buy seeds toward a future harvest.  For this reason, she has decided to take a loan to buy seeds.  She is happy that there are such organizations, which provide assistance to rural residents when they are facing difficult times.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Qoshqar

texts.en:
Qoshqar is 24 years old and married with a son. They are refugees and live in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) settlement. His wife is a housekeeper.   Qoshqar has been raising and selling fruits for four years and has good skill in this area. His monthly salary is 130 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat).

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year. People like to eat it fresh, and this is one of the main desserts for guests. Qoshqar's shop is located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits. 

Qoshqar wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover, as well as to improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a 1,200 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 67-year-old hardworking woman who adds additional income to support her family. She is blessed with five children. Beth has been selling paraffin for a period of five years, earning her an income of 8,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Beth is now servicing her second loan of 15,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy more paraffin to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Beth plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to further their education to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy more paraffin to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mukkaram

texts.en:
Mukkaram is a 55-year-old refugee. He is married and has a son and two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and they live in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. 

Mukkaram earns money for his family by raising up seasonal fruits (apples, pears, cherries, quince, etc.). He has been working in this area for 20 years and has good experience in this. His monthly income is 220 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat).
 
Fresh fruits are in high demand and people buy them very often. They use fruits to prepare jam for tea, fruit pies, juice, etc. They buy them from Mukkaram  because his fruits are always fresh and tasty.

The region where Mukkaram lives is very severe and after almost every winter, it’s hard for him to get a good harvest. This reduces his income. He applied for 1,200 AZN in order to buy new, good fertilizers and build a greenhouse for trees. Let’s help Mukkaram and make his life easier.

loans.use: to buy new, good fertilizers and build a greenhouse for trees

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a hard working entrepreneur from Busuanga Palawan, Philippines. He is 60 years old, married to Evelyn, and has six children,of which two is already working. He catches and sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Fishing is one of the common sources of income in the Philippines since most of the folks are living near seashore lines. Among them is Rafael. First thing in the morning, he prepares his fishing tools and accessories like nets, rod holders, bait prep and tanks, grippers, knives and more. After hours of bearing the scorching heat of the sun, he would go back to the shore with other fishers with their nets full of tons of freshly-caught fish. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of the freshness and cleanliness. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 3000 in sales every week.

Rafael needs to add more tools and equipment for fishing. That is why he is taking out a PHP 10,000 loan to continue operations of his business. He will be utilizing the loan to improve his service and to be able to catch more fish, which is necessary to increase his profit.

In the future, he wants to give his family a better life and a stable source for living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment he needs when catching fish.

loans.name: Living

texts.en:
Living is a 24-year-old male Ugandan married to Sanyu, with whom he has two children who have not started school. They are residents of Kanyabebe trading centre.

Living is a produce dealer, which is his major business alongside the growing of rice. He has been doing these activities since 2011 in order to earn a living and plan for his family.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy corn and beans that he will transport to the city and sell at a profit. His dream is to expand his business and acquire more land. He thanks the Kiva lenders for partnering with him to achieve his dream.

He faces challenges of price fluctuations and bad roads.

loans.use: To buy dry corn, beans and millet

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Fatima  está en su ciclo número 3º  del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza, lo que quiere decir que ella en especial debe  esforzarse un poco más para ir creciendo poco a poco.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien  está recibiendo capacitaciones que le permitirá poder ir creciendo y mejorando un poco más cada día. Ella es la presidenta del grupo, una persona muy ejemplar y luchadora. Es vendedora de comidas, por lo tanto el préstamo que ella pide es para la compra de carnes, harinas, leche, huevo para la elaboración de sus comidas, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: The group "Virgen de Fatima" is in its third loan cycle with the Poverty Elimination Program, in which one member is below the poverty line. In other words, she should do a bit more so that she can grow little by little. One of its members is Maria, who is receiving training that will allow her to keep growing and improving a little more each day. She is the president of the group, an exemplary and hardworking person. She sells prepared meals. Therefore, the loan she is requesting is to buy meats, flours, milk, eggs, in order to prepare her meals, among other things.

loans.use: to buy meats, flours, milk, eggs in order to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro de 56 años de edad habita en vivienda propia y su hijo de 30 años de edad y su pequeña nieta de 9 años de edad. Isidro trabaja como recolector de basura en su comunidad y así lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su hijo mantienen la economía familiar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda y para construir una galera para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Isidro, 56 years old, lives in his own house with his 30-year-old son and his small 9-year-old granddaughter. Isidro works as a garbage collector in the community, and in this way sustains his household and, along with his son, maintains the family economy. With the desire to improve his living conditions, he asks FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials to cement the floor of the outdoor corridor of the house and to build a shed, for which he will need materials such as cement, sand, galvanized metal sheeting and wood.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, galvanized metal sheeting, and wood to cement the floor of the outdoor corridor of the house and build a shed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 2, es un grupo relativamente nuevo, que está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marta, quien esta en un nivel medio de ingresos, ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de la venta de carbón, y por medio de ello tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora. 
La Sra. solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bolsas de papel para su carbón, y carbón en cantidad, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its second cycle.  It is a relatively new group.  They are participating in a survey of poverty elimination so that they are all familiar with one another's situation and are able to work.

Marta is one of the members.  Her income is at the middle level.  She devotes herself to the humble work of selling charcoal.  It is through this work that she has earnings in order to be able to help her family and her loved ones.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising person.

She is requesting this loan to buy paper bags for the charcoal and to buy charcoal in volume.  This will help her to cement her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy paper bags for the charcoal and to buy charcoal in volume.

loans.name: Genny Marlene

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, de 24, 22, 17 y 14 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y los menores en  colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Genny es una muy buena esposa que  realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice, el tiene un taxi en el cual se gana el sustento de su familia, el trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 en la ciudad de Manta, solo trabaja hasta esta hora por los peligros que hay en la ciudad y para evitar robos, trabaja hasta esta hora con lo cual se gana lo suficiente para salir adelante, el lleva con esa profesión más de 20 años.
Este crédito lo van a emplear para varios arreglos que necesita el taxi y así brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le Gusta porque con los créditos ella ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños son tener un taxi nuevo.
texts.en:
The “Montecristi” communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi. The canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its craftwork, which is recognized on a national and international level. It is famous for its Panama hats.

Genny lives here. She is 43 years old and married. She has four children, aged 24, 22, 17 and 14. The two eldest are at university and the younger ones are in high school. Her husband is a driver.

Genny is a very good wife who is taking out the loan so that her husband can use it. He has a taxi, which is how he earns money to support his family. He works every day from 6:00am to 8:00pm in the city of Manta. He only works until 8:00pm because of the dangers in the city and to avoid being robbed. He earns enough to get ahead in life by working until this hour. He has been doing this work for more than 20 years.

Genny and her husband are going to use the loan to do some necessary repair work on the taxi so they can provide a better service. Genny has been in the communal bank for six years and she likes it because she can use the loans to help her husband. Her dream is to have a new taxi.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crabs and fresh fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing net and materials for boat renovation like plywood, nails, paint and epoxy (glue).

loans.name: Noely

texts.es:
Noely tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa de sus padres, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Noely se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros), hace 04 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea invertir en la compra de patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes; para poder diversificar y aumentar el stock de sus animales; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satisfacer las diversas necesidades y gustos de sus clientes. Lo que en un corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noely is 25 years old, single and has two children who are dependent on her. She lives in her parent's house in a rural part of the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. Her community is mainly engaged in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Noely has been working raising and selling farm animals (ducks, guinea pigs, pigs, etc.) for 4 years. Her business is located behind her house. She is requesting a loan to have working capital as she wants to invest in the purchase of ducks, chickens, turkeys and guinea pigs. She wants to diversify and increase her stock of animals. The loan will help her have a better variety of animals with the goal of expanding her business and satisfy the differing tastes and needs of her clients. In the short term she will increase her income, improve her profits and in the end improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy ducks, chickens, turkeys and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es: Lizeth  de 29 años de edad habita en un municipio cerca de la ciudad, donde comercializa accesorios femeninos, artículos variados calzado, blusas etc.  Su negocio inició desde hace 3 años, , siguiendo su aptitud comercial, ya que desde muy niña mostró inclinación hacia el emprendimiento. Con el apoyo de su hermana inició su negocio con un pequeño capital, que poco a poco ha crecido y hoy quiere hacerlo crecer, vendiendo cada vez más blusas, calzado, accesorio y calzado directamente trabajando desde  las 8 de la mañana hasta 8 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza de contado a proveedores que le ofrecen los mejores precios y vende en su vecindad, donde ya es reconocida. Las metas de su negocio están relacionadas con el aumento de sus inventarios, pero su mayor desafío es que no ha encontrado fuentes de financiación a su medida. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios, chancletas, blusas etc, con el fin de lograr mayores ventas pues invirtiendo su credikiva en mercancías, tiene un mas amplio inventario, lo cual mejora su negocio.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 29 years old and lives in a municipality close to the city where she sells woman's accessories. a variety of footwear, blouses etc. She started her business three years ago following her commercial abilities. She has shown an inclination for business since she was quite young. With the help of her sister she started her business with a small amount of capital and little by little has grown selling ever more blouses footwear and accessories. She works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She makes her purchase in cash from suppliers who offer the best prices and sells in her area.

The goals of her business are related to her inventory. Her main challenge is that she has not found suitable sources of financing. This is the reason that she is requesting a loan from Kiva, the first loan that she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, She will use it to buy accessories, flip-flops, blouses, etc. with the goal of having more sales. She will invest the loan from Kiva in order to have a larger inventory which will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories, sandals, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy staples (rice, oil, sugar, beans, meat, and canned goods)

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Basiru, Yau and Hassan. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Ibrahim expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Ibrahim to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Ibrahim said: "I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his graduation and postgraduate fees

loans.name: Hanatu

texts.en:
Hanatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hanatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Istifanus, Promise and Gedion. Hanatu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Hanatu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hanatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Hanatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Hanatu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Hanatu said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make a farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Vichra

texts.en:
Vichra is a 21-year-old student at an institute. She lives with her parents in Kratie Province of Cambodia. 

Due to a shortage of financial support, Vichra would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate successfully. 

In the future, she is going to find a good job at any private or public institution.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is 47 years old. He lives in an IDP settlement with his wife and two sons. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. Mehman has earned money for the family by working as a butcher for 22 years. People address him when they need to cut cow or sheep meat properly. He gets for this 200 AZN monthly.
 
Butchery is one of the oldest and most prevalent professions. Azerbaijan cuisine is very famous and various. There are a lot of different delicious dishes from meat. Some of the recipes require meat to be specially cut. In these cases most people refer to butchers. Mehman is the most famous butcher in his region. Many restaurants’ chefs know him and prefer his butchery.

Being IDPs makes Mehman ’s family’s life hard. He can’t provide his children with education and isn’t able to cover demands. He applied for a loan of 1200 AZN in order to buy new butchery tools and new supplies for his small business. He wants to buy new butchery tables and make his butchery shop wider.

loans.use: to buy new butchery tools and new supplies for his small business.

loans.name: Segundo Tomas

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive don Segundo, el tiene 59 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, los menores estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
El señor Segundo es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta a base de trabajo sacar adelante a su familia, el se dedica a la venta de pescado, se  desplaza en la madrugada hasta la ciudad de Manta lugar en el cual compra el mejor  pescado para luego embarcarlo en un carro que alquila y llevar a vender el pescado en Montecristi y sectores vecinos donde tiene muchos clientes , el entrega al por mayor a comerciantes en ciertos lugares,  lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 30 años con la cual saca adelante a su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar pescado. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace más de 4 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its famous Panama hats. It has a cool climate and there are many natural tourist attractions in the area.

Segundo lives here. He is 59 years old and married. From his marriage, he has four grown-up children. The younger ones are in high school. His wife is a housewife.

Segundo is a very hard-working man who likes to support his family with his work. He makes a living by selling fish. He travels to the city of Manta in the early morning to buy the best fish, pack it into the car he rents, and go and sell it in Montecristi and the neighbouring areas where he has many clients. He delivers wholesale to shopkeepers in certain places. He has been doing this work for more than 30 years and it is how he supports his family.

He is going to invest this loan in buying fish. He has been with the communal bank for more than four years and he likes it due to the help they offer him through loans for getting ahead in life. His dream is to buy a car for his fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 40, and a resident of Busuanga, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a Seaman, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day. Aside from her variety store, she also manage a direct selling business and their tricycle unit for transportation services.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Gina dreams to grow her business and likewise her profit. She wants to give her children a better future, which is why she provides for their needs in their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is a 24-year-old single gardener. He is a refugee and lives with his parents in an IDP settlement. The main source of income for the family is raising and selling seasonal vegetables (cucumber, onion, greens and etc.). This brings him 180 AZN monthly but he also gets additional earnings working as a laborer in his free time. Raising vegetables is very popular in Azerbaijan because people have high demand in fresh vegetables. They use these products to prepare delicious fresh salads and national dishes. 

Nurlan’s parents are old and they need good care but this isn’t possible with a small income. So Nurlan wants to increase productivity and income, and provide his parents with a good life, because it’s very hard for refugees to pay for medicines. He applied for 1200 AZN in order to buy new, good fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy new, good fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria y su cónyuge  antes de iniciar su negocio en el año 2009, recibió asesoría de su primo quien también tenia una vidriería. Su primo conoce muy bien este oficio y e enseñó ha elaborar muchos productos y hoy fabrica vitrinas, pupitres, mesas y todo cuanto su cliente solicita y que le venden desde un local ubicado en el centro del municipio donde habita. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito  durante todos los días y en su taller trabajan desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, comprando a proveedores especializados en los insumos que los utilizan. Su meta es tener un taller amplio, reconocido  y apoyar a su hijo  de 24 años, para que potencialmente sea exitoso.  En la actualidad Maria está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vidrios, tornillería y aluminio, en un mayor volumen, aprovechando la oferta promocional del proveedor que le da ventajas competitivas y hace que su negocio mejores sustancialmente.
texts.en: Before starting their business in 2009, Maria and her spouse got advice from her cousin who has a glass business.  Her cousin knows this trade very well and taught her how to make many products.  Today she makes display cabinets, desks, tables, and whatever her customers request, and sells them from a location in the center of town where she lives.  She conducts her sales in cash and on credit, and she works in her shop from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. She buys from suppliers who specialize in materials that she uses.  Her goal is to have a well-recognized, spacious workshop, and to support her 24 year old son so that he has potential for success.  Currently, Maria is applying for a Credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Through this loan, she will purchase glass, screws, and aluminum in large volume, making the most of the supplier’s promotional offer which will give her a competitive advantage, and make her business substantially better.

loans.use: to purchase glass, screws, and aluminum in large volume.

loans.name: Vilayat

texts.en:
Vilayat, a 21-year-old father of one son, is a refugee living with his family in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housewife who raises their son, while Vilayat  is a farmer who has has been breeding cows and selling hay for two years. He fattens his livestock and then sells milk and meat at the local bazaar. 

Cattle breeding is widespread in Azerbaijan due to high demand for milk and meat. People like to drink milk every morning and when feeling ill, and use meat to prepare delicious national dishes. 

Because Vilayat’s income doesn’t cover all of the family’s needs, he is requesting a loan for 1200AZN to buy additional cattle and build a stable for his cows. He plans to increase his income and provide his little son a good education and bright future because he loves his family very much.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle and build a stable for his cows

loans.name: Sr. De Ccoyllority Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE CCOYLLORITY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen ella es soltera y tiene 66 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hotel, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de hotel.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sr. de Ccoyllority Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Carmen, 66, is single and has one child.  She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. in her restaurant business preparing a variety of dishes: chicken with potatoes, soups, and stir-fried meat.  She has 10 years of experience in this business and it's going very well for her.  Carmen's dream is to expand her restaurant business.

She's requesting the loan to buy products to cook, including chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The members who are attached to the photo had permission to have their photo taken after the meeting because of work.  The other members earn a living in a hotel business, selling clothing, a grocery store, and a hotel business.

Carmen's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as chicken, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep his food.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen de 19 años, está estudiando para certificarse en administración de farmacias, su abuela una mujer de negocios le propuso organizarse en un punto e iniciar el comercio de medicinas; ella siguió la propuesta de su abuela, pues en su familia es una actividad que comúnmente realizan y por eso practicarla, no es ajeno a Karen, pues desde muy pequeña, ha tenido relación con este tipo de negocios. Hace 2 años lo emprendió y todos los  días trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, su meta mas adelante es tener varios puntos de ventas y finalmente comprar su propia vivienda y continuar estudiando para sacarle el máximo provecho a su negocio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará medicinas y accesorios femeninos, con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, pues tendrá un fondo de efectivo para surtirlo con medicinas, que usualmente se sus clientes compran después de las fiestas por mucha bebida y comida y también comprará mercancías ajustadas a la temporada de navidades y de año nuevo, temporada que las familias esperan, para lucir su mejor imagen, resaltada por los accesorios y prendas que encuentran en la farmacia y miscelanea de Karen.
texts.en:
Karen, 19 years old, is studying for a certification in pharmacy management. Her grandmother, a business woman, proposed that she organize herself to a point and start the trade of medicines. She followed her grandmother’s proposition. In her family, it is a business that they often carry out. That is why doing it is not foreign to Karen since from a young age she has had a relationship with this type of business. She set about this 2 years ago and works everyday from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. Her goal is to later on have various outlets and eventually to buy her own home and continue studying to draw the maximum benefit from her business.

She is currently applying for a credikiva, the first financing she is doing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy medicine and feminine products. With this investment her business will improve since she will have a cash base to restock medicines that she knows her customers usually buy after the festivals for having drank and eaten too much. She will also buy merchandise suitable for the Christmas and New Year’s season. A season that families await to flaunt their best image, highlighted by the accessories and garments that can be found at Karen’s pharmacy and miscellaneous.

loans.use: to buy medicine and feminine products.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan is a 54-year-old married farmer with five children, living in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has cultivated rice and fattened animals since 1983. Her husband is 57 and also a farmer. All of her children are garment factory workers. Together, they can earn approximately $28 a day. Now Yan would like to request a loan to buy lumber to build a house for her child who has just married. This loan will help her build a house for her child. In the future, she is going to buy piglets to fatten and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house for her child.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 71 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa no tiene hijos menores, vive en el Caserío Huancas. El caserío donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias de él tanto personales como laborales. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Pedro es vender productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros), tiene su pequeña bodega desde hace 6 años, su negocio se encuentra en su mismo domicilio. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en su bodega, ya que desea tener mayor variedad y cantidad de productos para poder atender todos los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 71 years old.  He lives in his own home made of rudimentary materials along with his wife.  They have no minor children.  They live in the Huancas rural settlement.  This settlement is in a small rural area where the residents all know each other and are able to give personal as well as work references.  In Pedro's community, most people work in agriculture, livestock production or commerce.  This settlement is located in the Querocotillo district of Cutervo province, in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Pedro has a business selling consumer staple goods, (rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other items), from the small store that he has owned for 6  years.  His business is located in his house.  Pedro will use this loan to invest in his store, because he wants to have a greater variety and quantity of products to meet the tastes and preferences of his customers.  In the short run, this will allow him to increase his profits and earnings so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in products for his store

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Lawal joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Idris, Kamal and Jimada. Lawal is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Lawal expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Lawal to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Lawal said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make a farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married with three children; all of them attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her kids.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetics shop. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 39-year-old married mother of one child. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she decided two years ago to sell linens and clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.
 
Today, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new winter collection of clothes and linens, to attract more customers and satisfy their needs. Layla is working hard to expand her business, as she hopes to open her own clothes and linens shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new winter collection of clothes and linens.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en:
Lutfiya is a 56-year-old woman. She is widowed and has two children. Her business is selling furniture.

She is enterprising, strong, a fighter, persevering, responsible, and very hard working. She does her work in the area of central Tajikistan. She has a furniture shop where she sells a variety of furniture. She buys furniture from China and sells it in her shop. She tries to offer high quality furniture for her customers. 

Lutfiya works alone, and she works hard to earn a living and provide a good living standard for her two children. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy furniture to resell. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Aurora Piedad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Aurora,  tiene 67 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, una  de sus hijas viven con ella con su familia ya que está casada. 
Doña Aurora es una mujer muy luchadora que le he tocado muy duro para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale todas las mañanas por la localidad ofreciendo sus prendas las mismas que deja a crédito y que cobra por semanas, también vende en su casa lugar al cual llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta profesión con  la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Maria Del Carmen" meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, the place where the famous Panama straw hats are made. The city has a mild climate and many natural tourist attractions that are unique to the area. 

In this place lives Aurora who is 67 years old. Her husband passed away some years ago, but she has 7 children from this relationship who are all adults. One of her daughters lives with her along with her family, since she is married.

Aurora is a very hard-working woman who has had a very tough time moving ahead. She makes a living in commerce, selling clothes of all types. She makes her sales door-to-door. She sets out every morning and sells her garments throughout the community. She sells on credit and collects on a weekly basis. She also sells from her home; her customers go there when they need a garment. She has been doing this for over 10 years, and this is how she moves forward.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing of all types. She has been a member of the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes being a part of it because the loans help her move forward. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Miriam Rosario

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian,  tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 4 hijos de 21, 18, 16 y 9 años  de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela, ella vive en casa de la mama. 
Doña Miriam es una mujer muy luchadora que le he tocado muy duro para sacar adelante a sus  hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y varios artículos que estén de moda, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale todos los días por las mañanas aprovechando que a esa hora es más fresco y encuentra a sus clientes, ella deja su mercadería a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 4 años con este negocio el cual lo empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo y que le permiten sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos de todo tipo. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le da para vivir. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton, location of the famous Panama hats.  The city has a cool climate, and there are many natural tourist attractions in the region.  

Miriam lives in this place.  She is 40 years old, and her husband died several years ago.  She has four children, ages 21, 18, 16, and 9, from this marriage.  The two youngest are in Primary and Secondary school, and she lives in her mother’s house.   

Miriam is a strong woman that has worked very hard to get her children ahead.  She is engaged in business, selling all types of clothing, shoes, and various fashionable items door-to-door.  She goes out to meet her customers every day in the morning, taking advantage of the cooler weather at this hour.  She leaves her merchandise on credit and collects payments every eight days.  She has been in this business, which she started with one of the loans she received from the group, for four years and this allows her to get her children ahead.

This loan is for the purchase of all types of clothing and shoes. She has been with the communal bank since its inception, and she is pleased with it because she started her business with one of the loans, which has enabled her make her living.   Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids. 

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years, her potential customers mostly being ladies. In addition, she also operates a retail shop business which earns her other source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase hair dryer machines for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair dryer machines for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Areli Brillid

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Areli, tiene 20 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre y  fruto de la misma tienen una hija de  2 años de edad. Su marido es albañil.
Doña Areli es una joven  mujer que le gusta trabajar y con sus ganancias ayudarle a su marido con los gastos sobre todo los que ocasiona la crianza de  su hija que es lo más importante para ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de dos años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella se ayuda en su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The Maria del Carmen Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for the famous, shawl straw hats.  It is city with a mild climate and with many tourist attractions in the zone.
Areli, 20, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law marriage, the fruit of which is her two-year-old daughter.  Her husband is a mason.
Areli is a young woman who likes to work and with her earnings help her husband with the expenses, above all those associated with the raising of her daughter which is most important for her.  She makes a living selling clothes of all kinds.  She sells door-to-door and also from her house where her best-known customers come.  She sells on credit to her customers and collects every two weeks.  She has more than two years doing this with which she earns something for the welfare of her family.
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.  She has four cycles in the credit group and she likes it because in this way she helps herself in her business.  Her dream is to give the best to her little one.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mariela Vanessa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señorita Mariela, tiene 23 años de edad,  está soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Lleva más de tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado salir adelante.
Doña Mariela para obtener ingresos y con estos ayudarles a sus padres ya que son de escasos recursos se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por horas, no cuenta con horarios fijos ya que es un trabajo el cual lo realiza cuando puede y cuando sus clientas le llamen, ella también vende en su casa, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 3 años el cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo.
Este nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Sus sueños son tener algún día un local.
texts.en:
The Maria del Carmen Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, the place of the famous, shawl straw hats.  It is a city with a mild climate and many tourist attractions in the zone.
Mariela, 23, lives in this place.  She is single and lives in her parents' house.  She has been in the credit group for three years and she likes it because the loans have always helped her get ahead.
Mariela makes a living in business in order to get income and help her parents who have scarce resources.  She sells clothing of all kinds.  She sells door-to-door.  She works every day for hours.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule since this is work that you do when you can and when the customers call her.  She also sells out of the house.  She sells on credit to her customers and collects every eight days.  For three years, she has been doing this, which she started with a loan she received from the group.
This new loan is for buying clothing of all types.  Her dream is to have her own shop someday.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married, and has children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her two children.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit and vegetables selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ummi

texts.en:
Ummi is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Ummi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ummi operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood and charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bulus, Yohanna and Zafaniya. Bala is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Bala expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Bala to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Bala said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make a farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en:
Rabo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rabo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Peice, Bilha and Regina. Rabo is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Rabo expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Rabo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Rabo to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Rabo said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make a farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 36 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge; tiene un hijo en su poder de 5 años de edad, el cual está en el Pronoí del caserío La Unión del distrito Santo Tomas; Oscar vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso en la parte rural de caserío La Unión; mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su caserío y del distrito. Oscar es natural de caserío La Unión. Oscar cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona.
