Su vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Oscar es la agricultura, cultivo de café a la fecha de la visita cliente tiene 2 hectareas. Variedad catimor en producción, plantación tiene 3 y 4 años de edad, cuenta con experiencia en cultivo de café hace 4 años. Cultivo lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío La Unión, su producto lo vende en Distrito Santo Tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente Oscar se dedica a la cria de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes,patos, chanchos y otros) los cuales comercializa los días domingos en plaza plaza del distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de parcela de 2 hectareas, comprandole abonos, fertilizantes entre otros para poder asegurar su campaña con una mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015, obteniendo ingresos para así mejorar de calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old and has a stable home with his wife. He has 5 year old son. They live in the La Union area of Santo Tomas district. Oscar lives in his own home made of rustic materials in the rural area of La Union. He has good relationships with people who live in the immediate area and district. Oscar was born in La Union. He has good personal and business references from the area. His home has water service and is located in Santo Tomas district, Cutervo district, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. His community primarily works in agriculture, livestock and business.

Oscar farms, growing coffee. At the moment he has 2 hectares. He has been planting the catimor variety for 3-4 years. He has been planting coffee for 4 years. He grows the crop on his own land in La Union, and takes his product to Santo Tomas where the buyers are located. In addition, Oscar raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and more) that he sells on Sundays in the Santo Tomas district plana in Cutervo. The loan will be used to maintain his 2 hectare parcel, buying manure, fertilizer, and other items to ensure his growing season is successful and has good yield in 2015, resulting in income to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his 2 hectare parcel of land by buying manure, fertilizer, and other items.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is a thirty-three-year-old married man with three children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa buying and selling. He used the previous loan to buy a generator to curb the problem of electricity which used to disappear most times, making him lose customers in his salon. He hopes to construct a permanent house. He is affected by seasonality in trading but works hard to maintain his business. He wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ishaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child, Jamima. Ishaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Ishaya expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Ishaya to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Ishaya said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my child is educated and is able to get a professional job."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make a farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika resides in Tajikistan where she has been busy with a business deal. Malika began this business 17 years ago when she needed money. She sells a variety of food items. Malika at first had opened a little store and with the passing of the time she has developed the business. Now, she has a food shop and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With the Kiva loan, Malika will purchase flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soaps to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and improve the living conditions for son as she is widowed and is the only breadwinner for her children.

loans.use: to buy food items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 51 years old, married and has four children. She buys and re-sells rice to the people in their village. She only gains minimal income so she hopes to increase it by selling more sacks of rice. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more sacks of rice to sell. From this, she will gain more profits to be use for the family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 73 años de edad, está casada y fruto de  esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, su esposo no  trabaja por motivos de salud. 
Doña Carmen se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y batas de dormir, vende en su localidad y en ciertos días se desplaza a campos cercanos, lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante junto a su querido esposo. 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito pues es la manera que ella tiene para poder comprar su mercadería y así salir adelante, lo que se gana es  para comprar los alimentos y medicinas que ella y su esposo necesitan y gracias a los créditos pueden solventar estos gastos. Este crédito es para comprar ropa y batas de dormir. Está en el Grupo de Crédito hace más de 8  años y le gusta por la ayuda que  le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que su marido mejore.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso" (Hope and Progress) meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its art, which is recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous Panama straw hats.

In this place lives Carmen who is 73 years old and married. From this relationship she has four children who are all adults.Two of them still live at home. Her husband does not work for health reasons.

Carmen makes a living in commerce, selling clothing of all types as well as nightgowns. She sells at her house and on certain days she travels to nearby fields. She has been doing this for over 20 years, and this is how she supports herself and her dear husband.

She is requesting another loan, for this is the way that she is able to buy her merchandise and, therefore, move forward. She uses what she earns to buy the food and medicine that she and her husband need. Thanks to the loans, they are able to afford these expenses. She will use this loan to buy clothes and nightgowns. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 8 years, and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Her dreams are to move forward and for her husband to get better.

loans.use: to buy clothes and nightgowns.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is fifty years old and married, with ten children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Nelson operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for five years. He is also a farmer, dealing in crop production and livestock farming to get additional sources of income. Nelson has a dream of constructing a permanent house for his business and educating his children. Nelson is faced with the challenges of high transport costs and bad debtors. Nelson is so hard working and wants money to buy soap, books, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap, books, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Santos Heraldo

texts.es:
Santos Heraldo tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; en una zona rural del distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Santos Heraldo se dedica a brindar servicio de albañileria; desde hace 15 años, sus servicio lo realiza en su caserío y alrededores. Él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; pues desea realizar la compra de herramientas como son tablas, repisas, estantes, entre otros, para guardar sus herramientas de trabajo esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes, además de darle un valor agregado a este. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Heraldo is 39 years old. He lives with his partner and two children in their family home. They live in a rural area of the Nueva Arica district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. For the most part, his community works in farming, livestock breeding, and commerce.

For the past 15 years, Santos Heraldo has worked as a bricklayer in his village and the surrounding areas. He is requesting a loan to invest in tangible assets; he wants to purchase supplies such as planks, shelves, etc. to store his work tools. Then he will be able to provide better service to his customers, and it will give his business other added value, so he can improve his earnings in the short term, increase his profit, and in the end, improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase brick-laying tools

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 55 years old, and an IDP. She is married, and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. Her husband helps his wife earning money as a laborer. Maryam raises fruits and vegetables in her garden and sells them at local bazaar. That is Maryam’s business, and she has working in this area for 25 years. Her monthly income is 230AZN.

People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper.  People know that such products are always fresh and healthy; they are not grown with different pesticides and are not harmful. During long years of experience, Maryam learned how to cover the customers demands.  So, selling fruits and vegetables from houses is popular and cheaper for people to buy them in bazaars than in big markets.

Her income doesn’t allow covering demands. She is planning to expand her garden and grow more seasonal fruits and vegetables. 

Maryam wants her sons to get a higher education and have a good life. She applied for 1500AZN .

loans.use: to expand her garden and grow more seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Monserrate Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, la menor  estudia en Universidad, dos de sus hijos viven en su casa.  Su esposo es maestro albañil.
Doña Monserrate es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella lava ropa ajena pero también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja los fines de semana  en sus recorridos y también vende en su casa, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho  días, lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y con esto ha podido ayudarle a su hija para que siga en sus estudios.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal loan group "Esperanza y Progreso" meets every fifteen days in the cantón of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its craft items, which are recognized on an international level. It's also the home of the famous palm straw hats ["Panama" hats]. 

This is where Monserrate lives. She is 52 years old, married, and has three grown children. The youngest is studying in the university. Two of their children live with them at home. Her husband is a master bricklayer.

Monserrate is a very determined woman who likes to work hard to get ahead. She takes in washing, but she also works in commerce. She sells all kinds of clothing, usually door to door. She does her route on the weekends and also sells in her house. She sells to her customers on credit and charges every eight days. She has been in this business for three years and through it she has been able to help her daughter continue with her studies.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. This member is a founder of the the communal loan group and she likes it because the loans are very helpfu. Her dream is to continue working.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ramona Sabina

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 53 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun  viven con ella. Su marido  trabajador eventualmente.
Doña Ramona es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo para así sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, granos, carnes, detergentes, aguas en bidón, sodas, remedios, helados, legumbres, dulces entre otros productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, en su trabajo le ayudan su esposo y sus hijos cuando ellos pueden. Ya son muchos años que tiene  su negocio el cual le deja muy buenas satisfacciones ya que así se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva más de 14 años es socia del Grupo de Crédito y le agrada por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener la mejor tienda de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso [Hope & Progress] credit group meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisan craftwork, which is nationally and internationally recognized. It is also the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here lives Ramona, who is 53 years old and maintains a civil union, through which she has 3 adult children, 2 of whom still live with her. Her husband is a seasonal worker.

Ramona is a woman who likes to earn her own money in order to support her family. She has a grocery store in her house, where she sells all kinds of products: grains, meat, soaps, canned water, soda, medicines, ice cream, beans, sweets, and other items. She works every day from 6am to 7pm, and her husband and children help when they can. She has had her business for many years now, and it gives her great satisfaction to earn her living in this way.

This loan is to stock her store. She has been a member of her credit group for over 14 years, and she is grateful for the help she gets through the loans. Her dream is to have the best store in the city.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies

loans.name: Jael

texts.en:
Jael is a single female lady with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Jael has been operating a beauty salon for six years now. She also owns a motorcycle transport business to earn side income. 

Jael has a dream of expanding her business into a wholesale cosmetic shop. Jael is hardworking but is faced with a challenge of transportation costs. Jael wants money to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos, who is in his early 30's, is single with one small kid.  He has been running a business of selling fruits for three years now. He works from 07 am to 08 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Carlos's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase the fruit stock, and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, saved some in the bank, and covered household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy more and faster moving fruits like apples, mangoes, and oranges for his genge.  He dreams of buying more fruits of many different types.

Carlos will make sure that he pays his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy more and faster moving fruits like apples, mangoes, and oranges

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married with one school-going child. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees 

Mwanamisi has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Jefferson Fabian

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar vive el señor Jefferson, tiene 18 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre, no tiene hijos aun pero su esposa está en su séptimo mes de embarazo. Su mujer es ama de casa.
Don Jefferson con su papá  tienen  un taller de ebanistería en la localidad, allí fabrican muebles, camas, puertas, entre otras obras, ellos elaboran sus obras por pedidos que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación,  sus clientes los prefieren por la calidad de sus trabajos y también por el cumplimiento que ellos tienen ya que cumplen en la fecha indicada, esto los ha hecho ganar mucha clientela lo cual les sirve para ganar mas y salir adelante, el lleva 4 años en esta actividad la cual aprendió de su papá.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en  para elaborar los muebles. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos son rápidos. Su sueño es tener un taller mas grande.
texts.en:
The communal loan group "Esperanza y Progreso" meets every fifteen days in the cantón of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its craft items, which are recognized on an international level. It's also home to the famous palm straw hats ["Panama" hats]. 

This is where Jefferson lives. He is 18 years old and he's in a common law marriage. He doesn't have children yet, but his wife is seven months pregnant. She is a homemaker. 

Jefferson and his father have a furniture-making shop in their town. They make furniture, beds, and doors, among other things. They make their pieces by orders that their clients make ahead of time. Their clients prefer them because of the quality of their work and also because of their reliableness, since they always finish by the agreed date. This has earned them many clients, which helps them earn more and get ahead. He has been working in this business for 4 years, which he learned from his father. 

He will use this loan to make furniture. This is his second loan cycle with the communal loan group and he likes it because the loans are quick. His dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, laquer, etc.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Con la ayuda de su madre Javier compró una casa para arrendarla, la remodeló, le hizo un segundo piso con las utilidades, y consiguió nuevos inquilinos que le significaron mas y mas ingresos. Sus amigos le recomiendan las personas con las que hace contrato de arrendamiento y esto le ha dado resultado.  Su meta es tener cada vez mas inmuebles y aumentar sus ingresos y su patrimonio, para en un futuro lograr que sus hijos hoy en las edades de 14 y 16 años, sean personas realizadas.  Su mayor desafío en este negocio, es encontrar buenos clientes, pero aun así logra referidos, por familiares y conocidos que le son muy funcionales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales constructivos, pues está condicionando un nuevo apartamento y esta inversión hará que el bien inmueble aumente su precio y pueda venderlo aun mejor, logrando que su negocio mejore mucho mas.
texts.en: With his mother's help, Javier purchased a house to rent.  He remodeled it and, with the income from it, put on a second floor.  He also got new tenants, which meant more and more income for him.  Javier's friends recommend him to people, who then sign a lease agreement, and that has worked out very well.  Javier's goal is to own more and more properties to increase his income and his assets so that in the future his children, who are 14- and 16-years old, can be accomplished people.  Javier's biggest challenge in this business is finding good renters, even though he gets very useful references from family and acquaintances.  Javier is currently requesting a credikiva, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase construction materials.  He is fixing up a new apartment, and the loan will help raise the price of the property.  Javier will then be able to sell it more easily, which will improve his business that much more.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Genesis Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar vive la señorita Génesis, tiene 21 años de edad,  está soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos  y le han ayudado salir adelante.
Doña Génesis es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante y forjarse un mejor porvenir, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, a pesar que su negocio recién tiene tres años lo tiene muy bien surtido razón por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas y los clientes la prefieren por esta razón, su mamá le ayuda con su negocio cuando ella está desocupada.
Este crédito es para surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos de primera necesidad. Sus metas son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The 'Esperanza y Progreso' [Hope and Progress] credit group meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton. This is an area which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are known both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here lives 21-year-old Génesis. She is single and lives with her parents. She has been a member of this credit group for 4 loan cycles, and she likes it because the loans are quick and have helped her continue to make ends meet.

Génesis is a very hard-working young woman who likes to succeed through hard work and she enjoys shaping a better future. She has a grocery store in her home, where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, beans, fruits, and vegetables. Although she has only had this business for three years, she has it very well stocked, so her sales are good and customers prefer to come to her. Her mom helps with the store when she is busy.

This loan is to stock her store even more: she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other basic groceries. Her goals are to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, and other basic groceries

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie, 38, runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is a married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Marvie has operated her store for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Marvie wants to take a loan for her store. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks like canned goods, bread and snack foods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments to sell. This loan will allow her to increase her inventories thus attracting more buyers to her store.

Marvie believes that her store will become more successful someday.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, bread, snack foods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Chansor

texts.en: Chansor is an 18-year-old freshman and Accounting major at a university. She is from the Tbong Khmum Province of Cambodia. She lives with her widowed mother and two siblings. Due to the fact that she lacks financial support, Chansor would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her get a higher education. In the future, she is going to find a good job to help her mother to support the family and also pursue a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Rashila

texts.en:
Rashila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rashila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Manasseh, Joshua and Deborah. Rashila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Rashila expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rashila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rashila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Rashila to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Rashila said: "I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses and to pay school fees and food and farm loan payments.

loans.name: David

texts.es: Cuando David terminó sus estudios de bachiller, observó que en su barrio no habían puntos de ventas de repuestos; a él siempre le había gustado el negocio y no estuvo muy contento hasta que emprendió el suyo hace 4 años, durante los cuales se ha dedicado a la venta de repuestos, llantas, neumáticos, bombillos  y accesorios para motocicletas, de contado trabajando todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde. Los principales clientes de David son los motociclistas, que abundan en los barrios ofreciendo servicios de transporte informal y los ´propietarios de estos vehículos que la usan para su traslado personal. Su meta mas adelante, es ampliar el local donde funciona y lograr que su hija obtenga gradualmente estudios de calidad, mientras su mayor desafío consiste en incrementar sus ventas para aumentar sus ingresos. En la actualidad  David está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos para motocicletas para incrementar sus inventarios con nuevos artículos, lo cual hace que su negocio se beneficie con su credikiva.
texts.en:
When David finished his high school studies, he observed that there were no stores selling car replacement parts in his neighborhood. He had always liked business and he wasn't very happy until he started his own 4 years ago. During that time, he has sold replacement parts, tire inner tubes, headlights, and motorcycle accessories. He sells things for cash [not on credit]. He works every day from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. David's main customers are motorcyclists, who are abundant in the neighborhoods and who offer informal transportation services. The owners of these vehicles also use them for thier own transportation. 

His goal for the future is to expand his store and to make sure that his daughter recieves quality schooling. His greatest challenge is growing his sales so he can increase his income. David is requesting a Kiva loan, which is the first financing he has requested from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy replacement parts for motorcycles in order to fill out his inventory with new items, which will cause his business to benefit from the loan.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Elizabeth joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Joel, Markus and Sunday. Elizabeth is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Elizabeth expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Elizabeth would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Elizabeth can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Elizabeth to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Elizabeth said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make a farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Leisa

texts.es:
Leisa es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, comenta que tuvo que abandonar su casa para poder estudiar, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, con lo cual quiere convertirse en una excelente profesional.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Leisa comes from the city of San Ignacio and tells us that she had to leave her home in order to pursue her studies. She is getting her degree in commercial engineering and she hopes to use her degree to become an excellent professional.

She requests this loan to invest in the payment of her tuition so that she will be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her child's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 54-year-old female, widowed with four children and living in Kasese, Uganda. Alice operates a retail shop of general merchandise, she also earns a salary as side income. Alice has a dream of having prosperity and success in her business. However, she is faced with the challenge of competition and, like other civil servants, delayed salary payment. 

Alice is a hard-working woman who wants money to buy cement and sand to construct her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to construct her house.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She operates an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Melody

texts.es:
Melody es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es soltera, actualmente trabaja en un estudio contable y estudia la carrera de criminalística, está en el primer año y está poniendo todo de sí.
Quiere seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo, es por eso que pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Melody is from the city of Encarnación. She is single and currently works for an accounting firm while she is studying criminology.  She is in her first year and is giving it her all.

She wants to continue striving as she has been doing and that is why she is requesting this loan so that she can pay her school fees.

She is grateful for this opportunity to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Cecilia Lorena

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor de   16 años  de edad que  estudia en colegio, dos de ellos aun  viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica.
Doña Cecilia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante, ella tiene un taller de artesanía, fabrica  todo tipo de figuras las mismas que elabora  en barro o en cerámica, trabaja todos los días ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy grande, entrega sus productos semiterminados a comerciantes de su localidad y de otras ciudades que llegan  hasta su taller ya que conocen de la calidad de sus obras, su hijo le ayuda cuando él está desocupado. Llevan más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica y pinturas para elaborar sus productos. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la atención médica pues muy buena comenta. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su  familia.
texts.en:
In a parish in Montecristi, the Communal Bank “Para El Futuro De La Mujer” (For the Future of the Woman) meets every 15 days. This place is well-known for its rich traditional culture and the wide variety of handicrafts that are made by its residents.

Sra. Cecilia lives in this place. She is 47 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are adults and the youngest child is a 16-year-old high school student. Two of her children still live at home. Her husband works at a factory.

Doña Cecilia is a woman who enjoys working in order to get ahead. She has a handicraft workshop where she produces all types of figurines made of either clay or ceramic. Cecilia works every day and the demand for her products is huge. She delivers her products half-finished to merchants in her town and in other cities. Her workshop is known for the quality of her creations. Cecilia’s son helps her when he is not busy. She has been in this business for more than 15 years and it has allowed her to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy ceramics and paints for making her products. Cecilia has been with the Communal Bank for 10 years and enjoys the medical attention since it is well worth commenting. Her dreams include providing the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy ceramics and paints.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is a 36-year-old female married with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 10 years, Marion has been operating a general merchandise retail shop to earn a living. She also does livestock and crop production to supplement her income. Marion has a dream of educating her children. However, she is faced with the challenge of debtors who don't pay her on time and high transportation costs due to bad roads. Marion wants money to buy maize flour, millet flour, rice and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, millet flour, rice and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia proviene de una familia luchadora, su meta es culminar sus estudios con las mejores calificaciones y ser una reconocida en su profesión  que es la de obstetricia y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Ella es una chica muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante, y ayudar a las personas que necesiten de el.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cynthis comes from a hardworking family. Her goal is to complete her studies with the best grades and to be recognized in her profession, which is that of obstetrics. Thus she will be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

She is a very self-sacrificing girl who wants to get ahead and help those people who need it.

She is requesting this loan to pay her school feels so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es una Persona muy Responsable y Respetuosa. El esta Trabajando como chófer. Uno de sus Objetivos como Persona es llegar a culminar sus Estudios Universitarios de abogado para luego llegar a ejercer su cargo ya que eso es uno de sus metas como persona.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Victor is a very responsible and respectful person. He is working as a chauffeur. One of his objectives as a person is to finish his university studies as a lawyer and go on to exercise his profession. This is one of his personal goals.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his school fees and continue with his studies.

He is grateful for this opportunity he is receiving to continue striving.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “APU LLALLAHUANI DE KALLACANCHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kallacancha, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Felix  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales, el socio vende maiz,cacao y quinua, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cacao, maíz y quinua.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felix is a member of the Communal Bank “Apu Llallahuani de Kallacancha”. This bank is located in the District of Kallacancha in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco.

Felix continues to manage his business of selling grains and staple crops such as corn, cacao, and quinoa. He works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Felix has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. His dream is to have a shop where he can sell his products.

Felix is requesting a loan in order to buy cacao, corn, and quinoa. He would be pleased to receive a loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy cacao, corn, and quinoa to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria  tiene una despensa bien surtida en su barrio de la ciudad de San Ignacio, hace unos años que se dedica a este trabajo, ya tiene clientela formada, donde vende productos lácteos, golosinas, artículos de primera necesidad, panificados, entre otros.
Vive con su marido y sus hijos, todos pequeños en edad escolar, su marido es herrero, tiene su propio negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, lácteos, panificados, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y con ello luchar por mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria has a well-stocked food pantry in her neighborhood in the city of San Ignacio. She has been in this line of work for a few years. Maria already has an established clientele. She sells dairy products, snack foods, basic necessity goods, baked goods, and other items.

Maria lives with her husband and children, all of whom are of school age. Her husband is a blacksmith and has his own business.

Maria is requesting this loan so that she can buy vegetables, dairy products, baked goods, and other items in order to continue her sales. As a result, she can strive to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dairy products, baked goods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Aliyu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Buhari, Hamza and Mohammed. 

Aliyu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Aliyu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Aliyu to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Aliyu said: "I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 38-year-old female Ugandan who is a widow. She has three children, aged 11, 7 and 4, and two of them attend school.

She is a cattle keeper in Kyarushsha, and she also deals in farming and buys and sells corn to earn a living and support her family as a single mother.

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from Ugafode to buy produce, and she has promised to pay after making some profits.

Her plans for the future are to expand her farm, but she faces the challenge of animal diseases. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her kids.

For the past seven years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also does farming, which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 51-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working at the catering department of a certain company for three years to support her husband in covering their beloved family's increasing living needs.

Maha is a hard worker, well known in her region with her hard work and special cooking talents. Her income, combined with her husband's, is barely enough to cover their family's increasing needs, especially the education fees. Thus for this reason, Maha is acquiring her third loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees. Educating her children is very important to her, so she puts much effort to provide it to her children.

Her previous loans were invested in covering some family needs such as winter preparations, where she might invest part of the current loan in buying mouneh (conserved seasonal food).

She hopes that in the future she can open her own restaurant and develop her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es madre de dos hijos y  posee un negocio de venta Cosméticos y bisuterías desde hace 12 años, ubicadas en unos de los  mercados  de la ciudad león.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 6:30 am para ofrecerles a sus clientes las variedades de productos cosméticos y bisuterías a su  clientela retirándose a hogar alas 5:00 pm para descansar, horario que lo ejerce de lunes a domingos.

El crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de shampoo, vanidad, pintura de uñas y labio, bolsos aretes, crema, cola, de mejor calidad y así obtener mayores venta  lo que le permitirá que genere mayores ganancia mejorando así el nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Lorena is the mother of two children. She has a business of selling cosmetics and trinkets. Her business has been in operation for 12 years and it is located at one of the markets in the city of León.

Martha Lorena begins her work in the morning at 6:30 A.M. by offering her customers a variety of cosmetic products and trinkets. She returns home at 5:00 P.M. in order to rest. Her work schedule is from Monday to Sunday.

The loan she is requesting from CEPRODEL will be used to buy shampoo, make-up kits, nail polishes, lipsticks, bags, earrings, crèmes, and ponytail holders. By improving quality and generating better sales, Martha Lorena will be able to earn more income and improve the standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, make-up kits, nail polishes, lipsticks, bags, earrings, crèmes, and ponytail holders.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Bendera owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bendera has been operating a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood and charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman engaged in fishing as her source of income.  She catches and sells fish to the people in her community. She has been fishing for almost 20 years. Virginia lives with her family in Palompon, Leyte.  Due to lack of capital to continue her livelihood activity, Virginia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy an engine (for a motorboat), fishing net and a pump boat. These will help her to increase her catch and yield a higher income.

In the future, Virginia hopes that her fishing business will help improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy an engine for a motorboat, fishing net and a pump boat

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 24-year-old single man who has worked in a hotel for two years to satisfy the needs and expenses of his family. The poor conditions of his family didn’t affect his desire to continue his studies. Thus, today Fadi is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university’s tuition fees. This loan is very important to him because it will help him make the first step toward a better future.

loans.use: to pay his university’s tuition fees

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and a mother. She sells green groceries with the help of her family. Zawadi is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Zawadi is requesting a loan of KES10,000 to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a mechanic by profession. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial boost because he used the previous loan profitably and increased his income. He is a businessman and he sells motorcycle spare parts, a business he has done since 2011 at a trading centre because there is business there.

He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to add to his business since his plan for the future is to open a bigger shop and garage for motorcycles.

His major challenge is the lack of enough capital to cope with competition from more established business people.

loans.use: To buy spare motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
A resident in the province of Leyte, Philippines, Lea is making a living through fishing. She is 35 years old and has two children. For the past 14 years, Lea has supported her husband in their fishing venture. 

As of now, she wants to expand their business. For this, she wants a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a boat engine. This loan will help her and her husband in improving their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Lea has hopes of making her business more sustainable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a boat engine

loans.name: John

texts.en:
From a young age, John has worked in the fields, farming and cattle raising, just as his father taught him. In this way, he has been able to get ahead in life. 

Today, John mainly works in farming and cattle raising. His main goal is to raise his working capital by buying lots of cattle so he can increase his stock and generate a greater income. This is the reason why he is applying for a loan.

John is a responsible and loving father. He lives on a farm with his children and wife, who has been his greatest partner.

John dreams of being able to offer his children a quality education so that in the future, they will be able to fend for themselves and be independent.

John works at his farm every day and makes sure that everything he does, he does very well.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon is 33 years old. She is a married grocer with two children living in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. One of her children attends school. Her husband is 35, and has been a soldier since 2010. Both of them can earn approximately $13 a day. 

Now Samon would like to buy more groceries to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and support her children to have a higher education.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Romarico

texts.en:
Romarico is a fisherman from Palompon, Leyte. He is 39 year old and has two children who are 16 and 21 years old, respectively. He sells fresh fish, crabs and seashells to the nearby towns. He has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. Romarico is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy fishnet and an engine for the motorboat.  With these materials, he can continue his livelihood, improve his daily catch, and afford to buy nutritious diets for his family.

Romarico would like to expand his fishing business enough to support the college education of his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fish net and an engine for a motorboat

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hosea, Yahuza and Hauwa. Samaila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Samaila expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Samaila to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Samaila said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors, pupils, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Jumwa dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, 10 kgs of beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, 10 kgs of beans, and wheat flour

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Peris is married and has five children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty years now, and she is currently growing maize and beans and she also keeps livestock. Peris is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Peris’ first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Peris’ hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan Idi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Jonathan Idi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child, Shedrac. Jonathan Idi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Jonathan Idi expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jonathan Idi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jonathan Idi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Jonathan Idi to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Jonathan Idi said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my child is educated and is able to get a professional job."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make farm loan payments.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Inusa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Lifana, Baamurke, and Hassan. 

Inusa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan, Inusa expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Inusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Inusa to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Inusa said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Mohidil

texts.en: Mohidil is a young and hardworking girl. She is 18 years old. Mohidil graduated school successfully but she had no opportunity to apply to any university. Mohidil is going to start a business and in this way find a source of income as her family's condition is poor and she needs to earn a living. Mohidil is going to start a business in farming. She will sow vegetables and sell them in a local market. With this aim she took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and got a certificate. She will be a successful business lady as she is smart and hardworking. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to buy seeds for sowing vegetables. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds to start a new business.

loans.name: Pilar Del Carmen

texts.es:
Pilar es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ha estudiado la carrera de Secretariado pero por cosas de la vida, al salir embarazada no pudo ejercer su profesión ya que tenía que cuidar a su bebe. Con mucho esfuerzo logró iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza y ella cree que le está yendo bien porque se ha esforzado mucho y trabaja por más de 10 horas al día para poder incrementar sus ventas.
Pilar está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio y así ofrecer otras opciones a sus clientes. Más adelante Pilar espera poder cumplir su sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un excelente profesional y pueda tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Pilar is a hardworking woman who has tremendous drive to succeed. She was studying for a degree in Secretarial Studies, but due to life’s circumstances, she became pregnant and could not pursue her profession since she had to take care of her baby. With great effort, she was able to start a small business that involves selling beauty products. She believes she is doing well because she tries very hard and works more than 10 hours a day in order to increase her sales.

Pilar is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have provided. She will be able to buy merchandise in order to restock her business and offer other choices to her customers. Going forward, Pilar hopes to fulfill her dream of seeing her child become a successful professional and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Nohemi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nohemy, con el préstamo anterior se compró suficiente prendas de vestir usadas para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, tener su fuente de ingresos y mejor el estilo de vida familiar.
Para lograr mejorar su negocio se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar variedad de prendas de vestir usadas y un perchero, podrá mantener su negocio competitivo y con una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Nohemy used the last loan to buy enough second-hand clothing to satisfy her customers' demand.  This gave her a source of income leading to a better quality of life for her family. 

To improve her business again, she has decided to ask for a new loan to buy a wider variety of second-hand clothes and a clothes rack, so that she can stay competitive and improve the way she displays her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of second-hand clothes and a clothes rack.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es independiente, fuerte, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la localidad ‘Papa chililaya’ un islote dentro del lago Titicaca.
Vicente es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español para el comercio. su vida la comparte con su padres que ya son muy ancianos y no pueden trabajar, la casa donde viven cuenta solamente con luz eléctrica. Su trabajo es la pesca en bote con red. Su negocio atraviesa dificultades como el constante deterioro de las redes de pesca, el bote también se malogra pues la humedad afecta la seguridad del pescador. Ya lleva cuatro años de experiencia en esta labor y este es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida aumentando sus ingresos económicos para su familia y desea realizar la compra de redes por mayor y la refacción de su bote para mayor seguridad.
Es por esos motivos que Vicente solicita un préstamo para la compra de; redes de pesca, la refacción de su bote y con los beneficios ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Vicente, 26, is single and has no children.  He works as a fisherman.

He is independent, strong, reliable, responsible and hard-working. He works in the 'Papa Chililaya' area, which is a small island in the lake Titicaca.

He is dark-skinned, with short black hair and a medium build.  His native tongue is Aymara but he speaks Spanish in his business.  

He shares his income with his parents because they are now very old and they can no longer work.  The house where they live only has electricity.   

He fishes in a boat with a net.   He has to overcome many problems in his work such as the deterioration of his fishing net.  His boat also gets damaged by damp which can affect the safety of the fisherman. 

He has now been in this business for four years and this is the third round of loans with this business. He dreams of improving his quality of life and earning more of an income for his family.  He would like to buy nets wholesale and improve his boat for better security.

For these reasons, Vicente is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and repair his boat.  He will use the profits he makes to help his parents.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and repair his boat so he can help his parents.

loans.name: Olga Ines

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja muy duro en una Institución que ayuda a los niños sin hogar. Es muy amable, alegre y le encanta cuidar a los niños porque es su vocación.  Tiene 3 hijos quienes son el motor de su vida por ello es que lucha día a día para poder sacarlos adelante.
Olga está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una impresora para su casa, de esta manera sus hijos podrán imprimir sus trabajos y así mejorar sus estudios, con esto ella se sentirá tranquila porque estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is a hard-working woman who strives to get on in life.  For this reason, she works very hard for an organization who help homeless children. She is very kind, cheerful and loves looking after children in her work.  

She has three children who are her driving force; she works hard every day to raise them.

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she will be able to buy a printer for her home.  This will allow her children to print their work and improve their studies.  She will feel more at ease because she knows that she is working towards improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a printer for her children.

loans.name: Rosa Yanet

texts.es:
Rosa, ha tenido múltiples beneficios al invertir en su negocio el crédito anterior, su venta de pupusas se mantiene en el mercado, las nuevas ganancias le han servido para cumplir con sus obligaciones y mejorar la crianza de ganado, su familia mantiene un mejor nivel de vida y continúa luchando por agregar un nuevo rubro en su negocio.
Se ha decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de concentrado, zacate y vitaminas para el ganado, fortalecerá mejor la ganadería y sus animales se mantendrán saludables.
texts.en:
Rosa has enjoyed many benefits after investing her last loan in her business.  She has managed to maintain her take-away business on the market selling stuffed tortillas.  

The new profits have allowed her to meet her expenses and to improve the way she raises her livestock.  Her family has also benefited from a better quality of life and she is still striving to add a new line of work to her business.

She has decided to request another loan to buy animal feed, fodder and vitamins for her cows.  This will make her livestock stronger and keep them healthy.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fodder and vitamins to take care of her livestock.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Emilio de 51 años de edad casado, el motivo por el cual el está impulsado en realizar otro préstamo es para una nueva inversión el cultivo de papas.

Los préstamos eran con otras instituciones, pero no contaban con los beneficios que nos da adicla como lo es la forma de pago, intereses mensuales y el capital al vencimiento pues son beneficios que nos ayudan a soñar en un futuro mejor para nuestros futuros hijos.

El uso respectivo que Emilio le dará el segundo crédito es para la compra de semillas de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder empezar a cultivar más productos para luego venderlas en el mercado de su comunidad y así obtener una ganancias para el sustento de su familia y para que tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada. 

El cambio que realiza un crédito es principalmente asegurar  la cosecha con los insumos y el manejo en general de las cosechas agrícolas, para que las personas obtengan productos de la mejora calidad y es lo que a ocurrido con Emilio que por medio de los prestamos que se les a concedido el a podido obtener mejores cosechas.

Una de las metas de el es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para una condición de vida adecuada y estudios para sus hijos para que se conviertan en profesionales en la vida y seguir cosechando las tierras fértiles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Working the land under an energy sapping sun, but willing to sweat every last drop if it means providing your children with a better future. This is how Emilio feels.  He is 51 and married.  He is asking for a new loan to invest once again in his potato crops.

Other loans he has used, offered by other organizations, have not offered the same benefits as this one, such as the method of payment, monthly interest rates and the capital left when the loan expires; all of these are advantages that help people dream of a better future for their families.

The use that Emilio would give this second loan is to buy potato seeds and organic manure so that he can start to grow more produce and then sell them in the local market.  This will help him generate more income and take care of his family so that they have suitable living conditions. 

The change that the loan makes means that the supplies allow him to take care of the harvest and manage his agricultural crops in general.  This in turn leads to better quality produce, which is exactly what Emilio has found; the loans mean better harvests.

One of his goals is to build homes for his children so that they have suitable living conditions and also that they complete their studies so that they can grow up to become working professionals.  He would also like to continue harvesting fertile lands in his area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic compost.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Hellen is married and has five children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty years now and she is currently growing maize, sorghum, vegetables and sugarcane. Hellen is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and wax.

This is Hellen’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Hellen’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva esta cursando el 3er Año de licenciatura en enfermería, de aquí a tres años se ve con un titulo de Licenciatura en Enfermería, trabajando en un puesto de Salud y ejerciendo lo que a ella le gusta.
La inspira su familia y en especial su madre que es una luchadora, y sacrificada mujer.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar sus cuotas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Elva is in her third year of study toward earning a degree in Nursing. She works at a health center and is pursuing a career that she enjoys. Elva is inspired by her family, especially her mother who is a determined and self-sacrificing woman.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay her fees. Elva appreciates the opportunity she has received and it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.fr: Madame Nabintu est une femme dynamique, trésorière du groupe de credit Uzima. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, mère de 9 enfants  scolarisés  et mariée à un homme d’affaire. Vendeuse des boissons alcoolisées et non alcoolisées à son domicile,  elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter 22 casiers vide, 10 casiers de la bière primus et 10 casiers d’Amstel. Ainsi, son objectif est de prospérer dans les affaires. Elle remercie grandement Hekima et ses agents pour les services rendus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nabintu is a dynamic woman, and the treasurer of the Uzima loan group. She is 49 years old, the mother of 9 educated children, and is married to a businessman.

A seller of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages from her home, she is requesting this new loan to buy 22 empty cases, 10 cases of Primus beer and 10 cases of Amstel beer.

Thus, her objective is to prosper in business. She is very grateful to Hekima and its agents for services rendered.

loans.use: buy 22 empty cases, 10 cases of Primus beer and 10 cases of Amstel beer.

loans.name: Gil Bernanrdo

texts.es:
Las computadoras era el juguete preferido de Gil cuando estaba en su adolescencia. Siempre estaba diseñando materiales en informática y luego fue aprendiendo con profundidad más sobre su pasión. Ahora a sus 25 años de edad, ya está casado y es padre de un pequeño de un año de edad, lo que lo motiva a seguir adelante. Ahora es maestro de educación técnica, pues es egresado de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas.
Las habilidades de Gil en las computadoras lo han llevado a estudiar y a trabajar reparando computadoras de forma preventiva y correctiva, lo que le permite pagar sus estudios. Él está a tan solo un paso de convertirse legalmente en Ingeniero en Sistemas, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para pagar sus últimas clases en la carrera y el título universitario. Este avance le permitirá tener una prueba más de sus conocimientos en el ámbito profesional.  En sus planes está estudiar una maestría o una especialidad.
texts.en:
Computers were Gil’s favorite toys when he was a teenager. He always pursued computer programming and later studied it in-depth with great passion. Now that he is 25 years old, he is already married and the father of a one-year-old child who motivates him to continue forward. Gil is a technical education teacher, but he is also studying for a degree in Systems Engineering.

His skill with computers has led him to this field of study. In addition, his work of repairing computers through preventative and corrective measures allows him to pay for his studies. Gil is only a step away from becoming a certified Systems Engineer. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to pay for the final classes that he needs for his university degree. This advance will allow him to gain more knowledge for his professional field. His plans include studying for a Master’s degree or a specialization.

loans.use: to pay for the final classes that are needed for his university degree.

loans.name: Ep Cishadu Group

texts.fr: Monsieur  Milenge  est le représentant des enseignants de l’école primaire Cishadu, une institution éducative chrétienne de la place. Agé de 54 ans, il est instituteur, marié et père de 9enfants scolarisés. Il a pris connaissance de l’existence du produit credit enseignant au sein de Hekima qui a retenu son  attention. Cet ainsi, qu’il vient de solliciter un crédit pour rehabiliter sa maison. Son objectif est d’avoir une maison en matériaux durable. Il remercie Hekima pour cette nouvelle initiative en faveur des enseignants.
texts.en:
Mr. Milenge is the teachers' representative of the Cishadu primary school, a local Christian educational institution. Aged 54, he is a teacher, married and the father of nine educated children.

He became aware of the existence of a teacher loan program within Hekima, which caught his attention. This is why he is applying for a credit loan to rehabilitate his house.

His goal is to have a home made from sustainable materials. He thanks Hekima for this new initiative for teachers.

loans.use: rehabilitate his house

loans.name: Denis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Denis una mujer muy trabajadora y sonriente que a pesar de su falta de recursos siempre tiene un motivo para ser feliz, se dedica a la venta de comidas, las cuales prepara en su hogar que como se puede observar es muy humilde y necesita un impulso, tiene dos hijos y con orgullo los ha mantenido con su negocio y ahora quiere impulsar con una pequeña inversión.
Solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mesas, sillas, manteles, cubiertos, losa, arroz, aceite, papa, yuca, carne de res y pollo.
Es5ta inversión representara una mejor forma de trabajar para Denis tener insumos y comodidades para atender a sus clientes.
Su sueño es poder tener sostenibilidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Denis is a cheerful, hard-working woman who despite her lack of resources always finds a reason to be happy.  She sells food that she prepares in her home which is very humble as can be seen.  She has two children who she has supported with pride through her business which she wants to boost with a small investment.

She is requesting a loan to buy tables, chairs, tablecloths, cutlery, china, rice, oil, potatoes, yucca, beef and chicken.  This investment will give Denis a better work method as she will have the suppies and conveniences to attend to her customers.  Her dream is to be able to sustain her business.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, tablecloths, cutlery, china, rice, oil, potatoes, yucca, beef and chicken.  She is truly a woman in poverty.

loans.name: Ludys

texts.es: Ludys tienen 46 años de edad, y habita con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 21 años en un municipio del departamento del Atlántico. En el año 2006 emprendió un negocio atendiendo su aptitud por la costura, ella empezó comprando poco a poco las herramientas, maquinarias y equipos con los que organizar su taller y hoy hace 8 años que no se detiene, sus metas son mas elevadas y sueña con generar empleos teniendo confeccionistas a su cargo., para aumentar la productividad y comprar su vivienda. Su mayor desafió es tener la calidad ajustadas a la exigencia del mercado, pues necesita producir mucho mas para ganar mas y  lograr la plena satisfacción de su clientela. En la actualidad Ludys está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora, para darle un  acabado industrializado  y mejorar los tiempos productivos.
