Con esta  inversión puede ofrecer nuevos servicios, que muchas veces había tenido que contratar y esto es lo que hace que su credikiva impacte positivamente su negocio.
texts.en:
Ludys, 46, lives with her husband and two children, ages 19 and 21 in a municipality of the department of Atlantico.  In 2006 she began a business using her sewing skills.  She started out little by little buying tools, machines and equipment to organize her workshop and has been working ever since.  Her goals are higher now and she dreams of generating employment for seamstresses and increasing productivity so she can buy a house.

The greatest challenge she faces is to adjust her quality to market demand, as she needs to produce much more to earn more and achieve full customer satisfaction.  

Ludys is currently requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy an overlock sewing machine.  This is to give her products a more industrialized finish and improve production time.  With this investment she can offer new services which many times she has had to subcontract.  This means the CrediKiva loan will have a positive impact on her business.

loans.use: To buy an industrial overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Гавхар в этом году исполнилось 42 года. Она берет повторный кредит для оплаты за обучения своего сына. Первый кредит с этой же целью она брала в прошлом году, который успешно был профинансирован кредиторами Kiva и пользуясь случаем Гавхар хочет отблагодарить их за оказанную поддержку. Ее историю прошлого кредита Вы можете получить перейдя по ссылке http://www.kiva.org/lend/617965.
Сейчас Гавхар снова обратилась за кредитом, так как подошел срок для оплаты за текущий год обучения ее сына в институте. Без вашей финансовой помощи ей снова не обойтись. Она всегда надеется на то, что ее сын успешно окончит ВУЗ, став хорошим специалистом и будет приносить пользу своему государству.
texts.en:
Gavhar turned 42 years old this year.  She is taking a second loan to pay for her son's education.  Last year, she took a first loan for the same purpose.  That first loan was successfully funded by Kiva lenders, and Gavhar wants to take this opportunity to thank everyone for their support.  You can read Gavhar's loan history by clicking on the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/617965.

Gavhar is now taking a second loan, because time has come again to pay for her son's current tuition fees.  She cannot do it without your support.  She really hopes that her son will be able to successfully graduate from the institute of higher education where he is enrolled, and that once he becomes a university graduate, he can work in a position that will benefit his country.

loans.use: to pay her son's higher education tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica desde hace 5 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, y asi poder tener mejores cultivos para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He has worked in agriculture for 5 years, sowing corn and beans. He sells his products in the different markets near his home. He lives in his own house with his life partner and his son.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, disease control products, herbicides etc. and improve the land shown in the photograph. This will allow him to have better crops and so increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, disease control products, herbicides etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de 2 años y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la zona ‘Villa Ingenio’ frente a un colegio muy conocido, esta zona se caracteriza por estar en el altiplano, a una altura promedio de cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar, con un clima frío y rayos solares fuertes y penetrantes.
Betty es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español, cuenta con estudios primarios completos. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y su bebé, su pareja trabaja como ayudante de albañilería durante el día y durante la noche cuida al bebé y ella se ocupa de su bebé durante el día y al finalizar la tarde comienza su trabajo hasta altas horas de la noche. Toda su familia vive en casa de su cuñada y cuentan con los servicio básicos de luz, agua y gas. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; hamburguesas, salchipapas (papa frita y salchicha), hot dog, sándwich de huevo, sándwich de carne, en un puesto de venta alquilado (foto), ella ya lleva un año de experiencia en este negocio y quiere realizar una inversión en la compra de un puesto de venta en la zona de ‘Villa Fátima’ que se encuentra ubicado en medio de una plaza, cancha y colegio, esto hará que su demanda sea mayor y su negocio prospere. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos, los pagos de su anterior préstamo fueron puntuales. Su meta es tener su puesto de venta propio.
Es por esos motivos que Betty solicita un préstamo para la compra de un puesto de venta y así independizarse.
texts.en:
Betty is a 21 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has a 2 year old daughter. Her business is selling fast food. She is entrepreneurial, a god mother, reliable, responsible and hard working. She does her work in the ‘Villa Ingenio’ area in front of a very well known high school. This are is characterized by being in the highlands, with an average altitude of four thousand meters above sea level. It has a cold climate and has strong and penetrating sun rays. 

Betty has brown skin, medium height, and long, black, braided hair. She dresses in traditional clothing ( a hat, a shawl and a skirt). Her native tongue is   Aymará  and she speaks Spanish . She has a complete primary education. She shares her life with her spouse and baby. Her spouse works as an assistant bricklayer during the day and at night cares for the baby while she cares for the baby during the day and and in the afternoon starts working until late at night. Her whole family lives in her sister in law's house and they have the basic services of electricity, water and gas. Her business is selling fast food such as hamburgers, salchipapas (french fries and hotdogs) hot dogs, egg sandwiches, and meat sandwiches in a rented sales stall (see photo).   She already has a year's experience in this business and she wants to make an investment in buying a sales stall in the ‘Villa Fátima’ area, which is located in the middle of a plaza, sports field and high school. This will make her demand grow and her business prosper. This is her second loan cycle. Her payments with the previous loan were on time. Her goal is to have her own sales stall. 

This is why Betty is asking for a loan to buy a sales stall and become independent.

loans.use: to buy a sales stall so she can become independent.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Monica, mujer de 47 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 21 años, que son su motor en la vida y sueña con apoyarlos para que cada uno tenga su propia casa. Sus ingresos dependen de su negocio como comerciante, porque vende de contado y a crédito ropa, electrodomésticos entre otros articulados,  en un local ubicado en el lugar donde habita y en el que trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde diariamente. Su idea de negocio la hizo realidad desde hace 12 años, pues siempre le gustó vender lo que tuviera mas cerca. Monica necesita renovar sus inventarios con ropa para la temporada de navidad y año nuevo, para impulsar las ventas, además de que sus clientes reales se lo han solicitado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará modernos diseños de ropa, ajustado a las fiestas venideras. Con esta inversión atraerá aun mas clientes, impactando positivamente sus ventas, y poco a poco alcanzar su sueño de tener un almacén posicionado, en  las comunidades cercanas a su negocio.
texts.en:
Monica, a 47-year-old woman, is mother to two children, who are 14 and 21 years old. Her children are her driving force in life and she hopes to support them so that they can each own their own home. Her income depends on her business as a saleswoman, as she sells - by cash or credit - clothes and household appliances, among other things. She does this in a space located where she lives, and she works every day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. She started her business 12 years ago, as she had always liked selling whatever she had. 

Monica needs to renew her inventory, with clothes for the Christmas and New Year season, to boost sales. and because her customers have asked for these clothes. This is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first funding given to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy modern clothes designs, getting ready for the upcoming party season. Will this investment she will attract more customers, which will have a positive impact on her sales, and little by little she will reach her dream of having a store in the community nearby her business.

loans.use: to buy modern clothing designs, getting ready for the party season.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Debido a diversas situaciones ya  la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar una profesión, por eso hoy trabaja como operario de limpieza en una empresa de su ciudad natal. Él labora alrededor de 9 horas diarias y cree que le está yendo bien por su buen desempeño y porque siempre da lo mejor de si mismo para poder obtener buenos resultados.
Carlos tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia por ello tiene pensado utilizar el crédito para poder comprar un artefacto. él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su familia sentirá mayor bienestar y así él continuará esforzándose para más adelante empezar a estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Carlos is a person who very much wants to move ahead. He is not married and lives in Ica with his family. Due to various situations such as the need to work, he could not study for a profession. This is why today he works as a cleaner in a company in his native city. He works around 9 hours a day and he believes it is going well because of his good performance and because he always gives his best to get good results.

Carlos very much wants to improve the quality of life of his family, and this is why he thought of using the loan to buy an appliance. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, he wants them to know that with this, his family will have a better well-being and so he will continue to strive forward so that one day he can start to study for a profession.

loans.use: to buy a household appliance to improve his family's well-being.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans and high quality shoes.

loans.name: Loira Pricilia

texts.es: Loira de 47 años de edad posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos, etc. para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Loria, 47, has a small store at home. She has many customers and manages to cover the home expenses with the sales she makes. She lives with her two children in a house of her own.

Loria is requesting a loan to buy soups, eggs, candies, grains, beverages, etc. in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, candies, grains, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: La variedad de productos que ofrece Don Julio nos abre las puertas a su pequeña pulpería. Él es el encargado de proveer dichos productos a sus clientes estelianos, es por eso que el requirió anteriormente a un préstamo KIVA-MiCredito el cual le fue de mucha ayuda para surtir su inventario. Ahora requiere de otro préstamo para incrementar de nuevo su inventario en esta nueva temporada, requiere comprar Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Café, Leche, Detergente entre otros productos varios. Estima que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá surtir la demanda de sus clientes y a la vez aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
The great variety of products that Julio sells in his store is inviting. He sells these products to his customers in Esteli, which is why he requested the previous “Kiva-MiCredito” loan in order to offer a wider assortment.

Julio is requesting another loan to increase his stock levels for the season. He needs to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, milk and detergent, among other products. He believes that this loan will help him a lot because he will be able to fulfill his customers’ demands and maybe attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, milk, and detergent.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: Zoila de 39 años de edades es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar quesillo, frijoles, maíz, chicharrón y demás ingredientes y asi poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zoila is 39 years old and a single mother. She lives with her two children in a house of her own. She sells pupusas [thick corn tortillas] at home.

Zoila is requesting a loan to buy cheese, beans, corn, bacon and other ingredients. This will help her to improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cheese, beans, corn, bacon and other ingredients to make "pupusas"

loans.name: Grupo Chuisanto Tomas 3 Group

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 22 años de edad residente en Suchitepéquez, soltera con un  hijo de cuatro años de edad,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia.  (María es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda la que tiene puesta una blusa de color negro en la fotografía)

La actividad que realiza María es la fabricación de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas y los pone a la venta en la comunidad donde ella vive ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de refacciones, ella siempre trata la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a su hijo el estudio que se merece y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que María le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de hilos para la elaboración de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

María y un grupo de mujeres más sueñan con alcanzar sus sueños en la vida que es llegar a superarse en la vida y ver por los demás que los necesitan para superarse.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a su hijo en la escuela y llegar a ser un profesional  en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
She is an enterprising woman, 22 years old, lives in Suchitepéquez, and is single with a four-year-old child. She has to make an enormous effort to be able to support her family and see the way to improve her family economy. (María is the first on the right, who is wearing a black blouse in the photo).

The work María does is making güipiles [traditional Guatemalan blouses], cortes [traditional Guatemalan skirts], and traditional sashes, and she sells them in the community where she lives and for her it is an important source of income for her family, in order to improve the living conditions that they currently have in their community. She has a second job, which is selling snacks. She always tries to find the way to have extra income in order to provide her son with the education he deserves and that someday he can become a professional in his life.

The use that María will give the loan that she is taking out is to purchase thread to make traditional güipiles, cortes and sashes, to then sell them in her community and to her neighbors to have more income for herself and her family.

María and a group of other women dream of realizing their life dreams, which are to be able to improve their lives and see it through other people who need them to improve themselves. 

One of her future goals is to purchase a retail space in her community so that she can sell her merchandise and see her son grow in school and become a professional and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase thread to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sound system to rent out.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos del hogar, el solicita un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos, etc. para obtener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miguel, 59 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has a store located in his home; with the sales that he makes, is manages to pay the household expenses. He asks for a loan to purchase soup, eggs, candies, basic grains, soft drinks, etc. to get more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soup, eggs, candies, basic grains, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace varios años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de su residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que hay su casa, la joven solicita un crédito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been blurred because she is only 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area, lives in her own home with her family. She has had a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers for several years, which is located near her place of residence. She has a very good customer base as she sells her food at a good price. With her earnings she helps with her household costs. 

The young woman is applying for a loan which will allow her to buy everything necessary to make her sandwiches and hamburgers, such as: bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadellas and other ingredients. In this way she will be able to have higher earnings and continue helping at home with any costs that emerge.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadellas, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to fix the roof of the veranda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bedroom set for more comfort.

loans.name: Sotheara

texts.en:
Sotheara is a 26-year-old nursing student and a married cook’s assistant with a small child. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Having been in this work since 2007, she can earn approximately $12 a day. Her husband is 27 years old, a teacher at a public school earning approximately $6 per day. 

Now Sotheara would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. 

In the future, she is going to run a small clinic, support her child to go to university, and build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 41 years. She is single and blessed with three children. She stays with her sister, who helps provide additional income through horticulture.

Virginia sells groceries and fruits, and also makes and sells tea as a side business. She has done these businesses for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 15,000.

She has requested a loan of Kshs. 20,000, which she will use to buy assorted vegetables and fruits to sell. With the anticipated profits, Virginia will be able to repay her loan, as well as make more savings.

Virginia's hopes and dreams are to live a successful life.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Rachael is married, and has four children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for 30 years now, and she is currently growing maize, beans, bananas and sunflower. Rachael is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Rachael’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Rachael’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, sand, sheeting, etc. in order to finish building her bathroom.

loans.name: Simika Group

texts.fr: Madame Ngoza est trésorière dans Simika, un groupe de crédit. Femme forte et entrepreneur, elle est âgée de 52 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un agriculteur. La cliente est une vendeuse des maïs et de la farine de manioc depuis plus de 17ans. Le nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter 13 sacs de mais. Son vouloir est  d’ouvrir un dépôt et ravitailler les détaillants.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour lui avoir appris à épargner.
texts.en: Ngoza is the treasurer of the Simika loan group. A strong and entrepreneurial woman, she is 52 years old and the mother of 5 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a farmer. Ngoza has been selling maize and cassava flour for over 17 years. This new loan will enable her to buy 13 bags of maize. She would like to open a warehouse and to supply retailers. She thanks Hekima for having taught her how to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy 13 bags of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for his work, and an appliance for his house.

loans.name: Sombédia Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Sombédia travaille avec ACFIME depuis 05 ans. ces femmes battantes respectent leur date de remboursement. Djénéba responsable du groupe est vendeuse des légumes en gros depuis 7 ans dans le marche de fruits et légumes à Bobo Dioulasso. Elle est marié, mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés et son mari est boucher. Ce prêt pourrait permettre à cette brave dame d'acheter des légumes de bonne qualité auprès des producteurs et vendre en gros à ses clients qui les revendront en détail.Les bénéfices lui serviront à solder la scolarité de ses enfants et de continuer son commerce
texts.en: The Sombédia group has been working with ACFIME for 5 years. These resilient women respect their repayments deadlines. Djénéba, the group leader, has been selling vegetables wholesale for over 7 years at the fruit and vegetable market in Bobo Dioulasso. She is married and the mother of 3 children, who all attend school. Her husband is a butcher. This loan could allow this good woman to buy good quality vegetables from the farmers and resell them wholesale to her clients, who will resell them to retail customers. The profits will be used to ensure her children's education and to keep running her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Morales Group

texts.es:
Ricarda es una mujer de 62 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos dos varones de 36, 26 años y dos mujeres de 30, 28 años, y su negocio es la venta de gelatina de forma ambulante.
Ella es independiente, responsable, constante y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Ricarda es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello gris largo, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español (al centro).  Su vida la comparte con su esposo que es jubilado minero y su hija mayor que es independiente en una casa propia que cuenta con servicio de agua, luz y gas. Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, formó un grupo de personas que se dedican a la artesanía y comercio de ropa de cama, para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de gelatinas; preparadas en un vaso plástico y con una cuchara descartable, empezó hace tres años vendiendo en una feria muy popular y conocida, continuó vendiendo en otras ferias y su negocio fue prosperando. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos, el anterior fue pagado a tiempo y sin problemas. Ella sueña tener su puesto fijo de venta para ya no tener que caminar porque se cansa rápido y desea realizar una inversión en la compra de un puesto de venta fijo para ya no tener que vender ambulantemente.
Es por esos motivos que Ricarda solicita un préstamo para la compra de un puesto de venta fijo de gelatina y dejar de vender ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Ricarda is a 62-year-old woman who is married with 4 children: 2 men who are 36 and 26 years old, and 2 women who are 30 and 28 years old. Her business is selling jelly, which she does on foot.

She is independent, responsible, reliable and hard-working. She carries out her work in the ’16 de julio’ area, characterised by its trade in all areas.

Ricarda has a tanned complexion, small height and long grey hair. Her native language is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish (in town). She shares her life with her husband, who is a retired miner, and her eldest daughter, who is independent living in her own home which has water, electricity and gas supplies.

Due to the need to expand her business she formed a group with people who work in crafts and bedclothes sales, in order to apply for a loan. Her business is selling jelly, prepared in a plastic glass and with a disposable spoon. She started three years ago, selling in a very popular and well-known fair, then continued selling in other fairs as her business prospered. 

This is their second loan cycle; the previous loan was repaid on time and without any problems. She dreams of having a fixed sales post so that she no longer has to walk around, as she gets tired quickly. It's for this reason that Ricarda is applying for a loan, to invest in a fixed sales point so that she no longer has to walk around to sell.

loans.use: to buy a fixed sales post for selling jelly, and stop having to walk around to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Aida lives with her family in the town of Palompon, Leyte. Aida has helped her husband with their fishing business. For more than 23 years, fishing has provided them the income that they need. 

For now, Aida would like to borrow a loan to buy a new fishing boat and nets. This loan will enable them to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Aida plans onexpanding their fishing venture so that it will augment their earnings. She also wants to save money to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries and vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Phylis is married and has eight children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty-one years now. She is currently growing maize, beans and bananas and she also keeps cattle. Phylis is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Phylis’ first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family’s needs and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school while one is still young. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Shohin

texts.ru: Шохин проживает на районе Рудаки. Ему 24 года. Он живет вместе с мамой, сестренкой и женой. Шохин хочет начать новую деятельность. Он будет заниматься продажей овощей и фруктов. Шохин имеет свой бизнес план и с готовым бизнес планом обратился за кредитом. Шохин планирует купить овощи и фрукты и будет преподавать товар на рынке города Душанбе под названием "Зеленый Базар". Шохин также нашел точку продажи и оптовых продавцов. Он собранный, насчитанный и в себе уверенный молодой человек. Шохин уверен, что благодаря кредиту он купит достаточное количество фруктов, и сможет начать бизнес, и его деятельность будет процветать.
texts.en: Shohin lives in the Rudaki district. He is 24 years old and lives with his mother, sister, and wife. He wants to start a new business selling fruits and vegetables. Shohin has a business plan and is applying for a loan. He is planning to buy fruits and vegetables and sell them at the "Green Market" in Dushanbe. Shohin has also found wholesalers and a sales location. He is an organized, calculating and self-confident young person. He is sure that he will be able to buy enough fruit, start the business and become successful thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables and start a new retail business

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Carolyn is married and has six children. She runs her own business and she also does farming. She has been farming for twenty-two years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, bananas and sunflowers. Carolyn is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Carolyn’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Carolyn’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Eunice is married and has five children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for fourteen years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and sweet potatoes and she also keeps poultry. Eunice is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey. 

This is Eunice’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and to invest in business. Eunice’s hope for the future is to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Teresa is married and has seven children. She is an evangelist as well as a farmer. She has been farming for thirty-five years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and bananas. Teresa is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food and medicine.

This is Teresa’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to support her Evangelism Ministry. Teresa’s hope for the future is to live a good life in the Lord.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Rose is married and has four children. She is a nurse. She also does farming. She has been farming for fifteen years now and she is currently growing maize, millet and bananas. Rose is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Rose’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and to start a small business. Rose’s hope for the future is to live a good and healthy life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 45-year-old man, married to Emily who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  David has been operating a butcher shop business for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

David is now servicing his second loan of KES. 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy cows to slaughter to have meat to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

David plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to his children and  hopes to provide the best education to his children.

loans.use: To buy cows to slaughter and sell  the meat to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and other items to sell beer and soda

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 55 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales como actividad principal. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza nuestro Jorge es el servicio de albañilería, la actividad la realiza desde hace más de 15 años, en el distrito y anexos. El destino del crédito será para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como escalera, tablas, mezcladores, entre otros, los mismos que le servirán como herramientas de trabajo para el servicio que realiza además de darle un valor agregado a este. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que Jorge cuenta con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales. Y además él piensa trabajar otorgando buen servicio en base a buena mano de obra y así seguir siendo recomendado por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 55 years old and is married. He has four adult children. He lives in his own house with his wife in the district of La Matanza. Life in the district goes on peacefully. With respect to businesses and other activities there, the inhabitants work in agriculture, livestock, and raising animals as their principal activities. This district is located in the province of Morropón, in the region of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

The work that our Jorge does is masonry service. He has been doing this for more than 15 years in the district and its adjoining areas. The purpose of the loan will be to make the purchase of construction materials such as a ladder, boards, and mixers, among other items, which will serve him as working tools for the service that he performs, in addition to giving an added value to this. The market presents good prospects, thanks to which Jorge has very good work and personal references. In addition, he plan to work offering good service based on good workmanship and thus continue being recommended by his customers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 23-year-old single man who opened  a coffee shop seven years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family that consists of two members.

Youssef is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying desperately to increase his income and develop his business, thus he is now acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field Partner Al Majmoua to open a cell phone shop as a second source of income.

Youssef hopes to expand his two businesses more in the future to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to open a cell phone shop as a second source of income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Umitoy

texts.ru:
Умитой жительница кишлака Навкент. Замужем, имеет детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается животноводством. 
Умитой сотруничает с нашей организацией с 2013 года. Умитой с мужем решили купить теленка на зиму и откармливать до весны. Но для этого им не хватает денежных средств и решили обратится в МДО Арванд. ОНа заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Umitoy lives in the village Navkent. She is married, has children, and raises livestock witht her husband. She has been working with the organization since 2013. Umitoy and her husband have decided to buy a calf to fatten up during the winter, but they do not have enough money. They decided to apply for a loan with MDO Arvand. Umitoy thanks the organization in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Navil

texts.es:
Navil tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho distrito está ubciado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Navil se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche, desde hace más de 7 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para su ganado. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Navil, 33, lives with his wife and children in his own house in a large community in the urban area of Zaña, located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  He has good personal and professional references from his neighbors.  The community works primarily in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Navil earns a living raising cattle and selling milk.  He has seven years of experience in the business, which is at his own home.

He's requesting a loan to buy balanced fattening feed for his cattle so he can expand his business.  In the short term, this will allow him to improve his income and increase his profits, thus improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced fattening feed for his cattle

loans.name: Biyea Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI est la représentante du groupe BIYEA II. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé à 17ans.  02 vont  à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Madame est coiffeuse depuis 2004 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle  veut s’acheter 20 paquets de mèche et 02 pots de gèles fichateurs.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son salon de coiffure et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fati is the representative of the Biyea II group. She is married and the mother of four. Her eldest child is 32 years old, and the youngest is 17 years old. Two of her children are still in school. She has two dependents.

Mrs. Fati has been working as a hairdresser since 2004. She stocks up at her neighborhood market. Her customers are local women. 
She would like to buy 20 packs of hair extensions and two jars of adhesive gel.
Mrs. Fati would like to add the resulting revenue to her savings. Her goal is to expand her hairdressing business and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 packs of hair extensions and two jars of adhesive gel.

loans.name: Songre Nooma De Kokologho Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZARA est la représentante du groupe SONGRE NOOMA DE KOKOLOGHO.  Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgé a 16 ans.  01 va  à l’école. 
Madame est commerçante de céréales depuis20 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Elle  veut s’acheter 02 sacs d’arachides, 04sacs d’haricots et 02sacs de mils.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider à l’épanouissement de la famille. Elle ambitionne aider ses enfants et devenir une grande commerçante de céréales.
texts.en:
Azara is the representative of the group Songre Nooma de Kokologho. She is married and the mother of 6 children. The oldest of her children is 23 years old, and the youngest is 16. One of Azara's children currently attends school.

Azara has been in the business of selling cereals for 20 years. She stocks up in the neighboring villages.

Azara would like to purchase 2 bags of ground nuts, 4 bags of beans, and 2 bags of millet. She wants to use her profits to help provide for her family. She hopes to help her children and to become a successful seller of cereals.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of ground nuts, 4 bags of beans, and 2 bags of millet

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. Mathew is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty.

As a result of his previous loan for farm inputs, Mathew expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after the harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

Mathew is requesting another loan from Babban Gona, which he will use to store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This loan will allow him to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare. Mathew plans to use the additional income to educate his children, and ultimately, to ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time

loans.name: Sheilla

texts.en:
Sheilla lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Sheila is married and has six children. She runs her own business, and she also does farming. She has been farming for fourteen years now, and she is currently growing maize, vegetables, potatoes, cassava and bananas. Sheilla is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Sheilla’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her business and provide for her family’s needs. Sheilla’s hope for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Tryphena

texts.en:
Tryphena lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Tryphena is married and has nine children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for 35 years now, and she is currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, and potatoes and she also keeps cattle and poultry. Tryphena is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for medicine.

This is Tryphena’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children and buy more cows. Tryphena’s hope for the future is to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Taprandich

texts.en:
Taprandich lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Taprandich is single with nine children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for six years now and he is currently growing maize, potatoes, cassava, vegetables, and bananas. Taprandich is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food. 

This is Taprandich’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for her family’s needs. Taprandich’s hope for the future is to live a happy and healthy life in her old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Nua Ngam 1 Group

texts.en:
Dao, 23, is a Thai lady who is married with a son who is 5 years old. She has lived with her husband and her son in a small house for two years. Their main production is agriculture, such as cultivating rice and corn and raising chickens and buffalo. 

Dao's son will be at grade 1 next year, so she believes that the expenses for the family will increase significantly, which motivates Dao and her husband to work harder and earn more. To do that, Dao has taken a loan in the Anh Chi Em Program to buy goats to diversify her business. 

This is her third loan in the program, and she believes the loan will be useful for her, just like the previous loan, which she used to hire a machine to level the field before the harvest. She said that she heard much from other people in the village about how Anh Chi Em helps them resolve partially their difficulties of lacking capital. 

Dao hopes that her business plan will go well and she could afford to send her child to school. In the picture, she wears a horizontal striped shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Daniel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child, Obadiya. Daniel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Daniel expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Daniel to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Daniel said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my child is educated and is able to get a professional job."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
A 46-year-old married woman, Evelyn operates a small sari-sari (variety) store to earn an income. With five children, Evelyn works really hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for their children's schooling. Evelyn is also engaged in a fishing business with her husband.

As of now, Evelyn needs additional capital for her store. With this purpose, she requested to take a loan  to buy a new boat engine and additional stock for the store, like soap and detergents, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and condiments, among others. This loan will enable Evelyn to improve her store as well as their fishing business. She hopes that it will help in improving their livelihood.

Evelyn wants to make their business a successful and profitable one. Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and additional stock for the store, like soap and detergents, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and condiments, among others

loans.name: Silvia Rosa

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Silvia es que sus hijos pueden tener una vida plena y esperanzas para salir adelante.
Ella prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de La Dorada, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de sillas, mesas, insumos y materia prima para la preparación de sus recetas.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos siempre disponibles para sus clientes y podrá atenderlos de una forma más cómoda prestando así un mejor servicio.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia's children can have a full life with hopes to better themselves thanks to her perseverance and courage. She prepares and sells fast food in the town of La Dorada, a business which she set up with the ambition of seeking a new source of income to sustain her family. 

Her husband and her children are her greatest motivation to work every day and strive to better herself.

She hopes to be able to boost her business with the purchase of chairs, tables, ingredients and staple items for the preparation of her recipes.

With these things she will be able to have her food readily available for her clients and will be able to attend to them in a more comfortable way, thereby offering a better service.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same area, so that she won't lose her clients.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and ingredients for her recipes.

loans.name: Bibizilol

texts.en:
Bibizilol is married and has six children. She always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life. She decided to start a new business with buying and selling clothes. She will sell a variety of women's clothes in a local market. Bibizilol’s elder son will help her with selling clothes. 

She studied at the course called "To Get Ahead" by the women's organization and got enough skills about business. She will be a very successful businesswoman, as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy clothes for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes for organizing a new business of selling clothing

loans.name: Samsiyya

texts.en:
Samsiyya is 33 year old married with two kids. She and her family are refugees, and they have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. 

Samsiyya is a farmer. She raises fruits (apples, pears, etc.) and vegetables (cucumbers, onions, potatoes, and greens) and then sells them at the local bazaar. She has worked in this field for 10 years, and her monthly salary is 220 AZN.

People like eating fruits and vegetables. They know that fresh fruits and vegetables are useful for health. They use fruits to prepare juice or jam and cook different kinds of soups and dishes using vegetables. They prefer buying fruits and vegetables from private gardens because it’s cheaper. 

Samisiyya doesn’t earn enough money to cover her big family’s demands. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers and new sorts of fruit tree seeds. She wants to provide good education for her children and make their life as easy as possible.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and new sorts of fruit tree seeds

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio la socia continua vendiendo lo que son  manzanas, platanos,naranjas y uvas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cleofe continues working in her fruit selling business. She has been working in this business for years and it's going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day. She continues to sell apples, plantains, oranges and grapes. She wants to be able to carry on working and, in so doing, continue to support her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy apples and oranges, amongst other fruits.

Cleofe is grateful for the loan that has been granted her, and she pledges to comply with the repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges and other fruits.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 64 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, en el caserío de Cabramayo, dedicado a los servicios de maestros de construcción. Vive junto con su cónyuge en una zona rural del distrito. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho caserío esta ubicado en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Segundo es maestro de construcción, brinda este servicio desde hace 10 años en su Caserío Cabramayo. Solicita crédito para compra de herramienta de construcción, pues desea comprar una mezcladora de cemento. Lo que le va a permitir mejorar su servicio y darle un valor agregado a este. Segundo posee conocimiento en el negocio. El préstamo le va ayudar a captar más clientes por el valor agregado que va a ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 64 years old and lives with his wife in the small village of Cabramayo. He works in construction services. He and his wife live in a rural area of the district. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, ranching and business. This small village is located in the district of Colasay, Jaén Province in the Cajamarca Region of the northern sierra of Peru.

Segundo is an expert in construction, offering this service in the small village of Cabramayo for 10 years. He is requesting the loan to purchase construction tools. He wishes to buy a cement mixer which will allow him to improve his service with added value.

Segundo possesses knowledge in this business. The loan will help him acquire more customers for the added value he will be able to offer them. In a short time this will allow him to improve his income, increase his profit and therefore improve quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools. He wishes to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Belen Betzaida

texts.es:
Belen Betzaida tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Belen Betzaida se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, cuyes, entre otros), desde hace 03 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo pues desea realizar la compra de patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes. El préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Belen Betzaida is 31 years old. She is married and has two children in her care. She lives in a house belonging to her family, in a rural zone of the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The people in her community mainly work in agriculture, livestock raising, and commerce. 

Belen Betzaida works raising and selling small domestic livestock (ducks and guinea pigs, among others). She has done this work for three years. Her business is located in her home. She is requesting the loan for working capital, since she would like to buy ducks, hens, turkeys and guinea pigs. The loan will help her have a greater diversity of animals, with the aim of expanding her small livestock business and satisfying her customers' needs. This will permit her to improve her income within a short time, increase her profits, and ultimately improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy ducks, hens, turkeys and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yahuza joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mahammadu, Sabutu and Minzali. Yahuza is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to end the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Yahuza expects to reap up to 30 bags per hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Yahuza to generate earnings of up to $1,000 per hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Yahuza said, "I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de plátanos y ocas al horno, la socia vende  todos sus clientes que le solicita, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de platanos.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sofia continues to work in her business selling baked bananas and ocas. She sells all her clients whatever they ask for. 

She has been working in this business for years, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She wants to be able to carry on working and, in so doing, continue to support her family.

Sofia is asking for the loan to buy bananas.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende galletas, dulces, gaseosas y chocolates, la socia continua vendiendo de forma ambulatoria, lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetines, chocolates entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This group member continues to work in her business selling sweets. She sells cookies, candies, soft drinks, and chocolates. This group member is still doing her selling as a street vendor, has been doing this work for years and it's been going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wants to continue working so that she can continue to support her family. This group member is requesting a loan to purchase lollipops and chocolates, among other things. She's grateful to those that are taking part in this dream through this platform, and she's committed to making her payments within the stipulated time period.

loans.use: To purchase lollipops and chocolates, among other things.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman, and she lives in a rental home with her family. She has had a motorcycle transport business for more than three years. She operates from door-to-door. Fatuma is a very self-sacrificing woman. Previously she did side jobs, which earned her another source of living.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of a second-hand motorcycle. This would enable her to better meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Isah and Mannaseh. Rahila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for crop inputs, Rahila expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize. That is double the national average of 14 bags/hectare.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this new loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time. She will be able to sell it a few months later, for a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This will enable Rahila to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Rahila said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, such as child school fees, food, and/or farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de comida, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los paraderos de autobús de la ciudad, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en: This group member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" community bank. She continues to work in food sales, and is still selling at one of the city's bus stops. This group member still wants to work so that she can continue supporting her family. She's requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as rice, oil, and meat among other things. This group member is happy with the loan provided and is grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as rice, oil, and meat, among other things.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose  al negocio de transporte, él socio  lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio traslada a sus clientes a los lugares que le solictan,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para hacer el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working in transport.  He has been doing this for years and he is successful thanks to the hard work he dedicates to his job every day.  He takes his customers anywhere they want.  

He would like to continue working so that he can carry on looking after his family.  He is asking for a loan to service his car.  

He is happy with the loans and he promises to meet the instalments to pay it off.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de mates naturales ,la socia continua vendiendo de forma ambulatoria todos los días tanto en las mañanas como en las tardes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como manzanas, maiz, entre otros.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank 'Madres Trabajadoras' (Working Mothers) and she is still selling natural drinks.  She sells on the streets every day, both in the mornings and in the afternoons.  

She hopes to continue working so that she can look after her family.  

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as apples and corn among other things.  She is happy with the loans and gives thanks to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as apples and corn among others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose al negocio de transporte, el socio lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al  empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower continues working in the transportation business. He has been in the business for several years and is doing well because he spares no effort and works every day at it. His wish is to carry on so as to keep supporting his family. He asks for a loan to perform maintenance on his taxi. He is happy for the loan and promises to be punctual in his repayments.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose  a ejercer su carrera de docente, la socia lleva años trabajando en su carrera el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia trabaja en uno de los jardines de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales didácticos.
La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to dedicate herself to her career as a teacher. She has spent years working in this field, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work every day. She works in one of the preschools of the city of Cusco. She would like to continue working in order to keep supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan in order to buy educational materials. 

The borrower is happy about the loan provided to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Jose Segundo

texts.es:
Jose Segundo tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Jose Segundo se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes; con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Él solicita préstamo para compra de más animales(pavos, cuyes, conejos, etc), dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Jose Segundo piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Segundo is 55 years old and single with no children. He lives with his family in a rural area of the Oyotún District, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the north coast of Perú. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, ranching and business.

José Segundo works raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chickens and guinea pigs, with more than 15 years of experience in this business, located in back of his home.

He is requesting the loan to buy more animals - turkeys, guinea pigs, rabbits, etc. This investment will help him to have a greater variety and productivity and have a strong impact on the business. Jose Segundo plans to increase his stock of animals to cater to the varying needs and tastes of the customers in the area. In a short time this will allow him to improve his income, increase his profit and therefore improve quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals - turkeys, guinea pigs, rabbits, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.es:
Herminda es una mujer con gran empuje y emprendimiento, desde que vive con su esposo se determino a encontrar una actividad que le generar buenos ingresos y que le permitiera ser independiente, es así como desde hace 1 año inicio con un negocio de bar en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá.

Es un negocio bastante popular en el sector y se ha convertido en punto de encuentro para adultos.

Con tan poco tiempo en el mercado ya tiene cierto nivel de reconocimiento gracias a la buena gestión de Herminda que siempre pone su empeño y dedicación en sacar este negocio adelante.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas y así ampliar su capacidad para atender a más personas y quiere hacer su negocio mucho más atractivo y cómodo para sus clientes.

Ella ofrece trabajo a una familiar y desea generar otros empleos.
texts.en: Herminda is full of enterprising spirit. She got married and is now determined to find a business that provides a decent income and enables her to be independent. One year ago, she started a pub in Puerto Bocayá. The place is now well-known and attracts many customers. It is a testament to Herminda's skills as an entrepreneur, as well as to her determination and efforts, that her pub garnered such a reputation so quickly. She asks for a loan in order to buy tables and chairs and thus sit more customers. Her aim is to make the pub even more attractive and comfortable. She employs a family member and wants to create more jobs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her pub.

loans.name: Rouba

texts.en:
Rouba is a 26-year-old married mother of three children. She works hard to support her husband and beloved family in their living by taking good care of them and preparing their necessary living needs. 

Rouba is a housewife. She takes good care of her house and family and provides her beloved husband a peaceful family life. 

Today, Rouba is acquiring this loan to pay school tuition fees for her beloved children. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees for students whose families have low incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

loans.use: To pay school tuition fees for her beloved children

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old married father of 3 children. 

Ali started working a year ago as a transporter and distributor in order to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his family.

However, due to Ali's limited salary, he is now requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

In the future, Ali hopes to buy a van of his own, and continue to distribute goods, in order to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de cabinas de internet, la socia también continua dedicándose a su negocio de llamadas telefonicas tanto nacionales como locales,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevos celulares.
La socia sale en la foto con una de sus hijas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This group member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" community bank, and is still working in her Internet cafe business. She also still works in her phone call business, both national and international calls. This group member wants to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family. She's requesting a loan to purchase new cell phones. In the photograph the group member is pictured with one of her daughters. She's grateful for the loan provided and is committed to making the stipulated payments.

loans.use: To purchase new cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair oils including relaxers

loans.name: Grupo Las Conquistadoras Tzanjuyup Group

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 26 años de edad residente en Suchitepéquez, soltera con un  hijo de cuatro años de edad,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia.
