(María es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda la que tiene puesta una blusa de color negro con tallados en la fotografía)

La actividad que realiza María es la fabricación de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas y los pone a la venta en la comunidad donde ella vive ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de frutas, ella siempre trata la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a su hijo el estudio que se merece y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que María le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de hilos para la elaboración de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

María y un grupo de mujeres más sueñan con alcanzar sus sueños en la vida que es llegar a superarse en la vida y ver por los demás que los necesitan para superarse.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a su hijo en la escuela y llegar a ser un profesional  en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
María's an enterprising 26-year-old woman who lives in Suchitepéquez.  She's single and has a 4-year-old son.  She has to make a huge effort to be able to support her family and see how to improve their finances.  (She's the first person on the right in the photograph; she's wearing a black blouse with a diamond design.)

María's job is making traditional güipiles [blouses], skirts, and sashes, and selling them in the community where she lives.  It's an important source of income for her family, to be able to improve their current living conditions in her community.  She has a second job selling fruit.  She always tries to have a way to earn extra income to be able to give her son the education he deserves so he can become a professional in life.

María will use her part of the loan to buy thread to make traditional güipiles, skirts, and sashes to sell in her community and to neighbors.  That way she'll earn a better income for herself and her family.

María and a group of women dream most of realizing their life dream of improving themselves in life and of seeing that they need others to do so.  One of her goals for the future is to buy a retail space in her community where she can sell her merchandise and see her son grow in school, become a professional in life, and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Grupo Las Unidas De Aldea Xojola Group

texts.es:
En Suchitepéquez existe una variedad de negocios donde la gente puede escoger donde consumir sus necesidades diarias.  Pero lo importante no es la cantidad de consumo sino la calidad de esos servicios al cliente.

Gladys mujer de 26 años se ha dedicado, con su tienda de abarroterías, servir al público con una calidad de servicio.  Se necesita una vocación especial para ello y Gladys lo tiene porque es una de las negociantes más buscadas en su negocio. (Gladys es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía) 

Dos razones le han motivado para solicitar  un préstamo: ampliar su negocio de abarrotería por la cantidad de clientes que le buscan y la necesidad que tiene de construir una casa para sus dos hijos.

Ella es un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han decidido a emprender los negocios junto a Gladys para que ellas tengan una condición de vida adecuada.
  
Las aspiraciones que ella tiene es la ampliación de su tienda para obtener mejores ganancias y para la construcción de su casa para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
In Suchitepéquez there are a variety of businesses where the public can choose where to buy their basic daily household products.  However, the most important thing is not the quantity of products on offer, but the quality of the service given to the consumers. 

Gladys, 26, is dedicated to offering the public a quality service in her convenience store.  To do this requires a special personality and skills which Gladys has got because she has one of the most sought after stores in her line of work.  

Gladys appears first on the right in the photograph.  

She has decided to ask for a loan for two reasons.  Firstly, she wants to expand her business due to the number of customers she caters for.  Secondly, she wants to build a home for her two children.

She sets an example in her community, which is why the group of women have decided to set up their businesses together with Gladys so that they can have a suitable standard of living for themselves.  

She would like to expand her store so she can generate more profit and she hopes to build a house so that her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to expand her convenience store.

loans.name: Ivan Renato

texts.es:
Ivan es un joven luchador y muy emprendedor, soltero y vive en Huaraz junto a su familia. Desde hace algunos años trabaja en una empresa de fabricación de cocinas, él labora por un aproximado de 10 horas diariamente y cree que le está yendo bien por su gran trabajo, porque siempre está dispuesto a seguir aprendiendo, es muy atento y responsable.
En sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con su familia y así relajarse luego de un largo día de trabajo. Ivan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una cámara fotográfica y así guardar todos los recuerdos de las salidas con su familia para siempre. Él seguirá luchando para darle mayor bienestar a su familia y más adelante poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Ivan is a young, hard-working man, full of enterprising spirit. He is single and lives in Huaraz with his family. He has been working for a company that makes kitchen appliances for a few years. He works about ten hours a day and thinks he is faring well thanks to the fact that he spares no efforts, is always eager to learn new things, pays attention and is dependable. In his spare time, he enjoys taking walks with his family, all the better to help him relax after a long day at work. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, since thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a camera and thus capture precious memories of his time with his family. He will keep fighting to give his family the best standard of living he can afford and dreams of one day owning a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy a camera for his family.

loans.name: Cenaida Amparo

texts.es:
Cenaida es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como almuerzos típicos de Colombia.

Estos alimentos los prepara y vende desde su casa principalmente a vecinos del sector donde vive y quienes conocen la sazón de Cenaida, saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.
 
Cenaida desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas Como ingredientes.
 
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Cenaida is a humble and hard-working woman who has dedicated a great part of her life to taking care of her children. She lives in the municipality of La Dorada, where she does spectacular work in the kitchen, since her business is preparing traditional Colombian meals that customers can order for lunch.   

She prepares and sells these foods from her home, chiefly to neighbors in the area where she lives and those who are familiar with the way she seasons her cooking. They know that they will always obtain food that is delicious and very well-prepared. 

Cenaida would like to expand her food sales business, and she would like to work in a more convenient manner. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in order to continue preparing her recipes. 

This loan will allow her to make progress with her business, so that she can obtain the income she needs to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy traditional ingredients to continue preparing lunches to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Maria Mercedes sigue dedicándose  al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en la plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group member Maria Mercedes still has her grocery store.  She has been in this business for years and it is going well thanks to her dedication every day.  She would like to carry on working so she can look after her family.  

She is asking for a loan to buy milk, rice, oil and other things.  She is very grateful for the loan and she promises to pay off the instalments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice and oil among other things.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de librería y a la vez continua trabajando como asistenta social, la socia vende diferentes tipos de libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, fólderes entre notros  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar hojas, cuadernos, plumones entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member still has her bookstore, which she combines with her social care work.  She sells different types of books, notebooks, pencils, folders and other things like that.  She would like to continue working so that she can look after her family.  

She is asking for a loan to buy paper, notebooks, marker pens and other things.  She is very happy with the loans and she promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy paper, notebooks, marker pens and other things.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyugue y su hijo de 16 años el cual cursa secundaria en colegio nacional. Francisco es natural de la zona. Vive en una zona rural contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubciada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Francisco es el transporte de pasajeros mediante mototaxi, cuenta con unidad propia contando con clientela reconocida de la zona asi como el translado de deribados de construcción como arena, ripio. Francisco brinda este servicio en el caserio San Juan de la Vega y alrededores. Cuenta con más de 8 años dedicandose a esa actividad. Además se dedica a la cria y venta de cerdos ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningun problema.

El destino del crédito será para ivertir en hacer arreglos a su movilidad, con lo que él podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, para poder seguir generando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 58, lives in his own rustic home.  He lives with his spouse and 16 year old son, who attends secondary school.  Franciso is a native of the area, and lives in a rural area with water and electricity services.  His community is primarily engaged in farming, raising livestock, and business.  This community is located in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, which is located in the region of Cajamarca on the northern sierra of Peru.

Francisco is engaged in transporting passengers by motorcycle taxi.  He has his own vehicle, and has well-known customers in the area.  He also transports construction materials such as sand and gravel.  Francisco provides this service in the village of San Juan de la Vega and the surrounding area, and has been engaged in this activity for over eight years.  In addition, he is engaged in breeding and selling pigs, and this additional income will permit him to pay the loan without any problem.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in making repairs to his vehicle, which will enable him to ensure proper functioning of his work tool, and continue generating income.

loans.use: to invest in making repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her studies in gastronomy.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbours and college students. She faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during holiday seasons when schools have closed, she experiences a low customer turnout. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase manicure, pedicure, and facial kits, as well as relaxing chemicals, shampoo, and hair food. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loan requirements.

loans.use: to purchase manicure, pedicure, and facial kits, as well as relaxing chemicals, shampoo, and hair food

loans.name: Souleiman

texts.en:
Souleiman is a 38 year-old married father of six children, who has been working in a dairy products factory since 1998.

He is a hard working man who puts so much effort into develop his career to promote and increase his salary, to cover the increasing living needs of his family.  Souleiman's wife doesn't work. 

Today, Souleiman is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's school tuition fees.  Educating his children is his main aim, because he believes it can provide them with a brighter future.

He hopes that in the future he can open his own cow farm and start dairy production and sales.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia continua vendiendo  de forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos y personas que desean, la  socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de menestras, carnes, aceite entre otros.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en: The borrower belongs to communal bank Madres Trabajadoras (Working Mothers). She still sells food. She is a street vendor selling to her neighbors and to people who want her food. Her wish is to be able to keep working in order to continue providing for her family. She is asking for a loan in order to buy ingredients such as vegetables for soup, meat, and cooking oil, among others. She is happy with the loan and she is grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman and a mother of four children, from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in fishing business with her husband for more than 13 years.  This is the source of her income.

Irene is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets.  A loan will enable Irene and her husband to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Irene hopes to expand their business to generate more revenue for their sustenance and for their children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 31 years old and married to Ann. She also works and adds income to support their family. They are blessed with 2 children.  

Simon has been operating a retail shop for 3 years, earning an income of 15,000 KES each month.

Simon has now requested his second loan of 87,880 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy sugar, rice, tea leaves, and wheat and maize flours to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Simon plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot of land and build a permanent house for his family. He also hopes to expand his business and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, rice, and wheat and maize flours to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el Caserío Vista Alegre, dedicado al cultivo de café. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Alfredo se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 10 años. Su terreno esta ubicado en el caserío Vista Alegre. El destino del crédito es para comprar abonos, fertilizantes entre otros para mantenimiento de su finca. Manteniendo sus fincas obtendrá mayores rendimientos. Alfredo posee conocimientos en el cultivo de café por lo que se prevee una cosecha aceptable lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Alfredo, 27, is a coffee grower who lives with his wife and son in the Vista Alegre rural community in the district of Callayuc. The community lives off agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. It is in the Cajamarca Region in the northern reaches of Peru. Alfredo is a farmer who has grown coffee for the last ten years. His plantation is in the same community. He will use the loan to buy manure, fertiliser, and other supplies for his farm. This will enable him to increase his production. Alfredo is quite knowledgeable about coffee growing and relies on his skill to have a good harvest, which will grant him, in the short term, a better income. Thus, he will be able to improve his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertiliser, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres De Tonquin 1 Group

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos,  1 de ellos ya tiene familias diferentes y los dos últimos  vive con ella e estudian en la escuela de la comunidad donde ellos viven, ella es una mujer emprendedora y busca la forma de cómo sacar adelante su familia. (Rosario es la que se encuentra de 2da de izquierda a la derecha y la que tiene puesta una blusa de color blanco en la fotografía)

La actividad principal que realizan es la venta de tortillas ya que es una buena actividad para tener un ingreso económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la segunda actividad que realiza Rosario es la venta de enchiladas en su comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas  que habitan por el lugar.

Los fines con que ella desea realizar un préstamo, es para  la ampliación de la venta de tortillas que ella tiene para así poder tener mejores ingresos económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

En conjunto con un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras  que desean salir adelante decidieron formar parte del grupo de Rosario para tener un futuro mejor y de sus familias.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es ver que sus hijos se conviertan en un profesional en su comunidad y que tenga una vida mejor y un futuro de éxito.
texts.en:
Rosario, 26, is married and has three children.  One of them lives with a different family, but the other two live with her and study at the school in the area where they live.  She is an enterprising woman who looks for ways to take care of her family.  Rosario is the second from the left in the photograph and is wearing a white top.  

Her main business is selling tortillas, because it gives her a nice income which she can use to pay for her family expenses.  She also sells enchiladas in her community to the people who live there.  

She would like a loan to expand her tortilla making business so that she can generate more profit for her family.  

Some other women decided to form a group with Rosario so that they could also have a better future for themselves and their families.  

One of Rosario's greatest desires is to see her children become professional workers in her community and have a comfortable life and successful future.

loans.use: to expand her tortilla making business.

loans.name: Ahamed

texts.en:
Ahamed is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ahamed joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Saminu, Ladi and Ishaya. 

Ahamed is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Ahamed expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ahamed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahamed can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Ahamed to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Ahamed said,“ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Andrawus

texts.en:
Andrawus Adamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Andrawus Adamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Habakuk, Mathew and Matta. 

Andrawus Adamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Andrawus Adamu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Andrawus Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Andrawus Adamu can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Andrawus Adamu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Andrawus Adamu said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a bold farmer dedicated to the world of the land which he inherited from his parents. He gets up very early in the morning and works until the sun sets. 

He is a 34 year old veteran who only wants to serve his community with his healthy crops. He is blessed with three children who are his greatest motivation in life to persevere, because he wants to provide them a better future. 

Evans was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that his family faced. However, he never gave up and he has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Evans always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.”  Because of how much he likes farming he has even nicknamed one of his cows which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cow. 

Through his dairy cow, Evans is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps him support his family. Evans also practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. 

Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Evans is very visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. 

Evans believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his children a solid educational background. This loan will be Evans way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy, age 38, engages in fishing. He sells fish, crabs and clams, to members of his local community. He has been engaged in this business for almost four years. Randy lives with his family in Palompon, Leyte. He and his wife have one child, age 12.

Randy is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. He will use the loan to buy fishing net and pay for the repair of the motor boat. These things will help Randy increase his ongoing catch, and probably will improve his earnings.

In the future, Randy would like to expand his fishing business enough to support the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and pay for the repair of the motorboat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of dairy milk to sell, and household goods for the general store.

loans.name: Yuriku Jhoana

texts.es:
Yuriki Jhoana tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su hija de 3 años, en casa familiar, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí; goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Yuriki Jhoana se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 5 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en la parte posterior de su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para sus animales. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yuriki Jhoana is 24 years old, single, and lives with her 3 year old daughter in the family home in a community located in the rural district of Cayalti; she has good work references and personal references from her neighbors. Her community is basically dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and selling. The aforementioned district is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Yuriki Jhoana works in raising and selling animals, such as pigs, ducks, and guinea pigs in the rear area of her own residence and has over 5 years of experience in this business. She's requesting a loan to purchase nutritionally balanced feed to fatten her animals. In this way she would continue to grow her business, which would allow her to boost her income in the short term, increase her profits and thus improve she and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase nutritionally balanced feed for fattening her animals.

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
El es Germán, un hombre de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposa.

El se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de pandebonos desde hace aproximadamente 16 años de manera ambulante con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de forma empírica y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar un horno de microondas, una canasta nueva e ingredientes para los alimentos que prepara para vender.
 
Es un hombre que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
Germán is a man of character and good will, with the desire to make progress and better himself together with his wife.

Approximately 16 years ago he set out with lots of enthusiasm and drive to start up his business making and selling cheese breads as a mobile vendor.

He learned this business empirically, which means he has been able to obtain a lot of experience.

Nowadays he would like to give his business a little boost. For this reason he needs a loan to buy a microwave oven, a new basket and ingredients to make the food he sells.
 
He is a man who overcomes  challenges and bravely confronts them.

loans.use: to buy a microwave oven, a new basket and ingredients to prepare cheese breads.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Alheri, Suzanatu and Zainab. 

Iliya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution for ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Iliya expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare - more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Iliya said, “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses, including child school fees, food and farm loan repayments, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices, and thus increasing income by up to 37%

loans.name: Rabeccah

texts.en:
Rabeccah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Amos, Mercy and Daniel. 

Rabeccah is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution for ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, she expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rabeccah would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cater for her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabeccah can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows her to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare - more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Rabeccah said, 'I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately I hope to make more money for myself and my family.'

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses such as child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices, and thus increasing income by up to 37%

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, with one school-going child. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a clothes-selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Rahila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Manase and Dabora. Rahila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Rahila expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Rahila to generate earnings of up to USD 1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Rahila said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children and, ultimately, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty."

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses, children's school fees, food, and  farm loan repayments.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a married woman from Palompon, Leyte. She is 38 years old and has two children aged 12 and 19 years old. 

She works in fishing, and has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years. She catches fresh fish and sells it to members of her local community.  

Mylene is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 in order to buy fishing nets, an engine (for the motorboat), and a boat. With these materials, she will be able to improve her daily catch, and she hopes to provide her children with proper diets.

In the future, she would like to expand her fishing business for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, an engine (for the motorboat), and a boat

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has three children. Eden and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 21 years, now. This business has provided them the income that they need.

Eden would like to take a loan from CEVI. She said that she will use the loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and paint. This will help Eden and her husband to improve their catch. In the future, Eden hopes to make their business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start up a pig farm.

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMOR DE DIOS” iniciará el trigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mandiles y lana, venta de chamarras, venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de polleras, venta de chamarras de niños, venta de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de flecos y trenzas para mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, ya que le ayudaba en su negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de flecos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amor de Dios" is starting its 33rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  They meet in the Santiago II central office.  This group has 8 members, and is led by a board of directors where Antonia is the president. The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: selling wool and aprons, selling jackets, selling wool sweaters, selling traditional style skirts, selling children's jackets, and selling sports clothes.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesswomen in this group.  Antonia states that she joined Pro Mujer 4 years ago at the invitation of a friend who was a client of the institution.  Now she has a business selling fringes and braids for blankets.  She learned this business from her mother a number of years ago, because she used to help her in the family business.  Later she decided to start up her own business.

The loan that Antonia is taking now will be used to increase her capital (to buy fringe at wholesale).  She will buy her products from the sellers in the city of La Paz, and later sell them from her retail space.  By working in this way, she can generate resources to support her family financially, as she is a widow who has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Antonia answered that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fringe at wholesale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Farming, also called agriculture or husbandry, is the cultivation of animals and plants for food and other products used to sustain life. Agriculture continues to dominate Kenya’s economy, and is the largest contributor to Kenya’s gross domestic product. Daniel, 32, started farming approximately 11 years ago, and although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His half-acre of land, located in the Kenyenya area of Kenya, houses poultry and dairy cows.

Daniel passionately loves dairy farming. The Kenyenya area is populated, and has a ready market for dairy products. Daniel's biggest challenge is feeding his cows, which is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces, before it is mixed with other kinds of forage. This helps the animal's digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. Through this loan, Daniel will double his milk production.

Daniel has faced challenges trying to obtain financing. Now he feels relieved, knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva are there, to make his dream come true. Daniel chose Juhudi Kilimo, because the interest rate on their loans is low, and is on a reducing basis. Daniel underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, Daniel's income will increase and his life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for his family and a positive impact to the community.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter, a device which will help him feed his cows better, resulting in more milk production and income

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es:
Godofredo de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos dos de ellos están trabajando y tres estudiando. Él es agricultor, desde pequeño su papá le enseño a trabajar la tierra, también se dedica a criar ganado, engordarlos y venderlos, con él trabajan dos hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes y abonar sus cultivos de maíz. Desea mejorar su condición de vida ya que tendrá mas ingresos a través de su cultivo cuando se desarrolle en buen estado y que tenga un alto rendimiento.
texts.en: Godfredo is 43 years old, and has a fifth grade education.  Currently, he is in a common-law relationship, and has five children; two of them are working and three are studying.  He is a farmer and, as a young boy, his father taught him how to work the land.  He is also engaged in breeding livestock, which he fattens and sells.  His two children work with him.  He will use the loan he is requesting to purchase fertilizers and fertilize his corn crops.  He wishes to improve his living conditions as he will have more income through his cultivation when it is developed into good condition and has a high yield.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fertilize his corn crops.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 26 years old, married, and has two children. As a housewife, she works hard to support her husband and children by taking good care of them and preparing their necessary living needs. 

Madona requested a loan, which she will use to pay school tuition fees for her children. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees for students whose families have low incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for her children

loans.name: Ramona Margarita

texts.es:
Ramona vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Ramona tiene 72 años, vive con in sobrino ya que sus hijos mayores ya son independientes. Ramona trabaja en las tardes vendiendo cosméticos, ella recorre y visita a su clientela fija, cuenta ya con cinco años de experiencia, la conocen mucho en el sector. Ella es muy dedicada a su negocio, vende y hace promociones para que su clientela esté a gusto, también ppor las mañanas ella realiza limpieza en casas para incrementar sus ingresos.
Ramona está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería, con ello podrá comprar perfumes, cosméticos, desodorantes; ya que este mes es muy comercial y por ende bueno para sus ventas.
Acudió a Fundación Alternativa por referencias del sector, quién pudo ayudar a Ramona con este pequeño crédito, se siente muy agradecida con la Institución y con Kiva  porque con este dinero ella podrá crecer en su negocio  y a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramona lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city in the coastal region that has a pleasant climate.  This is a very commercial city which is also considered to be an inland port that connects the mountains with the coast.  Ramona is 72 years old.  She lives with a nephew, because her children are already grown and live independently.  Ramona works in the afternoons selling cosmetics.  She goes out and visits her regular customers.  She already has 5 years of experience with this business and is well-known in her neighborhood.  

Ramona is very dedicated to her business.  She sells and does promotions and keeps her customers happy.  In addition, she cleans houses in the mornings to make some extra money.  Ramona is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.  She will use the loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and deodorants, because this is a good month for sales and so this will boost her business.

Ramona came to the Fundacion Alternativa with references from her neighborhood, and they were able to help Ramona with this small loan.  Ramona feels very grateful to the institution and to Kiva, because with this loan she will be able to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat is from Tajikistan. It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature, since its scenery is very beautiful. Saltanat loves her country very much.

She is 49 years old. Saltanat is married and has six children. To make a living, she sells food items in the market. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns a little money for these activities. She works day by day, in the local market. She works around 10 hours a day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind, and she always loves what she does.

She is requesting a loan of 8000 Somoni, which will be used to buy more food items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Ismael Carlos

texts.es:
Ismael es un hombre muy trabajador, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace algunos años se dedica a brindar servicios de taxi en su ciudad natal, Ica. Su mayor motivación para salir adelante es su familia, por ellos es que lucha día a día y trabaja hasta de madrugada para poder brindarles un mejor futuro. En sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con sus seres queridos y saber cómo les va en el día a día.
Ismael quiere brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder arreglar su carro y realizar el mantenimiento respectivo, con esto el no tendrá inconvenientes al momento de transportar a sus clientes. Más adelante espera poder ahorrar un dinerito para poder abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Ismael is a hardworking man with a great desire to succeed.  For some years, he has been engaged in providing taxi services in his native city, Ica.  His family is his greatest motivation to succeed; day to day, he strives for them and works until dawn to be able to offer them a better future.  In his free time, he enjoys going for walks with his loved ones and hearing about how they are doing from day to day.

Ismael wishes to provide better service to his customers, and for this reason, he intends to use the loan to be able to repair his car and perform maintenance on it.  This way, he will not have problems when transporting customers.  Later, he hopes to save a little money and be able to open a store.

loans.use: to repair and perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Elena De Jesús

texts.es:
Elena de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, esta casada tienen 6 hijos de los cuales 4 están trabajando y dos se encuentran estudiando, de ella solo dependen los dos hijos que aun estudian, ella tiene un molino en su casa, esa es su fuente de ingreso desde hace 10 años y es muy reconocido en la comunidad, también tiene tienda en su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para lamina, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de una galera que le servirá para criar pollos y comprara pollos de engorde y concentrado.

 Sueña que su granja crezca y que tenga mas ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Elena, 52, has a 7th grade education.  She is married and has 6 children.  Four of her children are working, and two are in school.  Only the two children attending school are still her dependents.  Elena has a mill in her house.  This has been her source of income for 10 years, and her business is well-known in the community.  She also has a store in her house.

Elena is requesting a loan to buy sheets of corrugated metal, wood, and nails, to replace the roof on a shed where she will raise chickens.  She will also use the loan to buy chickens to fatten and chicken feed.

She hopes that her farm will grow so that she can have more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair the roof on a shed that she will use to raise chickens.  She will also buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 48 años de edad de estado civil, es soltera, reside en el distrito de Morropón junto a su madre de avanzada edad, es natural de la zona. La comunidad donde vive es un lugar en donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio. Su vivienda cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla María Elena es el alquiler de mototaxi para el transporte de servicio urbano. además también se dedica a la venta de comida, María Elena tiene a cargo 6 pensionistas a quienes le vende comida 2 veces al día, María Elena con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona donde vive. El destino del crédito será para la compra de carpas para su moto y renovar el motor de la misma, dado que esta unidad ya necesita mantenimiento, dandole mantenimiento a su unidad móvil podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 48 years old, single, lives in the Morropon district with her elderly mother and is a native of the region. The community where she lives is a place whose inhabitants work in agriculture, livestock, and business. Her residence is equipped with basic services like water and electricity. The aforementioned district is located in the Morropon province in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

The work that Maria Elena performs is motorcycle taxi service for urban transportation, and in addition she works in food sales. Maria Elena has 6 retirees that she sells food to twice a day. She's experienced in the field and has very good personal references and work references in the area where she lives. The loan will be used to purchase canopies for her motorcycle and repairs for its motor, since it currently requires maintenance. Providing maintenance to her vehicle would ensure proper functioning for her work vehicle and allow her to boost her income quickly, and increase her profits and thus improve she and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase canopies for her motorcycle and repair its motor, since it needs maintenance.

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Carmen es una señora de 35 años, vive con sus tres hijos, está separada de su ex conviviente, ya que a veces creemos estar junto a la persona indicada pero la convivencia mutua nos muestra aquellos detalles que pasan desapercibidos a primera vista, comenta Carmen; actualmente vive muy feliz con sus hijos, tienen casa propia en la vía Chone km 23 recinto Nuevo Israel, perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo, dirección en la que tiene ubicado su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como: Papas fritas con pollo, salchipapas, hamburguesas, hot dogs, asados, jugos entre otros, lo atiende todas las tardes sin fallar ningún día; tiene un bonito local.
Carmen ha ganado fama en el sector en el que radica gracias a que los productos que ofrece son de gran calidad y deliciosos esto la ha llevado a progresar; hoy en día ella busca acceder a un crédito y acude buscando el apoyo que ofrece la Fundación; logrando su objetivo ella está muy agradecida con Kiva quienes están haciendo que sus objetivos de superación personal y laboral se cumplan, con este crédito podrá comprar más mesas y sillas para mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Carmen is 35 years old and lives with her three children. She separated from her partner because Carmen says that sometimes, although we feel we are with the right person, living together shows you details that are missed at first glance. Now she is very happy living on her own with her children. They have their own home on Via Chone in Nuevo Israel, which belongs to the town of Santo Domingo. That is where her business is located. There she sells fast food like french fries and chicken or sausages, hamburgers, hot dogs, barbecued meat, fruit juice, and other items. She works there every evening without exception and her business is set up very nicely.

Carmen has gained recognition in the neighborhood where she lives because she offers high quality and delicious products. This has allowed her to move forward and today she is requesting a loan through Fundacion Alternativa. With their help she will be able to access financing. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because they are making it possible for her to achieve her business goals and improve herself personally. This loan will allow her to buy more chairs and tables to improve her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy floral arrangements and later sell them.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de l’habillement, de charbon et de divers.
Les femmes du groupe KOTOTALA sont à leur septième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile, des cartons de patte romane et des condiments chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente des plats se fait en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kototala group is composed of married women averaging 42 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Diola, Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell cooked dishes, clothing, charcoal and miscellaneous items.

The group members are on their seventh solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting a large customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso.
Our client Fanta, the first one from right to left in the photo, is illiterate. At present she works cooking food for sale. She plans to buy two bags of rice, three jugs of oils, some boxes of spaghetti and condiments from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her cooked dishes at the market, for cash, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Mirtha Soledad

texts.es:
Mirtha Soledad tiene 36 años, es casada, vive con su cónyuge en el Caserío Lagunas, muy conocida en el medio, por su labor de venta de abarrotes y por su labor de venta y crianza de animales. Vive en casa propia con cónyuge e hijos, cónyuge se dedica a trabajar como pescador artesanal. Mirtha Soledad es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada a la ganadería y agricultura, habitada por gente sencilla y amable. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Mirtha Soledad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes(arroz, azúcar, cafe, entre otros), y además a la venta y crianza de animales8patos, cuyes, conejos, ect) desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente. Adicionalmente trabaja en pollería los fines de semana (venta de pollos a la brasa). Ingresos adicionlaes que le permiten solventar el crédito sin inconvenientes. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería para negocio(arroz, azúcar, cafe, entre otros), con lo cual podrá aumentar sus ventas y también captará más clientes lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirtha Soledad is 36 years old, married, and lives with her spouse in the village of Lagunas. She is well known there for her work selling groceries, and for her work selling and raising animals. She lives in her own house with her husband and children, and her husband works as a traditional fisherman.

Mirtha Soledad has good personal and work references, and her family is very close. She lives in a community which is dedicated to livestock and agriculture and populated by easygoing and friendly people. This village is located in the Zaña district in the province of Chiclayo, found in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú. 

Mirtha Soledad works selling groceries (rice, sugar, coffee, among other things), and on top of this she sells and raises animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, etc. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. In addition, she works in a poultry restaurant on the weekends (selling roasted chicken). This provides an additional income which allows her to pay back her credit without any issues. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of commodities for her business (rice, sugar, coffee, etc), with which she will be able to increase her sales, and also gain more customers. In a short time, this will bring her increased earnings, and in the end will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase commodities for her business (rice, sugar, coffee, among other things).

loans.name: Nua Ngam 2 Group

texts.en:
Hoa is a member of Nua Ngam 2 Group. She is 29 years old and married, with two children: a boy of 11 years and a girl of 5 years. They live in a small house and work at agricultural production, such as cultivating rice, planting fruit trees, and raising ducks. Their life would go well and steadily, if Hoa's husband didn't get a gastric ulcer which costs lots of money for treatment. This motivates Hoa to expand business. 

To have capital for the expanding, Hoa has taken out a loan from Entrepreneurs du Monde - Anh Chi Em and she will use the loan to buy a lawn mower, to prepare the land for cultivating. She said that she also had difficulty in paying tuition fees for her children, so she hoped that the business would bring lots of profits for her family and they can live more sufficiently. 

Hoa dreams that her children will study in universities, get good jobs, and have a brighter future than her. 

In the picture, she wears a blue shirt and stands in the first line, on the right.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Es el trabajo de Santos de 45 años de edad  soltero y cuenta con 3 hijos el primer  hijo ya tiene vida independiente y los dos últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que Santos realiza es la siembra de zanahoria. Dicha actividad lo realiza en su comunidad donde el vive, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con conocimiento de manejo en la agricultura que lo heredo de su padre. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad.

El uso que Santos le dará al crédito es para la compra de semillas de zanahorias y abonos químicos e orgánicos para que su producción se de zanahorias sea buena este año.  Uno de los grandes sueños de el es la construcción de unos cuartos para sus hijos y para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
The farming business is best suited to people who love the earth like a mother, like something that gives you a future in life and gives hope for the next generations. Santos, who is 45 years old, is a farmer. He is single and has three children. The oldest lives on his own and the two younger ones attend the local school.
	
Santos works growing carrots in his community. He sells his product at the local market in Sololá. He chose this line of work because he learned farming skills and knowledge from his father. His second job is working as a laborer in his community.

Santos will use this loan to buy carrot seeds and both chemical and organic fertilizer. This will help him obtain a good carrot crop this year. One of his main goals is to build some rooms for his children so they can have more adequate living conditions. He would also like to see his children have a career in the future.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and both chemical and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo Lomas De San Cristobal Group

texts.es:
Dúo lomas de San Cristóbal 
El cual esta integrado por la señora Juana de 38 años de edad y Suly de 37 años de edad y quien tambien es madre de 4 niños y propietaria de una venta de tortillas ubicado en lomas de san Cristóbal  ella es una señora muy emprendedora la cual lucha día con día para poder llevar a cabo los sueños  y las metas que ella tiene ya que desea que sus hijos y familia tenga mejores recursos con los que ella creció y esa es la razón por la cual ella se esfuerza día con día para poder cumplir sus metas y  es por ello que ella solicita de FAPE la adquisición de un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor, le trae mas cuenta y le sale a un mejor costo esperando en DIOS que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud.
texts.en: Dúo Lomas de San Cristóbal is a two-member group comprising Juana, who is 38 years old, and Suly, who is 37 and also a mother of four. She owns a tortilla stall located in Lomas de San Cristóbal. She is a very enterprising woman and always does her best to meet her goals and dreams. She wants her children and family to have more financial resources than what she had when she was growing up. That is why she strives every day in order to achieve her goals. For this same reason she is requesting a loan from FAPE. She will use it to buy wholesale corn, which is cheaper and more profitable. She puts her faith in God that her request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy corn for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un joven campesino de 21 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee un pequeño lote de ganado bovino, adicionalmente realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará dos vacas, con esto podrá tener una mejor producción ganadera, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus animales y la leche que obtiene dde estos. 

Alejandro, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda tener su ganado en excelentes condiciones.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a young, 21 year old farmer. He is hardworking and humble, and thanks to the teachings of his parents, learned how to complete all farming work when he was a child. 

This has allowed him to achieve progress, and today he owns a small herd of cattle. Additionally, he works as a day labourer on different estates in the region, and with this he supplements his earnings in order to also look after his parents' well-being, as they fought so hard to get him ahead in life. 

With the support of this credit, he will buy two cows. With these he will be able to achieve better livestock production, thus improving his earnings when it comes time to sell his animals and the milk he gets from them. 

Alejandro, with his entrepreneurial spirit, his vigour and tenacity, wants to continue fighting to achieve his dream of having his own estate, on which he could keep his livestock in excellent condition.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows.

loans.name: José Pasiano

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad. Esmerado y luchador por su familia. Se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a la pesca artesanal, el cual es un medio de sustento y alimentación para su esposa y sus hijos.

José debido a problemas económicos en su familia no pudo estudiar, él junto a su esposa luchan día a día por salir adelante, sus dos hijos son mayores de edad y uno de ellos le apoya en la pesca. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lamina, madera, clavos para reparar su vivienda, ya que debido a las continuas lluvias ha sufrido daños, y él quiere mejorarla. Para que sus hijos y su esposa no sufran los fuertes fríos del invierno.

A futuro desea tener una fuente de ingresos muy rentable, él sabe que con la pesca continua y con un equipo de pesca propio lo conseguirá.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old. For his family, he is tenacious and painstaking in all that he does. He has dedicated almost his entire life to artisan fishing, which is a means of sustaining and feeding his wife and children. 

Due to his family's economic problems, José could not go to school. He, together with his wife, fight daily to get ahead. His two sons are of adult age, and one of them helps him with fishing. 

The loan that he is asking for is to buy laminate, wood and nails to repair his house, because it has sustained damage due to the continuous rain. He hopes to fix it so that his wife and sons don't suffer during the harsh winter cold. 

In the future he hopes to have a more profitable source of income. He knows that he will continue with fishing, and hopes to form his own team of fisherman as well.

loans.use: to buy laminate, wood and nails to repair his home.

loans.name: Norha Francedy

texts.es:
Norha es una mujer de 44 años de edad que busca a través del emprendimiento una ayuda económica que le permita mantener a sus dos hijos de 11 y 13 años de edad y su hogar los cuales se vieron muy afectados desde la separación con su esposo. 
Norha tiene una idea muy clara y es iniciar lo más rápido que pueda su empresa donde distribuirá ropa para hombre y mujer, zapatos, y accesorios para los dos sexos.
Este crédito le permitirá comprar mercancía para salir a distribuirla a familiares, conocidos y tocar puertas para vender ya que todo el peso del hogar recae sobre Norha.
Norha tiene un objetivo claro un sueño y es hacer de este negocio algo sostenible y por eso buscara no solo el éxito en sus ventas si no abriri un local comercial que es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Norha is a 44 year old woman who is looking for financial help, through entrepreneurship, that will allow her to support her two children who are eleven and thirteen years old. Her home is one of the things that has been seriously affected since the separation with her husband. 

Norha has a clear vision to start her business as quickly as she can, where she will distribute clothing for men and women, as well as shoes and accessories for both sexes. This loan will let her buy merchandise to distribute to relatives, acquaintances and to sell door-to-door, now that all the weight of the household falls on Norha. 

Norha has a main objective, a goal, which is to make this business sustainable, so she will not only be successful in her sales, but she will also open a retail store, which is her biggest dream.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing, shoes and accessories for both genders. Norha is a single mother that is looking to support her two children.

loans.name: Gloria Edith

texts.es:
Gloria de 46 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas negocio que esta instalado en su casa.; ella ya tiene mucho tiempo de elaborar este delicioso alimento y lo aprendió de su madre quien también lo realizaba. 

Ahora ella quiere emprender un nuevo negocio que siente que es muy rentable para la temporada, ella quiere instalar una venta de ropa en su casa, ya que debido a su pupuseria tiene muchos clientes que llegan a visitarle. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas para caballeros, faldas entre otros productos que es muy solicitado en su comunidad.

A futuro Gloria desea ver sus negocios surtidos, que sean rentables y con beneficios tanto para ella como para sus clientes. Desea ademas ver a sus hijos todos unos profesionales y así poder brindarles lo que ellos necesitan diariamente.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and a mother of five children whom she loves very much. She works selling pupusas and her business is set up at home. She has been making this delicious food for a long time, learning from her mother who also used to make pupusas.

Now she wants to start a new business which is very profitable during this season. She wants to set up a clothing store in her home, because thanks to her pupusas she already has lots of customers coming by her house. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy pants, blouses, men's shirts, skirts, and other products that are in very high demand within her community.

In the future Gloria would like to see her business well stocked, turning a profit, and benefitting both her and her customers. She also wants to see her children through school and to give them everything they need in order to become successful.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, men's shirts, skirts, and other products.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende diferentes tipos de mercancía como ropa y accesorios de vestir. 

Inicio el negocio hace 1 año y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar aun mas sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de invertir en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta y diferentes marcas de ropa y accesorios. 

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su almacén y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who's running on all cylinders and ready to take on the world and live a fulfilling life thanks to her hard work.

She has a store in which she sells different types of merchandise such as clothes and clothing accessories.

She started the business a year ago and in spite of the short amount of time in operation it has been well received in the area.
 
She would like to expand her inventory of products and further increase her sales by adding capital to her business. This is the reason she's requesting a loan, so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise that she currently doesn't carry as well as different brands of clothing and accessories.

She has big hopes for her store and thinks that it can improve substantially in the future thanks to the support of these organizations that make it possible for people to dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of clothes and clothing accessories to stock her store.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guatemala es reconocido por su gente trabajadora con el deseo de superación en la vida que toma las cosas como un reto en la vida para poder llegar a realizar grandes logros es el caso de María que se a tenido que ingeniar en como tener un ingreso económico par su familia ella tiene  21 años de edad soltero y tiene 2 hijos por la cual el realiza actividades artesanales para dar estudio a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales.

El trabajo que ella realiza en su comunidad donde vive es la venta y producción de productos artesanales ya que genera una ganancia económica para el sustento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y la de ella. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es jornalero en su comunidad apoyando a las personas que requieren de sus servicios pues el lo hace para tener un ingreso extra del trabajo que realiza.

El uso respectivo que ella dará el préstamo que el está realizando es para la compra de productos artesanales para luego venderlas en su comunidad y en todos sus alrededores, las metas de María en la vida es la construcción de su casa para que ella y su familia tengan una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Guatemala is known for its hardworking people with the desire to succeed in life.  They take events in life as a challenge, and they are able to achieve great things.  This is the case of Maria, who has had to devise a way to have income for her family.  She is 21 years old, single, and has two children.  She makes artisanal crafts to give her children an education so that they may become professionals.

Maria makes and sells artisanal crafts in the community where she lives.  This work generates an income to support her family and improve living conditions for herself and her family.  Her second job is that of a day laborer in her community helping people that need her services, and she does this for extra income.

She will use the loan that she is requesting to purchase artisanal products for later sale in the community and the surrounding area.  Maria’s goal in life is to build a house so that she and her family have adequate living conditions in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to purchase artesanal crafts.

loans.name: Mohamed Alieu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Mohamed Alieu.  He is married and has 5 children, aged 18, 16, 13, and 5 years (twins), 3 are school-going children. He has no additional dependent.

Mohamed Alieu owns a  business.  He earns about Le 2,050,000 every month from his business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  Mohamed Alieu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bags of rice and onions to sell. 

From his previous plans, Mohamed Alieu has bought a piece of land, but was unable to achieved his other plans.  He is now planning to develop his piece of land and expand the business.  This loan will help to generate more income and solve domestic issues.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy rice & onions to sell

loans.name: Salamatu Abass

texts.en:
This is 58-year-old Salamatu Abass.  She is married, and has 7 children, aged 39, 36, 33, 23, 15, 9 and 7 years, 4 are school going children. 

In 2000, Salamatu Abass established her local goods, cosmetics and jewelry business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,754,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Salamatu Abass has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cosmetics and other local items to sell. Her business improved greatly and had a great impact in upkeeping her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy local items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy millet, rice and wheat

loans.name: Hajar

texts.en:
Hajar is a 51-year-old married mother of eight children who works hard to support her husband and beloved family in their living, through taking good care of them and preparing for their living necessities. Hajar is a housewife. She takes good care of her house and family and provides her beloved husband a peaceful family living. 

Today, Hajar is acquiring this loan to pay school tuition for her beloved child. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

loans.use: To pay school tuition for her beloved child

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Osman.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 6 and 3 months, 1 is a school-going child. He has no additional dependents.  

Osman owns a  business where  he earns about Le 3,800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Osman has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy different sizes of foam mattresses and floor mats.  

Osman has started his building project and also expanded his shop and improved the business. Inadequate capital is his major challenge.  He is an ambitious businessman.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy mats and mattresses to sell

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Kadija.  She is single and has 2 children, aged 6 and 11 years, all are school-going children.  

Kadija owns a  business. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,900,000 every month from this business. 

Kadija would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,500,000.  She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy crates of drinks, cartons of baby oil, perfume and vaseline. She has started her building project and the business improved greatly.  She also bought a piece of land from her previous plans.  Her major challenge is low sales.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Mariama.  She is married and has 5 children aged 15, 12, 10, 7, and 4 years, 3 are school-going children.  

Mariama owns a business and earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mariama requires a loan in order to buy bags of salt rice, caustic soda, gallons of palm oil and cooking oil.  

Mariama is still on her building project, made much improvement in the business, and she is planning to complete her building.  This loan will help to improve her business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy rice, caustic soda & cooking oil

loans.name: Nuki

texts.en:
Meet Nuki. She is a housewife and lives with her husband and their two children in Cibubur, a suburban area about 30 minutes from Jakarta. To support her family, Nuki sells mobile phone airtime and services bill payments for her customers. She joined Ruma about four months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment service. 

As the business runs, Nuki hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Nuki is in front of her house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime and utility bill payment services in her community

loans.name: Adriana Lucia

texts.es:
Adriana es una joven de 19 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos pro catalogo como acolchados, almohadas, cobertores con los que espera pagarse una educación, poder comprar vivienda y muchos proyectos locos de una joven trabajadora que mantiene a su padres y prefiera emplear su tiempo trabajando que andar en casa sin hacer nada.
