Su mayor virtud es que siempre tiene que sentirse productiva  y ahora busca un impulso económico para crecer como empres ay mejorar sus ventas que aunque sabe que son muy modesta, todo gran ejecutivo inicio de 0.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos pro catalogo como los que pueden apreciar en la foto buscando su realización personal y laboral.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 19-year-old young woman who works selling products by catalog like quilts, pillows, and bedspreads. By doing this she expects to pay her way through school and to be able to buy a home. She has lots of crazy projects because she is a hardworking young woman who is supporting her parents and prefers to spend her time working than staying at home doing nothing.

Her best quality is that she always needs to feel productive, so now she is seeking a financial boost in order to expand her business and increase sales. She knows her business is very modest, but all great executives started from scratch.

She is requesting a loan to buy catalog products like the ones shown in the picture. Her goal is to move forward both personally and as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy catalog products like quilts.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Meet Lina. Lina is married and she lives with her husband and their three children in East Bandung, a regency area in West Java. Lina runs a small stall where she sells snacks, drinks, consumer daily products, mobile phone airtime, and utility bill payment services for her customers. 

Lina was introduced to PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma) by one of her friends and she quickly became interested in joining Ruma about seven months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She is excited about her new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to her community. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

In the photo, Lina is in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime and utility bill payment services in her community.

loans.name: Nunung

texts.en:
Meet Nunung. Nunung is married and she lives with her husband and their only child in Sumedang, a city located about 190 km from Jakarta. Sumedang is known for its famous tofu. 

To support her family living, Nunung runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, daily consumption products, and mobile phone airtime credits to her communities. She joined Ruma about five months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

In the photo, Nunung is in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy cell phone airtime to sell

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Isuhu, Shaibu and Losia. 

Saratu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Saratu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Saratu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Saratu said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: improve her farm business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of two children from Palompon, Leyte. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 14 years now. Fishing is a lucrative business in their area. Lilibeth is a hard-working woman, and she wants to give her best in order to support her husband.

Now Lilibeth would like a loan to buy a new fishing boat and nets. With these, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Lilibeth has hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and nets

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 31, earns a living through a fishing business. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 1. For more than 11 years now, Maricel has supported her husband in their fishing venture. 

Maricel would like to borrow a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. This will enable her and her husband to improve their fishing business. 

Maricel hopes of making their business more sustainable and productive in the near future. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy nets & repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy baby accessories to sell

loans.name: Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTOCABLES” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rita es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace dos años, al observar que este negocio sería ampliamente rentable en su zona por la escasez del mismo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de pollos por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Intocables" ("Untouchables") will begin their sixth season in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and it is run by a board of directors where Rita is the president. The members of the communal bank run various businesses, among them they sell: dishes, cell phones, chicken meat, flowers, fruit and tea service.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners where Rita is a member. She notes that it is the first time that she is joining Pro Mujer, because of an invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution. She currently has a butcher shop; she learned this business on her own initiative two years ago after noticing that this business would be profitable in her area due to the shortage.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her merchandise (to buy chickens in bulk) which she will get from the distributors in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she will sell them in her retail space. This type of work allows her to make money to support her family financially, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the consultation the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy chickens in bulk.

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en:
Matiyu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Matiyu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Simon, Musa, and Dauda. Matiyu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Matiyu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Matiyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matiyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Matiyu to generate earnings of up to USD 1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Matiyu said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children and, ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses, children's school fees, food, and  farm loan repayments.

loans.name: Reinaldo Antonio

texts.es:
Al hablar de Reinaldo se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Barbosa, Córdoba donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.

El se gana la vida con la cría, compra y venta de pollos de engorde y gallinas, tiene plena fe en su negocio y está decidido a cumplir su sueño de tener casa propia.

Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar Pollos y gallinas para su negocio.

El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.
texts.en:
Speaking with Reinaldo it becomes obvious that he is a very hardworking and helpful man and that everything he does is for his family's benefit and wellbeing. He lives in a humble home in the town of Barbosa, Córdoba, along with his wife and their four children. He has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

He earns his living raising, buying, and selling chickens and hens. He is absolutely confident in his business and is committed to meeting his goal of having his own house. He is a hardworking and determined person as well as a loving father.

He is requesting a loan to buy chickens and hens for his business. He hopes to find help in good-hearted people who believe in solidarity.

loans.use: to buy chickens and laying hens.

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer muy emprendedora y de grandes ideas que vio en un espacio de su casa la oportunidad perfecta para iniciar una venta de productos especialmente para mujeres, como lencería, ropa, accesorios etc.
Gracias a su esfuerzo, buenas estrategias Nancy pudo abrir su primer local comercial lo que la tiene muy motivada y ahora que tiene más espacio quiere solicitar un crédito para llenarlo de mercancía, comprara lencería, perfumes, accesorios, zapatos y productos para jornadas especiales de Halloween, Nancy busca mejor acogida del público y diversificar su oferta ya que tiene buen espacio y sueña con seguir progresando y expandir su negocio a otras localidad.
Apoyen a Nancy es una mujer que inicio desde 0, y ahora quiere seguir por esa senda de triunfo buscando mejores oportunidades de vida para ella y sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very enterprising woman. She always thinks big, which allowed her to see in a pace in her home the perfect opportunity to set up a business catering specifically to women. She sells lingerie, clothing, accessories, etc. From there, thanks to her hard work and good business strategy, Nancy was able to open her first store, which keeps her motivated. Now that she has more space available she wants to request a loan in order to fill it with merchandise. She will buy lingerie, fragrances, accessories, shoes, and special novelty products for Halloween.

Nancy seeks to reach more customers and diversify her products because she has ample space and wants to keep moving forward. She would also like to expand her business into other towns. 

Nancy started her business from scratch and now wants to follow this path of success looking for better life opportunities for herself and her two children.

loans.use: to buy lingerie, fragrances, clothing etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una joven que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, la cual está culminando, hoy solamente le falta la defensa de su tesis, pudo lograr su carrera con ayuda de sus familiares  y su esfuerzo.
Su meta es recibirse  y trabajar  para así poder ser una buena profesional  y así poder ejercer su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de titulación que tiene, ya que son un poco costoso y quiere poder cubrir.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman who is studying for a degree in Nursing. At the moment, the only thing she is lacking is the defense of her thesis. She is able to earn her degree as a result of the help from her family members and her own efforts.

Her goal is to be received into the profession so that she can work toward becoming a successful professional, thus allowing her to pursue this career. Ana is requesting this loan so that she can pay her existing degree expenses. These costs are a bit expensive, so she wants to be able to cover them.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru:
Точинисо местная сельская жительница района Дангара. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем, ее муж работает в школе. У них четверо сыновей, которым по 27, 26, 20 и 15 лет. Старший сын работает на стройке, второй сын работает в столице, третий сын работает трудовым мигрантом в России, а самый младший сын еще школьник. Сама Точинисо животновод. Она занимается выращиванием коров и быков на протяжении 7 лет. Точинисо продолжает ремесло матери. Она очень любит домашних животных и поэтому тоже выбрала эту профессию.    
Сейчас Точинисо намеревается увеличить поголовье своих скотов, так как зимой цены на скот повышаются. Таким образом она хочет увеличить доходность бизнеса и за счет него улучшить условия быта. Точинисо нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
Tojiniso is 48, married, and lives in the rural Dangara region. Her husband works at a school and they have four sons, ages 27, 26, 20, and 15. Their oldest son works in construction, the second works in the capital, the third is a migrant worker in Russia, and the youngest is still in school. Tojiniso raises livestock. She has been raising cows and bulls for seven years, continuing her mother's business. She loves animals very much and that is why she chose this profession. 

Now Tojiniso intends to increase her livestock headcount because the price of cattle increases in the winter. She wants to make her business more profitable and improve her living conditions. Tojiniso needs your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase her livestock numbers

loans.name: Gulinor

texts.ru: Гулинор всегда старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж таксист и имеет маленький доход. Это доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Гулинор решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием пшеницы, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки семена пшеницы, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulinor always tries to improve her family's living conditions and economic status. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns a small income, but it is not enough to take care of the family's basic needs. Gulinor decided to help her husband for the good of the family, so she enrolled in the "Achieve Success!" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate. Now she wants to start a successful business growing wheat, since she has experience in this area. She will use the profits from her business to give her children a good education and buy high-calorie foods. She is applying for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy wheat seed and start a new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy wheat seed and start a new business.

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru: Хусниддин родился в  1975 году. Он живёт в кишлаке Сугдиён  Шахристанского района. Хусниддин  женат и имеет троих детей. Он начал сотрудничать с Арванд с   2013 года. Хусниддин занимается ремесленничеством.  А также он занимается скотоводством. Чтобы принести в семью дополнительный доход он хочет купить скот на откармливание.  Так как у него не хватает средств, он обратился в организацию за кредитом. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Husniddin was born in 1975 and lives in a village in the Sugdiyon Shahriston district. He is married and has three children. He began working with Arvand in 2013. He is a craftsman who also raises cattle. He wants to earn extra money for his family by buying cattle to fatten. Since he does not have enough money, he turned to Arvand for a loan. He is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three daughters and a son. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for the last 10 years to earn a living with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She is in her ninth loan cycle and has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc. This monetary help can take Noreen closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc.

loans.name: Shreefan

texts.en:
Shreefan is a 56-year-old married woman. For the past 13 years, she has been involved in the business of selling bedsheets, covers and spreads. She purchases different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Shreefan is in her fourth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase a new collection of bedcovers and spreads to inflate her sales and earn a good amount of revenue for meeting her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of bedcovers and spreads.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 58-year-old widow woman who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, does sewing and then sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy a greater variety of cloth, needles, spools of thread and beads in various colors to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Naseem's seventh loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth, needles, spools of thread and beads in various colors

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla,  es un oficio digno de admirar el que mujeres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de mujeres campesinas dedicadas al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. De 45 años de edad soltera con cinco hijos que sustentar dos de ellos ya tienen familias separadas y los tres últimos son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que Isabel realiza es la siembra de maíz, tomillo y frijol para luego venderlas  en el mercado de su comunidad, para poder obtener un ingreso económico para ella y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida. Ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 20 años y la ha generado buenas ganancias 

El uso respectivo que ella le dará el crédito es para la compra de  fertilizantes para mejorar las producciones de sus cultivos y así poder tener una condición de vida adecuada para ella y su familia. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de Isabela es la siembra de 4 cuerdas de maíz para poder realizar ventas muchas más grandes con las que ahora realiza y tener un ingreso económico para la reparación de su casa y dar estudios a sus hijos y que sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
She works the soil with the sun beating down on her, and yet is willing to sweat every day to provide a better future for her children. The land has been blessed by hands that enjoy working with it and caring for it, it's an admirable profession that women have put years and entire lives into. Without the labor of farm women dedicated to working it, the land wouldn't bear the fruits that have supported every generation. She's 45 years old, single, and has five children. Two of them have their own separate families and the younger three are students at a local school.

The work that Isabel does is planting corn, beans, and thyme to subsequently sell them at the local market to obtain income for she and her family to improve their quality of life. She has been doing said work for 20 years and it has generated good profits.

She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers to boost her crop production so she and her family can have satisfactory living conditions. One of Isabela's biggest dreams is to plant 4 units of corn so that she can sell much more than she does now, and that way have income to fix her house and pay for her children's schooling so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: Compra de  fertilizantes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To support her newly established farm through buying a cow

loans.name: Dúo Amanecer De Peronia Group

texts.es: Dúo Amanecer de Peronia, este grupo esta formado por la señora Tomasa de 28 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de trajes tipicos desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica para la venta, esperando que le puedan dar la oportunidad del credito solicitado ya que solo asi ella podra aumentar un poco mas su ganacia y por consiquiente sus ganancias.
texts.en: Tomasa is 28 years old and part of the Dúo Amanecer de Peronia (Sunrise of Peronia Duo) group. For several years she has earned a living selling traditional outfits and is taking this opportunity to ask for a loan to buy traditional clothing to sell. She hopes to be granted this loan, as this is the only way she will be able to increase her profits and, as a result, her earnings.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jonlhing Lom Group

texts.en:
Jonlhing group members are strong women who work very hard for their own cause. They have formed this group to strive for their own financial independence by promoting their businesses through loans. 

Hoineilhing is the featured borrower of the group, pictured with her hand raised. She is a courageous woman who looks after her four school-going children alone as her husband serves in the army. “Our family meets once a year, only when my husband is home for the holidays and those are the happiest days for our family,” she said. 

Hoineilhing runs a grocery shop to earn income in her village situated in the hills that is very far from Imphal town. There are about 65 households in their village and most of them are engaged in agricultural activities as their main occupation. Hoineilhing buys stocks of items needed for her shop from the nearest town and earn a small profit by selling them in her village. The profit she makes is spent for her children's school fees and other household expenditures. Apart from that, her husband also sends her money to meet the household requirements but the amount barely meets their needs. 

Since her household expenditure increases, Hoineilhing cannot afford to buy inventory for selling anymore and her shop is on the verge of closing down. She aspires to revive her shop by buying more inventory of groceries to sell. She is excited and happy to access this loan to revive her business. With the Kiva loan she will buy inventory for her shop and start over with more items in the shop. 

Hoineilhing wishes good luck to the lenders who are willing to support her in times of her hardship by reviving her grocery shop. She says, “Thank you is the only thing I can give to the lenders.” The rest of the group members are engaged in livestock, piggery, shifting cultivation, banana farms and petty shops.

loans.use: To buy groceries including candles, matches, sugar, tea leaves, biscuits, soap, detergent powder, etc. to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO RENACER” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lizeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta e comida, taller de soldadura, tapizado de autos, venta de batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares, tejido de chompas de alpaca, venta de leche, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lizeth es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de busos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga, que comercializaba el mismo producto, con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra lana por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “New Rebirth” communal bank has begun its 6th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II Focal Center. The bank is composed of eight members and is managed by a Board of Directors with Mrs. Lizeth as President. The members' businesses vary greatly; among them, selling food, operating a soldering shop, upholstering cars, and selling batter, cell phone covers, alpaca yarn for sweaters, and milk, and offering transportation services.

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small entreprenuers of the bank where Lizeth is a member. She has belonged to Pro Mujer for some three years now, having joined at the invitation of a friend who is also a client of the institution. At present, Lizeth operates a business that makes and sells wool coats. Lizeth learned the business from her friend who sold the same product. With the passage of time, she decided to undertake this business independently.

The loan that she requests is to augment her merchandise, buying wool at wholesale, which she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. Then, she will make and sell her goods at her sales booth. This type of work allows her to generate resources to aid her family economically, since she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lizeth replied that she likes the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: buy wool at wholesale for knitting coats to sell.

loans.name: Holanda Soledad

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Holanda, tiene 72 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y de esta relación tuvo cinco hijos mayores de edad. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en un centro artesanal de la ciudad.
Doña Holanda con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa,  trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que siempre le llevan sus trabajos, ella también elabora ropa que luego pone a la venta en su mismo taller, en temporadas elabora uniformes de colegios y escuelas del lugar en esta época trabaja hasta muy tarde en la noche. Lleva más de 50 años con esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In a parish in Montecristi, the Communal Bank “Para El Futuro De La Mujer” (For the Future of the Woman) meets every 15 days. This place is well-known for its rich traditional culture and the wide variety of handicrafts that are made by its residents.

Sra. Holanda lives in this place. She is 72 years old and her husband died several years ago. She has five grown children. Several years ago, Holanda learned sewing and dressmaking at a craft center in the city.

In order to generate her own income, Doña Holanda took advantage of her knowledge of sewing and dressmaking by setting up a small workshop in her house. There she produces all types of clothing. She works by accepting orders from specific individuals who are always bringing her something to do. Holanda also makes clothes that she will display for sale from her shop. On a seasonal basis, she produces uniforms for local high schools and elementary schools. During those times, she works late into the evening. Holanda has been in this business for more than 50 years and it has enabled her children to get ahead.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics and other materials for sewing. Holanda has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help. Her dreams include staying in good health.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Mwanamvita

texts.en:
Mwanamvita is a married woman and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Mwanamvita is requesting KES 50,000 to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat to boost her kiosk. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Luz Eneida

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera que vive sola y puede mantenerse gracias a su negocio de venta de comidas que tiene ubicado en las calles del sector de bello.
Luz muy soñadora y risueña siempre busca oportunidades para mejorar su servicio, como lo son diversificar su oferta y crear cercanías con los clientes ya que solo tiene su negocio para subsistir por tal razón lo asiste diariamente 8 horas.
Luz siempre ha querido comprarse una casa y por eso cada día guarda una moneda que simbólicamente representa un ladrillo para su casa y quiere mejorar sus ventas para ver más cerca este sueño por tal razón solicita un crédito que invertirá primeramente en algunas mejoras a su puesto de comida que necesita y lo otro lo invertirá en trigo, carne, v verduras, etc. Para realizar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Luz is a 31 year old woman, she is single and lives alone and is able to support herself thanks to her food selling business which she runs in the streets of the Bello area.

Luz is a cheerful and visionary person, she is always looking for opportunities to improve her service, like diversifying her products and getting closer to her customers. As she has only her business to survive on, she works 8 hours a day every day.

Luz has always wanted to buy a house, and for that day she keeps a coin that symbolically represents a brick for her house. She wishes to improve her sales to bring her dream closer, and for this reason she is asking for a loan to invest primarily in various necessary improvements to her food stall. She will invest the rest in wheat, meat and vegetables etc. to make her foods.

loans.use: to make alterations to her food cart and to buy ingredients to prepare her meals. Luz is a single women who seeks to buy a home of her own.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, están cursando el 5to Año en la carrera de Notariado, su meta es recibirse y trabajar en actividad relacionada a su carrera.
Su sueño es ayudar a sus padres económicamente por que son personas de escasos recursos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, ya que le será de mucha ayuda y le permitirá seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Paraguarí. He is currently in his fifth year of study in order to become a notary. His goal is to be received into the profession and do work that is related to his degree.

Juan’s dream is to help his parents financially because they have limited resources. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay the fees for his degree. This will be a great help since he will be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for his degree.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 15 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 35-year-old married woman and has six children. She is motivated to provide them with good food and education. She is running a business of cattle sale and purchase, with the help of her husband. She is responsible for looking after the cattle and her husband sells the cattle in different markets. 

Her goal in life is to continue to progress and to do this she wants to strengthen her business's worth. So to be able to run the business in a more sustainable way, and to become more competitive, Iqbal needs a loan of 45,000 PKR. It will allow her to buy more animals for resale purposes. Iqbal has had four loans with an excellent record of payment. She promises to continue to pay on time so that the lenders continue to place their confidence in her. She is hopeful to use this amount in a productive manner.

loans.use: to buy more animals for resale purposes.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis un hombre de 63 años que a partir de sonrisas y un excelente producto sabe atraer clientes, pues el carisma de este hombre crea un impacto muy positivo entre sus compradores, se dedica al negocio de tienda general, actividad que inicio como respuesta económica ante las necesidades que presentaba su hogar con su esposa y dos hijos y ya por su edad no podía encontrar donde emplearse. 
Aprovechando su carisma Luis opto por montar su empresa y le ha ido bien pero siempre que le puede ir mejor pues no tiene capital para invertir y siempre se queda estancado en lo mismo y la idea de ser emprendedor es superarse a sí mismo por tal razón solicita un crédito que la corporación interactuar está dispuesto a desembolsar pues cree en los proyectos de este hombre. 
Con la ayuda del crédito Luis podrá diversificar su oferta pues traer más productos como víveres, variedad en granos, pastas, y productos de aseo. 
Su sueño es que su tienda se mantiene con el tiempo y que esta le brinde todos los recursos para tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Luis is a 63-year-old man who, in addition to smiles and excellent products, knows how to attract customers. This man's charisma has a very positive impact on his customers. He makes a living at his general store, which he started out of necessity in order to support his wife and two children when he could not find a job due to his age. Taking advantage of his charisma, Luis decided to open his business and it is going well; of course, it could always be better.

He does not have the capital to invest and he is always at a standstill. The purpose of being an entrepreneur is to improve oneself, so he has requested a loan that Interactuar is ready to disburse because they believe in his projects.

With the loan, Luis will be able to diversify his products by bringing in more products like provisions, a variety of grains, pastas, and cleaning products. His dream is to bring his store up to date and to have enough resources to be calm in his old age.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like provisions, grains, and cleaning products, to diversify his products, and bring his store up to date.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and together with her spouse,  has been blessed with seven grown children between 40 and 23 years old.

Margaret runs a general goods store, which she has run for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. Margaret has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy general goods for her store.

With the anticipated profits, Margaret will be able to repay her loan and get more stock. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to secure a plot of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy general goods for the store

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs (soccer balls) for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to cover the expenses of her family members. She is contributing a lot to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to cover the needs of his family members. 

Najma is a motivated mother of three. She is responsible to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity to cater to more customers without delay and earn a good amount of income to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity to cater to more customers

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 48-year-old married woman, who lives in a small village called Chitatskari. She has only a school-aged daughter and the family earns a living with a trading business. In particular, Nona trades flowers, which she buys at wholesale prices and sells in the local market at increased prices. She has her own customers, which are locals and passersby as well. However, the income is not enough for Nona and her daughter to reach financial stability. 

So, Nona requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to expand her trading business but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Now, Nona's loan request has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Nona plans to purchase stock of linens to sell in her community at good prices. Her income will significantly increase thanks to Kiva lenders. So, Nona and her daughter rely on the goodwill of lenders and they will highly appreciate your support.

loans.use: to start a business trading linens to generate more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets for some rental houses she is building.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a supply of fabrics for his store.

loans.name: Shrifan

texts.en:
Shrifan, age 50, is a married woman who deals in the business of selling animals in her locality. She has seven children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Currently she applies for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for reselling in the market.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Sololá está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. Entre esos grupos se encuentra María de 33 años de edad, ella realiza un enorme esfuerzo para sostener a su familia, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes sueños en la vida.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de verduras, ella eligió dicha actividad porque le genera ingresos económico para su familia, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante nueve años y lo aprendió de su mama, a ella le gusta realizar esta actividad porque por medio de ello a mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia y también la de su comunidad. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la siembra de cebollas en un terreno que tiene disponibles cerca de su casa donde ella vive.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de verduras y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus siembras para obtener buenas cosechas y mejorar sus ventas en el mercado de su comunidad con buenas cosechas. La aspiración de ella es agrandar su negocio y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It's a very hot day, and the main market in Sololá is full of people coming and going, some buying and others selling. Hope dances between the two groups. Among these groups we find María, 33 years old, who makes an enormous effort to sustain her family. She has 4 children, who are all studying in the local school. She is an enterprising woman with big dreams in life.

She works buying and selling vegetables, an activity she chose because it generates a big economic income for her family. She has been doing this for nine years and learned the trade from her mother. She likes this work because through this she has improved both her family's living conditions and those of her community. Her second job is growing onions in some land nearby her house.

She will use the loan to buy vegetables and fertilizers to be able to improve her crops and obtain better harvests, and to improve her sales in the local market with these good harvests. Her aspiration is to enlarge her business and to build houses for her children so that they can have adequate living standards.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fertilizers.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a happily married woman. Six years ago, she decided to support her family by stitching clothes at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Asia is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, Asia has requested a loan of PKR 45,000. She is in her fourth loan cycle. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material such as threads of different colours, laces, zippers and cloth. She hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material such as threads of different colours, laces, zippers and cloth.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom, age 32, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques, les six membres du groupe Djèkafo ont en moyenne 42 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Hamdallaye. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (bazins) de meilleures qualités, des friperies, la restauration et charbon du bois. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maïmouna  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits (bazins) meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20m de bazins en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Hamdallaye en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Maïmouna  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djèkafo group are married and live in both monogamous and polygamous households. They are on average 42 years old with an average of 2 children each.

The women all live in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and came to know each other through neighbors and their various small businesses in Hamdallaye.

The members of the group sell high quality clothing (brocade cloth), used clothing, restaurant supplies, and firewood. In order to increase their business capital, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Maïmouna (the woman pictured on the far right of the photo) is a successful seller of high quality clothing. She plans to use her loan to purchase 20m of brocade cloth wholesale in Bamako. She will resell it at retail in Hamdallaye, door to door, to a customer base made up mostly of women. 

Maïmouna plans to earn, with this loan, an average monthly income of 95,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to meet the daily needs of her household.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Las Rositas De Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSITAS DE FORTALEZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papas fritas, venta de chicharrones, tejido de aguayos, venta de ropa usada, taller de costura de overoles, venta de ropa de bebe, servicio de transporte, venta de ligas y guantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felisa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitar a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de papas fritas y chacharrones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, ya que le ayudaba en su negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceite y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Rositas de Fortaleza" will begin its first loan wit Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata focal center. It is made up of 8 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Felisa is the president. The members run various businesses like french fry sales, chicharrones sales, cloth weaving, used clothing sales, overall sewing, children's clothing sales, transportation services, and glove sales. 

The loan will benefit small businesses like Felisa's. This is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of one of the institution's promoters who visited her at her home. She currently has a business making and selling french fries and chicharrones. She learned this business from her mother many years ago and, since she helped at her family's business, she decided to start her own business.

This loan is to increase her capital and she will purchase potatoes and oil in bulk from sellers in La Paz, then make her products, then sell them to her customers. Her job allows her to generate income to support her family; she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the office, the training, and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase oil and potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is a 43-year-old woman married to Pius, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with two children.  Benedetta has been a livestock farmer for a period of five years earning herself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Benedetta is now servicing her first loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy cattle feed.

Benedetta plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and to be able to further their education to higher levels. She hopes to have growth in her business and live a stable life.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 30-year-old man married to Susan who adds additional income to support the family and they are blessed with two children.  Benjamin has been a livestock farmer for a period of 10 years earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.
 
Benjamin was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a friend and is now taking his first loan of KES 20,000. He intends to use the entire amount to buy animals feed.

Benjamin plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to open a butcher shop business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a entertainment  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP  through NWTF to purchase additional units of sound and wire for her entertainment  business.

Myrna has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from a restaurant.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional units of sound and wire

loans.name: Ivio

texts.es:
Ivio con 51 años de edad, es soltero y padre de 4 hijos. 

Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Hace un año, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comprar y vender cerdos, pues los obtiene, los cría, engorda y al momento de la venderlos los ofrece a un precio más alto, debido al peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones para engordarlos y venderlos, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, Ivio espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica para darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de una mejor educación y tener buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ivio is 51 years old, single, and is a father of 4 children.

During his working life he has done a variety of activities independently, with which he has generated income for supporting his family. A year ago he began working in the buying and selling of pigs. He acquires them, raises them, fattens them and then sells them for a higher price due to the animal's increased weight. This allows him to obtain income to continue caring for and supporting his children.

The borrower is a hardworking, determined man who is motivated by his family to make an effort every day to get ahead. This is what drove him to request a loan, to invest it in the purchase of pigs and piglets to fatten and sell them. That way he'll have sufficient stock to fulfill the orders he's received and improve his profit margin and income.

This is how Ivio hopes to take another step forward towards achieving his biggest dream, making his business official and setting up a meat distributor that would be profitable and long-lasting so he could have financial stability and provide his children with a better education and good living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and piglets to fatten and sell them.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 33-year-old married woman from the village of Tkemlovani. She has three children and a husband, who generates income from private activity as an artisan. 

Manana is a hard worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs, especially their children's educations. Manana works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and vegetables. The harvested products are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no significant income and live in poverty.  According to the above mentioned situation, Manana lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business.

The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2000 GEL for purchasing a milk cow and cattle.  After that, the family will start producing dairy products, cheese and yogurt, to sell. They also use the milk products for family feeding. 

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products availableion the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and cattle in order to expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Cruz María tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su compañero de hogar Su actividad principal es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar y también se dedica a la caficultura.
Doña Cruz María lo que vende en su negocio es: azúcar, arroz, manteca, salsa, margarina,  refrescos, etc. cuenta con más de 3 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad tiene una buena clientela siendo estos personas de la misma aldea y comunidades aledañas ya que su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio.
Doña Cruz María espera que el préstamo le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos, su sueños es tener bien surtido su negocio permitiéndole tener mayor clientela y mejorar las condiciones de vida.


Trojes, Honduras -  Octubre del  2014
texts.en:
Cruz María is 42 years old and lives with her partner. Her main work is selling staple goods but she also works growing coffee.

At her business, Cruz sells sugar, rice, butter, margarine, sauces, soft drinks and other items. She has been doing this work for three years. She has a good customer base from the village where the shop is located. The business is in a very strategic, commercial area.

Cruz hopes that this loan will give her business more stock, which will allow her to increase her income and cover family and other expenses. Cruz's dream is to have her shop well stocked, giving her more customers and allowing her to improve her living conditions.

Trojes, Honduras; October 2014

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, butter, margarine, sauces, soft drinks and more for her business.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Myra works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and chickens. Myra is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fish net for her fishing business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional an bundle of fish net

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 54 years old, married, and has four children.  She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nancy has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nancy has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Nancy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs, and additional piglets.

loans.name: Keny Johana

texts.es:
Keny es una mujer de 31 años de edad madre de dos hijos, responsable, talentosa, con una gran sonrisa, que se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas en un local que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar. 
Buscando mejorar su oferta y destacarse entre la competencia Keny quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en dos Pasivos muy importantes que son un congelador para ofrecer bebidas frías a sus clientes, y mesas y sillas para que puedan sentarse, el resto del crédito lo invertirá en surtido para realizar sus comidas. 
Keny pone todas sus esperanzas en este crédito y es que los clientes ya presentan quejas sugiriéndole que tenga bebidas frías y un lugar donde ellos puedan consumir sus productos y está la razón de la importancia del crédito para una mujer que no dispone del capital para realizar la inversión de su bolsillo.
texts.en: Keny is a 31 year old mother of two children. She's responsible, talented, has a great smile, and works in selling fast food at a location that she set up with a lot of hard work. With the goal of improving her product and standing out amidst the competition, Keny wants to request a loan that she'll invest in two very important assets, namely a refrigerator for selling cold beverages to her customers and tables and chairs so that they can sit down. The rest of the loan would be invested in purchasing ingredients to prepare the meals. Keny has put all of her hope in this loan and it's because customers have already complained and suggested that she stock cold beverages and a place for them to consume her products. This is why the loan is important to a woman that doesn't have the capital to make this investment out-of-pocket.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerators, tables, and chairs by request of her customers who want cold beverages and a place to eat their food.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz es una comerciante de productos de catálogo de la marca Avon, actividad con la que ha podido criar, alimentar, brindar educación a sus dos hijas de 19 y 20 años de edad, aprendió este negocio gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres quienes fueran también comerciantes y ahora sus hijas también se dedican a esta profesión algo que tienen en las venas. 
Luz atendiendo a las sugerencias de sus hijas quienes la motivaron a iniciar con la comercialización de ropa para hombre y mujer quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar variedad de líneas tanto para dama como para hombre y junto con sus hijas constituir una micro-empresa donde las tres trataran de abarcar la mayor parte de público y solo las frena la falta de capital para iniciar con sus proyectos que buscan un objetivo en común y es comprar una casa para vivir.
texts.en:
Luz sells Avon products via catalog, a job that has allowed her to raise, feed, and provide an education to her two daughters ages 19 and 20 years old.  She learned this business thanks to lessons from her parents, who were also business people, and now her daughters also work in business, something that they have in their veins. 

Luz is following the suggestions of her daughters, who have motivated her to begin selling men's and women's clothing.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a variety of women's and men's clothing lines. Together with her daughters she is creating a micro-business, and between the three they will try to reach the majority of the public. The only thing holding them back is the lack of capital in order to begin their projects. They also have a common goal, which is to buy a house in which to live.

loans.use: To purchase a line of men's and women's clothing, which will allow her to work with her daughters and to eventually buy a home.

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
Diversificar la oferta de productos, sostenibilidad de negocio, incrementar la utilidad, aumentar sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas, son  las expectativas que María se ha podido crear gracias a un crédito que la corporación Interactuar donde podrá realizar una ampliación a su carrito de comidas, donde tendrá ms espacio para iniciar otras líneas de venta como perros y hamburguesas.
María es una mujer de 54 años de edad, felizmente casada y con dos hijos ya mayores de edad. María adopto esta actividad por necesidad económica y solo espera que este crédito la impulse para vender más y pensar en abrir su propio local.
texts.en:
With her loan, Maria would like to diversify the products that she offers, increase her business's sustainability, increase usefulness, increase customers, and increase her sales. Thanks to a loan from Interactuar, she will be able to expand her food cart and have more space to add products like hot dogs and hamburgers.

Maria is a 54-year-old woman, is happily married, and has two adult children. Maria started her business out of economic necessity and hopes that this loan provides a boost to her business so that she can sell more and possibly open up her own store.

loans.use: to expand her food cart to offer hamburgers and hot dogs without neglecting the rest of the fast food that she offers.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria cuenta con una experiencia de 20 años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 15 años. 

Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller genera 2 empleos para personas con muchas necesidades. 

Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la producción es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en grandes pedidos. 

Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Maria requiere de un préstamo para comprar insumos como tela, hilos y agujas para tener disponible su mercancía a sus clientes.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a su esposo y su  hijo.
texts.en:
Maria has been working in the sewing business for more than 20 years. She has had a sewing workshop in her home for the past 15 years. She works hard all day and provides jobs for two disadvantaged people. She learned how to sew from her mother at a very young age. Her advantage is that she is very well-known in her area and her products are very good. This has allowed her to continue to obtain more customers for her business and it has also resulted in large orders.

Because her production capabilities are not currently enough to complete all of her customers' orders, Maria requires a loan to purchase supplies like thread, fabric, and needles so that she can have merchandise available for her customers.

Her greatest wish is to move forward with her sewing workshop and to have more financial opportunities to progress with her husband and their son.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies like thread and fabric.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is a 54-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been doing a business buying and selling cattle for the past 16 years. She supports and assists her husband in his work. She is responsible for taking care of the cattle. They purchase cattle from the local market at a low price and then sell them in another market. They currently have two cows and two buffaloes. They also sell milk to generate extra income.

Hanifan is in her fifth loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market to increase revenue. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market to increase revenue

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente  de 54 años de edad quien vive en Sololá, casado con 10 hijos. Quien se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra como campesino por muchos años pues es el único oficio que le genera ingresos económicos, los primeros 4 hijos de Vicente ya tienen vida independiente y los 6 últimos hijos son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos de Vicente pues es la actividad que el realiza y le gusta  trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación.

El motivo de la realización de su  préstamo es para la compra de terreno ya que desde un tiempo ha venido trabajando por ello para poder cultivar la tierra sin pagarle a otra persona por usar sus tierras como lo ha vendió haciendo.

Las metas de el es pagar sus deudas con que el cuenta y en un futuro comprar más terrenos para sus hijos e brindarles educación a sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Vicente lives in Sololá, is married and has ten children. He has worked the land as a peasant for many years; this trade has earned him an income. Vicente's four eldest children are now independent adults while the youngest six are still attending the local school.

Vicente has blessed that land that he works as he likes to look after it. This is a decent job that men do for many years or throughout their lives. Without men working on it, the land will not give the fruits that support another generation.

Vicente is applying for this loan in order to buy the land that he has been working for some time. He wants to buy it so as not to pay rent to another person, as he has been doing.

Vicente's goals are to pay his debts and, in the future, buy more land for his children. He also wants to give his children an education so that they may live in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GUADALUPE DE SENKATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas de tejido a mano, venta de salchipapas, carnicería, costura de polleras y macramé, venta de DVD’s, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitar a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde trabajada de empleada, con un poco de ahorros decide abrir su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Guadalupe of Senkata" will begin its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer.  As part of the downtown of Senkata, the group is composed of eight members and is directed by a board of which Rosa is the President.  The businesses that members run are varied, including the following: Sale of hand-knit sweaters, sale of meals like "salchipapas" (sausage and potato dish); butcher shop; sewing shop for traditional Peruvian dresses and macramé; sales of DVD's; Construction services. 

The loan will be used to support micro businesses like the one that Rosa runs.  She notes that this is her first loan with Pro Mujer, and she joined based on the invitation from an institutional recruiter who visited her in her home.  Currently she has a business making and selling sweaters.  She recounts that she learned this business from a previous job, where she worked as an employee.  With a bit of savings she decided to open her own independent business. 

The loan that she will take out is for increasing capital (purchasing wool in bulk) which she will acquire from sellers in the city of La Paz and then later use to make sweaters for sale upon request from customers.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is single. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the consultations, the trainings, and the loans that the organization offers.

loans.use: To purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Tucked away in the countryside near the Litein area of Kenya, is a jobless man-turned farmer named John and his family of three lovely children. He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. In Litein area there are people who in their totality constitute wrenching statistics. Hardcore poverty pervades every homestead, yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible.  Armed with this conviction, John has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past seven years. 

John currently has maize and bean crops as well as two dairy cows. He sells his milk to his neighbors and sells his harvest at the local market. John is a humble and hardworking man. In spite of the obstacles that he meets, he is always willing to try to get ahead. John is applying for his loan to buy a dairy cow. With another cow he can increase production and therefore his sales income. Through his work, John wants to continue fighting for his dream of expanding his milk business. This will allow him to earn a higher income for his family, and to give his children the opportunity to have a better education and improve his well being.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to retail for her rice retailing business.

Mylene has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from fishing and pig-fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 55 years old, married, and has four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Nelita has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing and selling rice.

Nelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nyesi

texts.en:
Nyesi is a forty-year-old divorced woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She sells cassava flour, a business she does as her main source of income to get money to educate her children. Nyesi has a dream of educating her children and expanding her business. Limited capital is her challenge. 

She is a hard-working woman and wants money to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: At the age of 58, Mussarat is a widow.  She deals in a business selling goats to support her family members.  She is successfully running a business to provide them a decent life. She buys baby goats at low prices, and after raising them a year or two, she sells them out in their locality.  Now she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales to fulfill her dream, to provide her children with the basic necessities of life including food, health, and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales.

loans.name: Janeth Liliana

texts.es:
Janeth es una madre d dos hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad, a los cuales les ha llenado la cabeza con ilusiones de oportunidades de estudios universitarios y día a día trabaja para mantener viva esa ilusión en ello pues está muy orgullosa de que quieran estudiar y ser alguien en la vida. 
Para apoyarlos en sus proyectos Janeth vende productos de uso personal como perfumes, desodorantes, talcos, crema dental etc. Etc.
Junto con su esposo se ha trazado la meta de comprar una casa propia y dejar de pagar arriendo para vivir más tranquilos y dejar algo a sus hijos es por eso que Janeth quiere mejorar sus ventas, ampliando su oferta a sus clientes y trabajando 12 horas diarias por tal razón solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía de uso personal en general.
texts.en: Janeth is a mother of two children ages 18 and 17, who dream of opportunities to attend college and so she works every day to keep those dreams alive. She's very proud of their desire to study and to be somebody in life. To support their aspirations Janeth sells toiletries such as perfumes, deodorants, powders, tooth paste, etc. Together with her husband she has set a goal of buying a home so that they can stop paying rent and live more comfortably, and so she can have something to leave to her children. This is why Janeth wants to improve her sales, by expanding the stock of items on sale and working 12 hours a day. For this reason she's requesting a loan to purchase general toiletry merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase deodorants, perfumes, tooth paste, powder, and toiletry merchandise in general

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Yabu

texts.en:
Yabu is married and has one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Yabu dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Anonymous
