texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 18 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  posee desde hace 1 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman pictured, whose face has been pixelated because she is 18 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has had a small store at her place of residence for a year.  She has many customers because of her good prices and the kindness she has when making sales.  The young girl lives in her own house with her mother.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc., so as to earn more of an income and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Los Ángeles” está  conformado por 13 socios optimistas y dinámicos. Miryam de 32 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Hace más de 01 año que Miryam se desempeña como ama de casa. Así mismo como actividad secundaria viene implementando su negocio de comida. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, pollo, huevo y carne de res. Su mayor deseo es de terminar implementar su negocio de comida. El grupo “Los Ángeles” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Miryam es la cuarta del lado derecho, viste casaca azul y polo color verde.
texts.en:
The group "Los Ángeles" [The Angels] is made of 13 optimistic and dynamic members.  32-year-old Miryam is separated with two dependent children.  Miryam has been working as a stay-at-home-mom for over a year.  As a secondary occupation, she is implementing her restaurant.  That is why she requested a loan to buy rice, chicken, eggs, and beef.  Her greatest dream is to finish implementing her food business.  

The "Los Ángeles" group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the assistance they provide.  In the photo, Miryam is the fourth on the right, wearing a blue jacket and a green shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, eggs, and beef.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, five of whom are in school, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Nenita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
As a  parent of two children, Monica works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Monica is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Monica has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 32-year-old, married woman.  She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames etc. it will allow her to earn maximum income, and provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames etc to earn more income and provide a quality education for her children.

loans.name: Alida Maria

texts.es:
Alida es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas rápidas que ella misma prepara.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus 2 hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Alida solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de surtido de ingredientes para sus preparaciones.
 
Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir su sueño de otorgar una buena educación a su hijo.

Con tu ayuda Alida Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Alida's a very enterprising and persistent woman with big hopes that she has been cultivating and trying to accomplish.  She has a small business selling fast food that she herself prepares.  With this job she tries to get ahead every day and improve her family's living conditions.  Her son and her two children are the driving force of her life and her motivation to strive every day.

Her biggest difficulty is competition in the field, but with her great capacity for working she's capable of supporting herself and making progress.

Alida's requesting a loan to buy a supply of ingredients for her dishes.

With this help, she'll be able to fulfill her dream of giving her son a good education.  With your help, Alida will be able to pay for her son's education, one of her biggest dreams!

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
	
For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Shaher  Bano

texts.en:
Shaher Bano is a 40-year-old married woman; she has been manufacturing footballs for many years to contribute to the family income. 

She offers various types of footballs in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy good quality leather covers, spools of thread, and needles to increase her sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality leather covers, spools of thread, and needles to increase her sales.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 54-year-old married woman, and a mother of six children. Azra is a humble and hardworking woman who has spent a large part of her life caring for her children. She wants to provide them a standard living and to make them good citizens. For the past 13 years, she has been running a business of animal sales and purchases along with her husband. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. 

Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Azra has requested for a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to buy more animals for resale purposes to generate more revenue. In this way her business will move forward, and she will be able to offer a good income to her home, so that they can continue having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old and married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is thankful to Kiva because she managed to buy cassava, which has also increased her profits. Beatrice is faced with the challenges of limited capital and competition. However, she is a hardworking woman with a dream of expanding her business and owning a milling machine. Beatrice needs money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dominga is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

Dominga has been in this business for one year. In the future, Dominga would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Guia

texts.en:
Guia is 46 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Guia has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 28-year-old, married woman. She started her animal business along with her husband to provide a better standard of living. She has been doing this for the past three years. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

They want to expand the business and need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, but the greatest obstacle is to have sufficient capital to increase her sales and obtain better earnings. Therefore, Asma has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy more animals for resale purposes to grow her income. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more animals to sell.

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Magreth, who is in her late 30s, is single with two daughters. One of them is still in school and the other one is a grown-up. Magreth has been a food vendor since 2005. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Magreth's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her "mama lishe" (food vendor) stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy food ingredients for her "mama lishe" business. She dreams of building her own house.

Magreth will share this loan with her loan group, "Ari Mpya," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her "mama lishe" business

loans.name: Delma Maria

texts.es:
La señora Delma  tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su esposo en una aldea de Trojes al oriente de Honduras su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar y cuenta con más de 4 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad.
Doña Delma tiene una buena clientela siendo estos vecinos de la misma aldea y comunidades aledañas esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, arroz, manteca, leche, pollo, mortadela, refresco, etc. espera que le contribuya a tener  un mejor surtido en su negocio.
Doña Delma su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Trojes, Honduras -  Octubre 2014
texts.en:
Delma is 40 and mother to 3 children. She lives with her husband in a village in Trojes in the west of
Honduras. She has worked selling basic family goods for more than 4 years.

Delma has a good clientele, namely, the neighbours from her village and nearby communities. She is asking for a loan to buy items such as sugar, rice, butter, milk, chicken, mortadella sausage and snacks. She hopes that this will her to stock her business better.

Delma's dream is to give a good professional education to her children and to improve their living conditions.

Trojes, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, rice, butter, milk, chicken, mortadella sausage and snacks for her business.

loans.name: Junnaday

texts.en:
Junnaday is a married woman and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Junnaday is 36 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Junnaday has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Junnaday has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nora has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her buy-and-sell charcoal business for 5 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Nora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
“When people come together, they are powerful,” says Peter, a 36-year-old farmer who has one angel-looking  child and lives in the village of Mageche in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. 

As a young boy, he watched women in his village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led him to join Marindi self-help group. 

For the past three years he has been actively involved in mixed farming. He never got the chance to get a white collar job but this has not been a setback. He has been practicing crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. 

Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Peter is very visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: The sunny person in this picture is Lusine. She lives in the Zorakert village of Shirak Marz. She is 42 years old and has 19 years of experience as a teacher in the village school. She is well respected among her colleagues, as well as among the villagers. She has a husband and 10-year-old son, of whom she is very proud. Every time she looks into his eyes, she sees a joyful and happy future. Their family is hard-working and very respectable. All the difficulties and hardships of rural life they overcome together. They have numerous livestock, and they wish to purchase forage for feeding them in the coming winter.

loans.use: to buy forage

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman and has been blessed with two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees. 

Joyce has operated a fish-selling business for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Joyce dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff of maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanaisha dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 36 year old man married to Jane who adds additional income to support their family. Together, they are blessed with four children.  Charles has been operating as a livestock farmer for a period of six years and earns an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.
 
Charles was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now taking his first loan of KES 20,000. He intends to use this amount to buy additional goats and sheep to sell to his customers.

Charles plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional goats and sheep to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 53 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Marlyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Patria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Patria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Patria has been sustaining her business activities through her past (one) loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. Yolanda is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc.

Yolanda has been in this business for six years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes needs a loan to add more stock such as soap and cooking oil to sell. She is a retailer and at the same time does farming, growing mainly bananas. 

She faces the challenges of high competition, although she has a vision of having enough capital to educate her children to higher levels of learning. 

Agnes used her previous loan to add items such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to add  more items such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Dismus

texts.en:
Dismus used the previous loan to buy tea seedlings for planting. He is a renowned farmer growing tea and rearing cattle. 

He faces challenges of low income and unpredictable weather changes, especially hail stones. Besides that, he dreams of building on his plot a commercial house that will generate him more income. 

Dismus has asked for a loan to expand his  tea plantation.

loans.use: to expand his  tea plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Kitebero Model Group

texts.en:
Aidah is 30 years old and is a member of the group. She lives in the outskirts of Mbarara town. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a self-employed plumber who sells plumbing materials and installs them.

Aidah has been a tailor since 2007 and has managed to survive off the tailoring business since then. She specializes mostly in ladies' fashions. She has been helping her husband with household obligations.

Before joining the group, business for her was low. This was because she did not have enough capital to buy materials to meet demand. She also lacked business management skills that she obtained from the training offered at Ugafode. After receiving her first loan, Aidah was able to double her revenue. With her savings she also purchased another sewing machine for her business and this has enabled her to achieve better efficiency and effectiveness.

With the Kiva loan, she hopes to get more materials and an assistant, so she can take on bigger jobs as her business expands. She wishes to one day have her own house where she can live with her family.

The gentleman seated is the group chairperson who has a running loan also but is not taking a loan this cycle. He signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to purchase materials and hire an assistant for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies from the family shopping basket to get ahead

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris is a hard working married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in coffee and banana farming as his main source of income. Moris started this business to improve on his general welfare. He faces the challenges of seasonal changes and coffee wilting. 

Moris is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm. He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 66 year old hardworking woman. She is married to Pius who adds additional income to support their family and together, they are blessed with eight children. Grace has been a farmer for a period of ten years earning herself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Grace is now servicing her third loan of KES 10,000 and intends to use the entire amount to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

Grace plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es:
Gladys es una señora de 36 años, vive junto a sus dos hijas en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad con un clima cálido húmedo agradable; sector conocido en Ecuador por ser el puente terrestre que une a la sierra y costa, además porque en ella habita la etnia Tsachila.
Gladys todas las tardes sale a vender sus asaditos en un sector estratégico junto a canchas, es muy conocida ya que lleva en el sector cuatro años, prepara carne, molleja, cueritos asados, tienen una sazón única por ello cuenta con buena clientela. 
Gladys se acercó a Fundación Alternativa para solicitar un crédito, con este crédito podrá comprar un congelador para tener las gaseosas frías, un activo que tanto le hacía falta.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year old woman who lives with her two daughters in Santo Domingo de los Colorados.  The city has a pleasantly warm and humid climate.  The area is known in Ecuador for being the earthen bridge that connects the mountains to the coast.  In addition, it is where the Tsachila people live.
Every afternoon Gladys sells her barbecue in a strategic area near the playing fields.  She is well-known in the area, as she has been selling there for four years.  She barbecues meat, gizzards and pig skins.  Her food has a flavor all its own, which is why she has a good clientele. 
Gladys approached Fundación Alternativa about requesting a loan.  With the loan, she will be able to purchase a refrigerator to keep her sodas cold; it's something she has really been needing.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep her beverages cold.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing. 

Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to  buy additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald used his previous loan to buy more cattle for fattening, which enabled him to realize more profits. He deals in motor vehicle transport where he earns a living, although he also carries out farming and cattle fattening to earn an extra income. He started this business to generate funds and to satisfy his family’s needs. He has hardships of poor roads, diseases and inadequate capital. However, he hopes to expand his business and to construct a good residential house in the future. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Tulibamu Kyakamese Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She grows maize, beans and bananas to sell and for home consumption. She is a single mother and is taking care of four children. 

Rosemary desires to modernize her farmland, and establish another family business from which she can raise money to educate her children as a loving mother. However, she is challenged by weather vagaries and a poor transport network.

Rosemary needs a loan to weed and to buy pesticides. She is a member of Tulibamu Kyakamese Group, in which the members act as guarantors for each other to get a loan.

loans.use: to weed and buy pesticides.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 28-year-old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop where he earns a living, although he also carries out farming and motorcycle transportation for extra income. He started these businesses to meet his family's increasing demands. He has hardships of price fluctuations, although he hopes to expand his business and to construct a permanent house. He is requesting a loan to buy items for his shop like soap, sugar, salt and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy items to sell from his shop like soap, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Marni

texts.en:
Marni is married, and she lives with her husband and their two children in South Tangerang, a city located to the south of Jakarta. To support her family, Marni sells mobile phone airtime. 

Marni joined Ruma about three years ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited to expand her new business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on a weekly basis. In the photo, Marni is in front of her house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Blanca Elvira

texts.es:
Blanca es una feliz madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, y aunque ellos le ayudan y aportan en su sostenimiento, ella siente que debe trabajar y progresar para salir adelante por sus propios medios.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como ropa y accesorios, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de sus hijos.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un vitrina para exhibir sus productos, también comprara surtido de productos como ropa y otros accesorios, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca's the happy mother of three adult children.  Even though they help her and contribute to her support, she feels she must work and improve so she can get ahead on her own.  She found selling merchandise such as clothing and accessories to be a way to earn a good income alongside her children.

Now she's starting with a small amount of capital.  She's in the process of acquiring customers, so she's requesting a loan to buy a display case to show her products.  She'll also buy a supply of clothing and other accessories wholesale to stock her small business with quality products.

The loan will help Blanca be able to give her business a boost: She'll have a better variety of products to sell and be able to strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale to sell

loans.name: Florecita

texts.en:
Florecita is 59 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, noodles, egg, etc.

Florecita has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Florecita aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 41 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Janet has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Janet aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

Susan has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Susan aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
The farmer in the picture is Norayr from Goghovit village, Shirak region.  He lives with his wife and two sons, who greatly help him with farming activities. Norayr's farm, which he has been running since he was young boy, includes livestock and cultivation of wheat. The livestock particularly includes cows, calves, sheep and hens. Norayr sells the gathered agricultural products locally and earns income for his family's living. Norayr also owns agro machinery, which he uses during the cultivation season.

By applying for this loan, Noray asks lenders to support him because it is important to purchase forage for feeding the livestock (1000 packages). The loan will greatly help this farmer to maintain his livestock during the winter season, so he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers; and by that, I mean [those] people who make a living off of the land; and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Jackline, a 37-year-old mixed farmer based in Kutus, a remote village in Kerugoya area of Kenya. Jackline has a husband, and at home they have one child. For the last 20 years, Jackline has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, rice planting, eggs and vegetables. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Jackline to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. 

Jackline is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production and thus, increase sales volume. Jackline needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a sixty three year old, hard-working, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in farming as his main source of income alongside motorcycle transport. He started this business to improve his family's standards of living and educate his children. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes and inadequate capital, however he has a vision of becoming a prominent business man.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Rofel

texts.en:
Rofel is 37 years old and married with four children who are in school.  Rofel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Rofel has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Rofel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ana Libia

texts.es:
24 años son los que lleva la señora Ana como independiente, comenzó en los años 80 con una modesta venta de alimentos y hoy por hoy tiene un restaurante muy tradicional en el sector pues tiene mucho tiempo de funcionamiento. 
Ana es madre de 4 hijos, y a sus 59 años pudo encontrar su amor vive con su pareja con la que atiende el restaurante y han identificado falencia como lo es, competitividad en el mercado pues hay varios restaurantes con gran capital en la zona, esto podría afectar su sostenibilidad en el tiempo, mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus clientes y para ello quieren solicitar un crédito para la compra de nevera, vitrina y surtido mejorando el aspecto del negocio y trayendo nuevos platos, está es la apuesta de Ana que seguirá trabajando y dejara todo en manos de destino. 
Apoyen a esta microempresaria que solo cuenta con su restaurante para vivir, decidió ser independiente y ahora no cuenta con una pensión que le ayude en tiempos difíciles, si desapareciera su empresa teme por su futuro ya que no tiene nada más.
texts.en:
Ana has worked independently for 24 years.  She started in the 80s with a modest food store, and now she has a very traditional restaurant in the area that she has operated for a long time.

Ana's the mother of four children, and at 59 years of age she has managed to find her love.  She lives with her companion, with whom she runs the restaurant.  They have identified a shortcoming, competition in the market, because there are several restaurants in the area that have a lot of capital.  This could affect her sustainability over time to improve their sales and expand their clientele.

For that reason, she wants to request a loan to buy a refrigerator, a display case, and stock to improve the appearance of the business and introduce new dishes.  

Ana is hoping for this.  She'll continue to work and leave everything in the hands of fate.

Support this micro-entrepreneur who has only her restaurant to live.  She decided to be independent, and now she doesn't have a pension to help her in hard times.  She fears for the future if she should lose her restaurant, because she has nothing else.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, display cases, and stock for her restaurant, which is threatened by strong competition

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos medicinales naturales para la salud.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘carretera a Viacha’, sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y porque es una avenida de gran tránsito que conecta a varias localidades.
Elizabeth es de tez morena, cabello largo color castaño, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y también habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hija que estudia en la escuela y viven en una casa que cuenta con los servicios de luz, agua y gas. El negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud, sus inicios fueron como vendedora minorista, actualmente es vendedora mayorista y desde hace ocho meses que alquila una tienda para la exposición de los productos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa en dos años de experiencia en el negocio.  Actualmente cuenta con vendedoras que distribuyen las medicinas por mayor, su tienda cuenta con escasos muebles y necesita una vitrina para exponer su mercadería. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y convertirse en líder en la venta y distribución de productos medicinales naturales para la salud.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles para exposición y ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 43-year-old woman. She is single and has a 12-year-old daughter. Her business is selling natural medicinal health products. She is independent, enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. She works in the "highway to Viacha" zone, a place characterized by businesses in every area because it is a heavily-traveled avenue that connects several towns.

Elizabeth has brown skin and long chestnut-colored hair, and she is of medium height. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her daughter, who is a student at school, and they live in a house that has electricity, water, and gas service. The business is selling natural health products. She began as a retail seller. Currently she is a wholesale seller and for the last eight months she has rented a store to exhibit the products. This is the first loan cycle in two years of experience with the business. Currently she has saleswomen who distribute the medicines wholesale. Her store has few pieces of furniture and she needs a display case to exhibit her merchandise. Her goal is to expand her business and become a leader in sales and distribution of natural medicinal health products.

These are the reasons why Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy furniture to exhibit and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy furniture to exhibit and expand her business

loans.name: Coshgun

texts.en: Coshgun is 30 years old. He is married and has a daughter. The family members have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city for 22 years and now live in Seyidmahmudli village in the Füzuli region. Coshgun has been in the animal breeding busines for three years. He buys little cattle, raises them and then sells them in the local bazar to live on. Coshgun wants to develop his business so he needs 1200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more cows. Coshgun is thankful for this aid from the Kiva organization, Komak company and the lenders. In the future, he wants to produce dairy products and sell them.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more copra (dried coconut meat).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and married with six children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 10 years and earns additional income from her general store.

Vilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 38 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Tek Phos district of Kampong Chhnang province. She has four dependent children. 

Farming rice and raising pigs are the primary sources of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 10 years. With her business, San  currently earns approximately 11 USD per day, out of which she is able to keep about 5 USD for future needs. 

This is San's first micro loan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy a solar panel to power lighting in her house. She hopes to make better livings conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel to provide lighting in her house.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Thida is 45 years old and lives with her husband and six daughters in a rural village of the Tek Phos district. 

Rice farming and raising buffalo are the main source of income for her family.  She has been in this business for 18 years. The business currently earns her about 12$ per day. 

This is the first loan for Thida with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes to have it for lighting in her family home.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acquire equipment, a building permit, and signage

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар простая жительница маленького городка под названием Дангара. Ей 38 лет. Она замужняя женщина. Дилбар с мужем растет пятерых детей. У них четверо сыновей и одна 16 летняя дочь. Сыновьям по 18, 14, 11 и 3 года. Дилбар много времени уделяла воспитанию детей, и ее муж не отстает от жены и старается обеспечить детей всем необходимым. Обеспечить пятерых детей нелегко и поэтому Дилбар тоже начала работать, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить дом. Она занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров, как и ее муж. Дилбар нравиться работать в сфере торговли, и она хочет развить свой бизнес, увеличить товарооборот и расширить точку продажи, с такими планами Дилбар обратилась за кредитом. На заемные средства она купит светильники, провода, рабочие инструменты и т.д. Дилбар верит, что с дополнительными средствами она сможет принести в дом больше дохода и дать образования детям.
texts.en:
Dilbar is a regular resident of the small town called Dangara. She is 38 years old and married. Dilbar and her husband are raising five children. They have four sons and one 16 year old daughter. The sons are 18, 14, 11 and 3. Dilbar has spent a lot of time on raising the children, and her husband is not far behind her, and always strives to provide the children with everything necessary. 

To support five children is not easy, and therefore Dilbar also started working, in order to help her husband provide a home for them. Dilbar works with selling household products, as does her husband. She likes her working with retail sales, and she would like to develop her business, increase the turnover and expand her sales point, buying lamps, wires, tools, etc.

With these plans, Dilbar applied for a loan. She believes that the additional resources will enable her to bring a larger income to their home and provide the children with education.

loans.use: to buy lamps, wires, tools, etc.

loans.name: Bibisharifa

texts.ru: Бибишарифа замужняя женщина в возрасте 41 года. Бибишарифа с дочерью живет на районе Кубадиён. Ее муж и сын находятся заграницей. Бибишарифа хочет заняться продажей миндаля. Она уже имеет определенное место для продажи и договарилась с оптовыми продавцами. Бибишарифа для начала купит 200 кг миндаля для такого бизнеса это мало, но она будет начинать с малого, чтобы добиться больших успехов. Для кпили миндаля ей не хватает средств и Бибишарифа надеется на получения кредита, и тем самым начнет бизнес. Она уверена, что благодаря кредиту она сразу купит товар и приступит к работе. Бибишарифа надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Bibisharifa is a married woman of 41 who lives with her daughter in the Qubadiyon region. Her husband and son are working abroad. She wants to sell almonds. She already has a retail space and an agreement with wholesale sellers. To start, she will buy 200 kg of almonds, which isn't much for this kind of business, but she will start with a little in order to achieve greater successes.

Bibisharifa doesn't have enough money to buy the almonds and so she hopes for this loan so she can start her business. She is sure that thanks to this loan she will immediately buy the goods and start working. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy almonds for resale

loans.name: Los Alamos De La Estacion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilma ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Los Alamos de la Estacion.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to the LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION communal bank. This bank is located in Urcos district, which is part of Quispicanchis province and Cusco department.

The member is Hilma, she is partnered and is 36 years old and has 3 children. She works in her business which is a grocery store. She sells staple products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM. She has been in this business for 10 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She asks for the loan to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The borrowers that are added to the group photo took their photos after the meeting because they got excused from being there for work reasons.

The member whose face is covered with a circle is no longer a member of hte Los Alamos de la Estacion communal bank.  
 
The other members work in a business selling clothes, a business selling cakes, a grocery store business and a restaurant business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Cadolina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cadolina works hard to support her family.

She has a purified drinking water sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Cadolina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Cadolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 52 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Susie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for seven years and  earns additional income from buying and selling food supplements.

Susie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Abdolia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 17 children, Abdolia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a welding shop.  Abdolia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

Abdolia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Winny

texts.en: Winny, 24, is a small-holder farmer who resides in the Litein area of Kenya. The mother of two has been a farmer for four years. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk and a side business. Winny finds farming to be very enjoyable. However, as she is aging, she is finding dairy farming to be challenging. She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business since the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Winny is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Winny is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GIRASOL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soledad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: Taller de costura, venta de papas fritas, venta de bañadores, venta de salchipapas, taller mecánico, servicio de té, salón de belleza, pastelería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soledad es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugo de quinua; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar en el mercado el amplio comercio de este producto, es por ello que decide emprenderlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de quinua por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Girasol" ["Sunflower"] communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes central hub. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board, of which Soledad is the President. The communal bank's members have a variety of businesses, among them dressmaking, selling fried potatoes, selling bathing suits, selling salchipapas (sausages and fried potatoes), mechanic workshop, tea service, beauty salon, and pastry shop.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microbusinesswomen, of which Soledad is one. She indicates that this is her first year as a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a customer of the institution. Currently she has a business selling quinoa juice; she says that she started this business upon observing that this product was widely sold. That is why she decided to start it.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wholesale quinoa) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and after preparing it she will sell it at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family economically, since she lives with her partner and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale quinoa

loans.name: Sadelyn

texts.en:
Sadelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. Sadelyn earns more income from a general store and fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Sadelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase varieties of synthetic hair and hair products for resale

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 19 years old and single with children.  With her children in school, Cristine works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries, etc. 

She has been in this business for 2 years. Christine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel  Ahmed is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Daniel Ahmed joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Victor, Vincent and Ketura. 

Daniel  Ahmed is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Daniel  Ahmed expects to reap up to 30 bags per hectare of maize, which is double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel Ahmed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel  Ahmed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Daniel  Ahmed to generate earnings of up to $1,000 per hectare, which is more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Daniel  Ahmed said, “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty."

loans.use: meet urgent expenses such as child school fees, food costs and  farm loan repayment, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices and increasing his income by up to 37%.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past thirteen years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, son luchadoras y sobre todo muy luchadoras, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona aun en crecimiento y que está luchando por mejorar.
La Sra. Amada es una de la integrante, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas de Ropas de manera ambulante y también se dedica en obstetricia, es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora.  
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias para poder venderlas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Ella es un ejemplo de lucha y esmero, ya que quiere salir adelante y crecer. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
This group is in the seventh cycle of the Comité de Mujeres [Women's Committee] program. They are hard-working women and especially tenacious. They are from the city of Curuguaty, a zone still growing and struggling for improvement.

Amada is one of the group members. She has a small business selling clothes as a street vendor. She also works offering maternity support services.

She is requesting this loan to buy various clothing items to continue with her sales.

She is an example of determination and diligence, she wants to get ahead and grow. Her dream to is continue working and to provide for her family meeting all their needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing items to sell.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Roque” está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2  de las 18 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco más.
Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de verduras que está haciendo esta pudiendo mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Es una persona muy entusiasmada y que quiere seguir creciendo, es por eso que se viene esforzando cada día más.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras frescas para la venta, ya que eso le facilitará mucho más para poder continuar. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, y que con ello podrá tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The San Roque group is taking the elimination of poverty survey.  Two of the 18 women are below the poverty line.  Teresa, one of the members, came out at a level one of poverty.  That means that she needs to put forth a little more effort.

Through her effort and continual work, and through her vegetable sales, she is improving her living conditions.  She is a very enthusiastic person, and she wants to keep growing.  That is why she is putting forth more effort every day.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy fresh vegetables to sell.  This will help her a lot in order to be able to continue.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting.  With this opportunity she will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheeting, pillars, iron, etc., in order to repair and expand the covered walkway, and cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Jeffry

texts.es: Jeffry es un joven de 25 años, esposo y padre, el perdió su trabajo hace unos meses y desde entonces no ha podido conseguir otro. Sin embargo tiene las ganas y el deseo de superación, por lo que junta a su esposa tienen pensado establecer una pequeña tiende de ropa para empezar a recibir ganacias.  Necesita un préstamo de quinientos cincuenta mil colones para comprar la mercadería necesaria para empezar su negocio.  Con esto pretende junto a su esposa lograr los ingresos necesarios para alimentar a su familia.
texts.en: Jeffrey is a young man, 25 years old, husband and father. He lost his job a few months ago, and since then has not been able to find another. However, he has the drive and the desire for self improvement, that's why together with his wife, they have in mind to establish a small cothing store to begin to receieve profits. He needs a loan of 550,000 CRC to buy the merchandise necessary to start his business. With this he hopes, together with his wife, to get the income necessary to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his clothing store

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Nata'Ala, Kyauta and Basira. Haruna is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Haruna expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Haruna to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Haruna said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: To store his corn crop and sell later, increasing his income by up to 37%.

loans.name: Nerilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nerilyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig raising.  

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. Now, Nerilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, palm oil and beans to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer lives alone in Haykavan village, Armavir region. She is a widow and her two daughters are married and live separately with their families. 
Varditer, an accountant by profession, works in the local village school. Besides that work, Varditer is engaged in agriculture. She runs a farm, which includes cows, calves, and sheep and cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. Varditer likes her farming business and takes care of her farm with great love and pleasure.
 
She has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel needed for land cultivation. Varditer hopes for lenders' support for her farm.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de mucha experiencia, carisma y gran sentido del humor.
Es madre de 5 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como arepas, empanadas, buñuelos, pasteles entre otros que ella misma prepara en su casa. 

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 11:00 Am para tener sus productos listos y frescos para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar insumos para su producción de arepas y otros alimentos, además de comprar una pipeta y una plancha para cocinar.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda y buen corazón de las personas para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman with much experience, charisma and a good sense of humor. She is the mother of five children and has worked practically her entire life to raise them. 

She has a small business selling food such as arepas (flatbread made of ground maize), empanadas (fritters stuffed with meat or potatoes), cheese fritters, and pasteles (rice cakes mixed with meat, vegetables and other ingredients) which she makes at home by herself. She works every day from 5:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m. to have her food ready and fresh for her customers who are mostly people who live in her neighborhood. 

Gloria wants to add capital to her business so she can buy a large supply of ingredients and have a good inventory of products. She is asking for a loan so she can buy supplies to make arepas and other foods. She will also buy a propane tank and a grill for cooking. One of her main difficulties is the lack of money to invest in her business, but she is relying on the help and good heart of people to move her business forward.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her recipes, a propane tank and a grill for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 100% natural products, her goal is to lift herself out of poverty.

loans.name: Kurbonoy

texts.ru: Курбоной жизнерадостная женщина 54 лет. Она вдова и имеет 3-х детей. Сама Курбоной живет со своими детьми в сельской местности. У нее нет высшего образования. Чтобы зарабатывать на пропитание Курбоной работает швеёй. Курбоной шьет платья для женщин, свадебные платья для невест, а также курпача и спальное белье. От данного дела она получает хороший доход.  Она берет заказы на дому, чтобы одновременно и работать заниматься домашним хозяйством.  Сейчас Курбоной хочет купить материал для продвижения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Курбоной заранее благодарит нашу организацию за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Kurbonoy is a cheerful woman of 54. She is a widow and has three children, with whom she lives in a rural area. She doesn't have a higher education and earns a living as a seamstress. She sews women's dresses and wedding dresses as well as kurpacha (a local style of mattress) and bedding, and receives a good income from this work. She fulfills orders from her home so that she can work and take care of household chores at the same time.

Kurbonoy currently wants to purchase fabric in order to continue her business. Therefore she has turned to Arvand for a loan. She thanks the organization in advance for the support and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Aychur

texts.ru:
Айчур 57 лет. Она вдова и живет вместе с детьми и внуком в селе района Яван. У Айчур двое дочерей в возрасте 30 и 28 лет, и сын, которому 19 лет. Внуку исполнилось 5 лет. Сын и одна дочь работают в России. А другая дочь дома занимается шитьем. Айчур по натуре выносливая, трудолюбивая женщина. Четыре года назад она начала животноводческий бизнес. Айчур занимается выращиванием коров, бычков и овец. Дочь также помогает ей в деятельности. В данный момент Айчур нуждается в кредите. Она хочет запастись кормом для скотов на зиму, а также приобрести пару мелкорогатых скотин.
В будущем за счет прибыли с деятельности Айчур хочет починить крышу дома и расширить свой скотный двор.
Ваша поддержка ей очень важна!
texts.en:
Aychur is 57 and a widow. She lives with her children and grandson in a village in the Yavan region. She has two daughters aged 30 and 28 and a 19-year-old son. Her grandson is five. Her son and one daughter are working in Russia and the other daughter works at home as a seamstress. By nature Aychur is a sturdy, hardworking woman. Four years ago she started a business in animal husbandry. She raises cows, steers and sheep. Her daughter also helps her with the business. 

Aychur currently needs a loan as she wants to stock up on livestock feed for the winter and to acquire a pair of animals. In the future, with profits from her business, she wants to repair the roof of her house and expand her livestock yard. Your support is very important to her!

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son jefas de familia, que se unieron para que a través del trabajo unido puedan ir mejorando sus vidas. Ellas están en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zunilda.
Ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo montar. Se abrió camino con mucho esmero y hoy tiene muchos clientes fieles que van a su negocio.
Zunilda es muy buena peluquera y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y cumpliendo con ello.
Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group comprises 17 women who are the heads of their households. They joined forces so that they would be able to continue improving their lives by working together. They are in the Elimination of Poverty Program, of which Señora Zunilda is a member.

She has a small beauty salon that she was able to open through great effort and sacrifice.  She made a start with great effort, and now she has many faithful clients who visit her business.

Zunilda is a very good hair stylist.  She says that she is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase supplies for her beauty salon, as this is how she will be able to continue with her work as she has been, and carry it out fully.

All of the women are thankful for receiving the opportunity to be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase various supplies for her hair salon.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: Don José labora como taxista medio por el que mantiene a su familia, su esposa no trabaja ya que viene enfrentando problemas de salud de hace mucho tiempo, solamente él es el sustento de la familia y su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para que puedan tener sus propios ingresos, José solicita el crédito para mejorar su vivienda pues desea instalar cerámica en el piso para mejorar su apariencia y así brindar a sus hijos mejores condiciones en el hogar.
texts.en:
José works as a taxi driver, which is how he supports his family. His wife does not work now that she is dealing with health problems she has had for a long time. He is the only provider for the family, and his greatest desire is that his children finish school so that they can earn their own incomes.

José requests the loan so he can improve his home. He wants to install a ceramic floor, which will improve its appearance and improve the home’s condition for his children.

loans.use: to install a ceramic floor, which will improve its appearance and improve the home’s condition for his children.

loans.name: Yeraldine Keila

texts.es:
Yeraldine es una joven muy emprendedora y entusiasta, estudió la carrera de Biología y actualmente labora en diversos fundos y laboratorios donde realiza actividades relacionadas a su profesión. Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, por ellos lucha día a día para poder brindarles todo lo mejor del mundo. En sus tiempos libres le gusta hacer manualidades para relajarse y distraerse.
Yeraldine está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá empezar con los trámites para obtener su Bachiller en Biología y próximamente su Título Profesional, con esto ella pretende convertirse en una profesional exitosa y empezar a estudiar una Maestría.
texts.en:
Yeraldine is a very enterprising young woman. She studied for a biology degree and now works in diverse farms and laboratories where she does jobs related to her profession. Her greatest motivation in life is her family; for them, she fights day to day to be able to provide them all the best in the world. In her free time, she likes to make crafts to relax and entertain herself. 

Yeraldine is very grateful for the Kiva microloans because with the support that they have provided her, she will be able to start with the steps to obtain her bachelor's in biology and next her professional title. With this she hopes to become a successful professional and start to study for a master's.

loans.use: to follow the steps to obtain her bachelor's in biology

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Rowena is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stock of fish to sell. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is 50 years old and married. He has two children, one of whom is in school.

He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gerardo is borrowing 45,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Gerardo has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling balut (duck eggs).

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream, to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Lolita has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Tatiana Marcela

texts.es:
Tatiana es una mujer casada, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 4 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00.  

Tatiana sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco y ha intentado mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tatiana is married and is a hard-working, responsible woman. She worked with her family in various businesses where she gained experience in sales. Four years ago she started a grocery store on her own and works from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00. She dreams of having a supermarket in the future.

For now, the loan she has requested will be used to buy a large variety of products such as greens, grains, fruits, vegetables, etc. at wholesale and offer her clients items of excellent quality. This business has allowed her to slowly get ahead and she has tried to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a supply of groceries and grains for her store.

loans.name: Abanabumwi Womens Group

texts.en:
Joy, whose hand is raised, is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman who strives hard to see that her family gets the basic necessities of life. 

She operates a retail shop that is stocked with general merchandise. From this business, she ensures that her five children go to school. Price fluctuations and bad debtors are her key challenges to her business.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soap, salt, books, and rice, among other items for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Lucas Evaristo

texts.es:
Lucas de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta 6 grado esta acompañado y su pareja a los labores del hogar, tienen 4 hijos que viven con ellos, de los cuales 3 están estudiando y uno le ayuda a trabajar.

Lucas se dedica a trabajar de albañil desde hace 30, lo aprendió desde muy niño ademas trabaja en la agricultura, que lo aprendió de sus padres , también trabajo con ganado de repasto lo que le genera un ingreso económico adicional, lucas se levanta muy temprano a ordeñar las vacas luego se traslada 4 kilómetros en motocicleta para poder llegar a donde esta trabajando y sale a las 4:00 pm regresa a su casa para terminar el día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto que un termino de  un año tiene resultado positivos.


Los sueños de Lucas son darles el estudio que él no tuvo a sus hijos, ademas de tener una vivienda digna para darle una mejor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
46-year-old Lucas studied until sixth grade. He is accompanied by his wife in the household chores. They have four children who live with them, of which three are studying and one helps him to work. 

Lucas has worked as a bricklayer for 30 years. He learned it when he was a child. He also works in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. He also worked with pasture livestock, which has earned him a small additional income. Lucas gets up very early to milk the cows. Then he travels four kilometers on motorcycle to be able to arrive where he is working, and he leaves at 4 pm and returns to his house to finish the day. 

The loan that he's asking is to be able to buy pasture livestock that at the end of one year will have positive results.
